Well, that's it.Overall I'd highly recommend for you to watch this movie, that is if you want to see a great romantic drama that's also a musical. I really enjoyed watching this film and I think you will too, and that's why I rate Moulin Rouge! an (8.7/10).

After watching "Moulin Rouge!" for an hour, I was forced to walk away from this emetic as I became quite afraid that someone at the candy counter had slipped some LSD into my Cola.  I have never used drugs in my life, but thanks to this abomination, I now have a good idea of what it must be like to experience an horrendous hallucinatory 'trip'.This so-called picture is an insult to the "Moulin Rouge" in Paris, a slap in the face to the French, and an affront to every filmmaker - past or present - in possession of even minimal intelligence and sensibilities.

Review title: If this movie moved you, stop seeing movies all together!!!!
Review_body: This film was visually stunning and was shot in a unique style. Unfortunately this isn't a painting and a film can't be given a A just for how it looks on the outside.  Just like the new Planet of the Apes, this film was nice to look at but I just wanted to hit the mute button so many times during my viewing.  Truly a ghastly film and if it wins best picture over...well anything it would be time to do some national soul searching concerning what kinds of crap we're giving anyone with the first name Baz to make films.

I cannot stop watching this movie. It gives me chills. Ewan McGregor is an amazingly talented actor and singer, as is Nicole Kidman. Watching this movie makes me wish I could have been a part of it. It has so much feeling and so many emotions.

The single worst movie ever made, and for good reason: none of the plot was original, at all. You want a dying courtesan caught in a love triangle? Try the opera Madama Butterfly, or the hit musical Miss Saigon. You want a heroine dying of consumption in a bohemian atmosphere in Paris? There's this opera called La Boheme I highly recommend. The cabaret singer who falls for the poor writer? Watch the movie/musical Cabaret. The entrepreneur who toys with the affections of his starlet? The black-and-white classic Twentieth Century with John Barrymore will suffice. And not only is it the most derivative movie ever made, the acting was ridiculously bad. Ewan McGregor's crying when Nicole Kidman died actually made me laugh out loud. Sounded more like he was struggling with a hairball. And Kidman can't touch Liza Minelli as the singer in Cabaret. That this pitiful excuse for a movie is even considered to be in Oscar competition with such a staggering, incredible cinematic achievement as Lord of the Rings is a travesty.

Review title: They could as well write some music for this musical
Review_body: This film develops along a plot that is as cliche, naive and predictable as is cinematographically possible, with most secondary characters bordering on the ridiculous ( Lautrec's ghost should sue the producers ). And that's not all - Ewan McGregor is the British equivalent to Keanu Reeves, totally uninteresting to watch, his expression of emotions and complexities coming out completely forced and shallow ( and singing worst than the average guy on the street ). But anyway, none of it should matter since this is after all a musical, right ?  Well, it is here that things really fall apart. The idea of transforming well known tunes to songs for the Moulin Rouge proves funny on occasion, but generally the songs are worst than the original tunes and there is absolutely no worthwhile original music for the viewer to associate with the movie. No tune to whistle back home or remember the next day's morning. The camera work is mostly awful - it moves so fast in the club scenes that one is never left with any images of dancing or with any rythm, just a mixture of sounds, colours and movement that supposedly provides for the "crazy" atmosphere, I guess, but comes out tiresome and boring.So we have a musical that is not funny but mostly annoyingly ridiculous, the music leaves us with no impression and no dance to watch and enjoy ( apart for the Spanish dance scene which is rather indifferent ). Then, of course, there is Nicole - she is gorgeous, sings surprisingly well and acts wonderfully, but all in the wrong movie I'm afraid.

Review title: Unbelievably fantastic I have seen this film over 30 times
Review_body: The costumes were breathtaking, all of the actors were adorable, I actually felt the romance and fell in love right along with the lovers. The music was the best part.  I was so captivated by Ewan McGregor's voice that I kept running back to see this film over and over.  Nicole Kidman was more beautiful than ever and her voice!  I was very impressed with all of the music, the actors, the setting, and the fun I had watching this movie. I loved every minute of it. Although I have seen this movie more than 30 times, each time was still fresh. It touched me very deeply.  I can't wait to see it again.

Review title: What a show off!! I've watched it again and again and again...
Review_body: This movie is a celebration!! A spectacular show of colour and music, with amazing fast-track editing, out-of-this-world scene design, and a wonderful cast of talented support roles. I must admit - when the movie came out, I had no intentions of ever seeing it. I was sure it would not be my cup of tea. But oh! how wrong I was!! From it's first cinematic line the movie takes you thtough a fantastic journey of cabaret and nostalgia. It is sweet, queer, and funny. Kidman is full of wit and shine, and in all - it is the most glamorous film I've seen in quite a long time. It seems to be made by people who love anything about the cinema - for people who love everything about the cinema. Enjoy!!!

I loved this movie, i never saw it at the movies, (BIG MISTAKE), but i have purchased the dvd. I have watched it at least half a dozen times, without leaving the room. I have to admit i didn't want to see it, i thought it would be a cheap movie(prostitutes), but it was terrific. The acting, singing, sets, etc. all excellent. I even have the audio, which i play all the time, my friends are tired of listening to me sing(I sound terrible). Go rent this movie. A must see.

Review title: One of the worst films I have ever seen
Review_body: The critical acclaim for this abomination boggles my mind.  The casting is atrocious (fresh-scrubbed Nicole Kidman as the sensual, consumptive Satine?), the deliberate anachronisms (the Sound of Music?  Elton John?) are a pathetic and woefully inadequate substitute for creativity, and the singing stinks.  What's to like?

Review title: Not my cup of Earl Grey
Review_body: This film is an exercise in excess. Visually, it's like a gourmet meal that just keeps coming and coming and coming, long after you're full to bursting and writhing in digestive agony. Zoom in to the window, zoom out from the window, zoom in again, zoom out again...So much red velvet and crepe you begin to pray for a touch of green. Most of the songs fit into the movie the way Rush Limbaugh fits in at an NSync concert. The principals can sing in a highly tutored, competent sort of way, but don't exactly bring Judy Garland or Gene Kelly to mind. Nothing about this movie really had any effect on me. I couldn't care less about the characters or their love story. It seemed to be trying to be "Shakespeare in Love", "Titanic", and a bit of "Monty Python and the Holy Grail" to boot, without ever really achieving any of it. If you loved this film I'm very happy for you, but it felt more like 228 rather than 128 minutes to me.

Review title: Watching this film, I wore a stunned look of amazement on my face.
Review_body: I just didn't expect any movie to be so bad.  I will never believe the critics and the academy awards people again.  I like musicals, and this was an insult.  Is it trying to revitalize the musical, spoof musicals or kill the musical dead so it never sings another note?  No original songs, just borrowed lyrics.  Kidman isn't one of the greatest actresses out there but this is her all time worst.  I liked her in the others though.  Direction for this film, well, it gave me a headache, style over substance.  Weak plot. Jesus Christ Superstar kicks this films a$$ a hundred times over. See that if you want to see a good musical.  West side story's pretty good too. But whatever you do stay away from Moulin Rouge.

This movie takes the classical tragic love story and tells it in a unique and beautiful way.  The colors, the drama, the dizzy wonderment really captures you in the film and causes you to feel the good and the bad with the characters.  (And though it is a love story guys - it is NOT a chick-flick)  Pure genius to use Madonna, The Police, Nirvana and many more in a film taking place in 1900 Paris and actually make it work.  To appreciate Moulin Rouge, you have to over look a seemingly simplistic plot and dialogue and enter into a fantastical world of music, dance, color and unique cinematography.  In film style it reminds me of a combination of Brazil and Willy Wonka and the Chocolate Factory (a bizarre combo I know). I am in love with this movie and have been recommending it to everyone (something I rarely do).  Watch it, enjoy it!

Review title: No movie has ever affected me like Moulin Rouge
Review_body: When I was a naive little thirteen year old girl and not the avid movie watcher I am now, Moulin Rouge was definitely the cream of the crop,untouchable, and the most moving film I'd ever seen. It shook me from the core so much that it occupied my mind for at least 6 months straight during all hours of the day. Yes I was that obsessed that my whole life revolved around scheduling viewings of Moulin Rouge to watch and laugh and cry and be utterly captivated by every moment of this movie.8 years later I am now deeply aware that this is a flawed and rather shallow movie but to deny the effect this movie had on me would be blasphemy. I still adore the soundtrack but now in a way adore the original songs more I still watch it from time to time but now I would probably describe my favorite movie as Two Lovers, Saving Private Ryan, Memento or Nightmare before Christmas, though no movie has ever left me as breathless as this movie.

Review title: Makes Battlefield Earth look like Academy Award material.
Review_body: Like Titanic, this was one of those movies that female friends had suggested was good, but that I intended to go to my grave having not seen.  However, someone put it on at a little get-together, so rather than be completely neurotic and leave, I stayed to watch.God how I regret it.That's two hours of my life I want back.  The only good points I could pick out were that the sets (when you could see them) and the costumes.  Both seemed quite well done.  Actually, if you removed the script and the cinematography, I suppose it wouldn't be such a bad movie.  But those two ruined it for me.  The camera angles were so jerky and uncoordinated I felt sick, and the plot was incredibly bizarre and didn't make sense until at least half way through.  And the final nail in the coffin that would make me recommend this movie only to people I hate is that they used SOUND EFFECTS for the characters' movements.  Seriously, cartoon sound effects.Want a historical semi-funny romance? Get Shakespeare in Love.  Want to be sickened by bad camera angles, nauseated by the neurotic acting, and just plain irritated by the general reek? Then by all means, I wholeheartedly recommend Moulin Rouge.

This is the antithesis of the so called "serious" American movie- I had the odd joy of seeing it the day after I saw that ridiculous piece of Junk "IN THE BEDROOM" (avoid).  Moulin Rouge is a joy from start to finish, but a bit like eating junk food. You know it's bad for you even as you gobble it up. Fast paced to the point of incomprehensibility, this movie is a visual feast. Enjoy it for the moment. 7 out of 10 stars.

I had avoided seeing Moulin Rouge simply because I heard that it was a "musical". I soon seem to forget that I DO in fact like "musicals" (Wizard of Oz, Willy Wonka and the Chocolate Factory). So, for a year, I avoided the movie altogether. If it weren't for a good friend of mine INSISTING on seeing the movie, I probably would have missed out on this wonder! I am so glad I listened. I never knew how talented Ewan McGregor was (I am now a HUGE fan, he is adorable!), and though I have always loved Miss Nicole, she was stunning throughout the movie. My favorite scene is the duet they have in the elephant (the first of many). I have never been sucked into a movie like this one. You feel what they feel. You "feel" their love, and sorrow. Its beautifully done. I was very upset when Nicole Kidman did not win the Academy Award for this film. The acting is believable and ALL of the singing IS done by those starring and NOT dubbed. Everyone who worked on this film put their hearts and souls into it, and it shines through. It opened me up to at least try on a few other musicals (Chicago, which I didn't like), and I am always looking for another film to make me feel like I did when I watch Moulin Rouge for the first time. I am highly looking forward to the release of "Across the Universe" this summer. If you had doubts about seeing this film, try it out. You won't be sorry that you did.

Review title: With wonderful production values, who needs an interesting story?
Review_body: I really wanted to like this movie: clever sets, clever lighting, rapid edits, and it is very clever how "modern" songs are interwoven. Unfortunately the story is the usual hollywood recycled trash.The characters are flimsy, the story repeated a bajillion times before, and telegraphed in the first ten minutes of the film. An evil duke - oh my - how original and interesting. Two people who fall in love at first site - wow. Wacky sidekicks - golly.It's fun to look at, but again we have proof that hollywood assumes that money put into flash will hide the lack of substance.It's not horrible, but it is not as good as I wanted it to be.

I can, if I squint REAL hard, maybe, just maybe, see why people like this film.  This is one of those movies where your eyes are frantically searching for something to hold onto, but just can't find the ground.  Besides the visuals, the plot was also dry wall.  The love emotion deep inside I felt was the tickling of my gag reflex.  This movie is not for the faint of heart, nor should it be for anyone.

Review title: One of the best movies in the last ten years
Review_body: If you have not seen this movie, go now! I saw it here in Holland four times. Finally a movie musical that isn't stupid or boring. Nicole Kidman and Ewan McGreggor are perfect together. The songs are very creative and great. The editing sweeps you into the movie. There is nothing bad I can say about this film. Just go see it or rent the dvd in stores. I think Nicole should win Oscar for this role. Tom Cruise can go cry over loosing her because Nicole is so much beter than Penelope. This is Nicole's best role and one of the best movies in the last ten years. Baz give us more, more, more! Ten out of ten.

as I sat down in the theater I didn't know what to expect, I had heard that there would be lots of great music, and that was why I had picked this movie. I was absolutely taken by surprise, this was like nothing I had ever seen before, and I have only nice things to say about it. Afterwards when I found out that all the singing was done by the actual stars I loved the movie even more. basically what I want to say is: "go see it" even if its the only movie you'll watch this year, because it's so worth watching.

Review title: A visual stunner!!!!! Eye Candy heaven!
Review_body: This is the most visually stunning movie I have ever seen!  I'm not a big Nicole Kidman fan and I'm not big on musicals, but this movie works on all those levels!  And the Collector's edition DVD is chocked full of extras that make this a movie worth spending time with.

Review title: Doesn't get much better than that...love the music...
Review_body: That's what a musical is all about.  Not only is it fun to watch and great to listen to, but it has a great moral tone.  Not necessarily for the whole family, but definitely a great movie in my book...not to mention that Ewan McGregor has an awesome voice in addition to his acting abilities...can't wait for Star Wars Episode II...hopefully it will be better than episode I...

Review title: Laugh, Cry, Dance, or Sing Along; this movie makes you do all of them.
Review_body: In an age of movies where the ending in each one is your typical boy meets girl, defeats villain, gets girl in the end, it is good to see a movie that tells a heart-felt story with a sad end.  It also tells the story in a type of genre long thought dead and only used in Disney cartoons - a musical. This movie is colorful in every way, from the lovesick and love obsessed Christian and the courtisan/singer Satine to the amazing costumes.  The cinematography in the movie was exquisite, my favorite use of the camera being near the beginning when you first enter the Moulin Rouge, it is used to make you feel disoriented, like Christian probably felt when he first entered the late 19th century version of Studio 54. In a movie about Truth, Beauty, Freedom, and Love, you feel all of it. The Truth - This movie is sensual, uplifting, a definite "Spectacular Spectacular." The Beauty - Every thing about the movie is beautiful, from the setting and time ( late 19th century, paris france during the bohemian revolution) to the people, costumes, music...need I say more. The Freedom - You will feel free as your entranced by this story about the lovesick Christian in his attempts to free his first love, Satine, from the grips of the evil duke. The Love - You will love to watch this movie over and over again.  You will love to sing along with the characters in each of the amazing songs (Your Song, Elephant Medley, Come What May)  You will love being able to share the movie and its story with your kids, grandkids and so forth. You will just flat out LOVE this movie.

Review title: A movie I walk away and can't say anything but I love that movie!!!!!
Review_body: I must say the first time I heard about it was from my sister and she said after five minutes she turned it off because it couldn't hold her interest.However I must admit I sat through the entire thing and this is possibly the best movie I have ever seen. The acting is amazing definitely one of Nicole Kidman's best roles yet.Then of course there is Ewan Mcgregor who not only is a talented actor but one heck of a singer as well. The music itself I found interesting because it was modern day mixed with another era. In the end the music is a big part of the film it shows the passion and the capability of these wonderful actors/actresses. I do hate that Satine dies in the end but I don't believe it would have worked any other way. I would recommend this movie to anyone as long as you have an open mind. It is simply incredible and very easily enjoyable.

I gave this movie an 8 because I'm convinced that I'd like it, at least, that much if I had been allowed to see it as it was supposed to have been seen. Unfortunately I ended up seeing it a very tired Sunday at 9 p.m. in a theater where the sound technician were either deaf, on dope or both.This movie is ... intense. Its imagery is intense as well as its sound. Therefore it became almost impossible to experience for me. On the other hand, I've never been much for musicals and Moulin Rouge is a musical on steroids. It's somewhat difficult to take the plot seriously when everybody's running around, singing everything. The scenes of the show at Moulin Rouge are almost tiring in their excessiveness.It's got humor, romance, music, sorrow and action but it misses at some point, trying to compress too much movie into too little space. Or maybe it's just that some songs are way too cheesy. Or maybe I'm just tired and grumpy. The point I'm trying to make is that, being such an intense film, you really need to have the perfect setting for it, or you will just not like it (like me).Oh, and one very big positive thing: They all actually sing their own songs. Without that the whole movie would just be laughable, at best.

This film brings the auidence a wonderful spectrum of arts! Hints of classical paintings such as Manet to musicals like Singin' In The Rain are all part of this wonderfull musical. Can the auidence grab every hint as to what is next, or remember what was film past? This work even refers to the roots of film genius, George Melaias.

Review title: Seen it before, heard it before...now in even smaller pieces
Review_body: I just do not understand the photographic intent in this film; the great dance scenes cut into tiny epileptic shreds, and the close-up face scenes intolerably slow, like the prelude of Tarkovsky's Solaris. Why the fast cuts? Is there a global lack of dancers today capable to keep a pose longer than a quarter of a second. In comparison Fred Astaire and Ginger Rogers did their whole dance numbers in just one take, Mr Astaire was a perfectionist though. Still, it can be verified that face shots does not become more dramatic by time alone.Neither the characters of Satine, nor Christian manages to attract my sympathy, and the Duke is too plain; more like a clown. Maybe intentionally, but since this is a fairy tale, I would appreciate the villain to be more of a character.Finally a potpourri is a potpourri is a potpourri. Why not put some effort in giving this film its own music, instead of the mishmash of great love songs it ended up with. Waste your time on "All that Jazz" or "Cabaret" instead, at least they got an interesting plot.

When this film first came out, I didn't hear much about it.  Once Oscar season started, it seemed as if I had lived in a hole.  Everyone was talking about this film.  I still hadn't seen it, and the only thing it was to me was competition for my favorite of the year, "The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring." However, about a month later, I finally saw the movie everyone had hailed for nearly a year.  It seemed as if everyone I knew had seen and loved this film. I rented it, and from the first moment it started, I was entranced.  Every moment of this film kept me hanging on, and sending me through a whirlwind of sights, sounds, and delights for every sensory part of my brain.  I truly believe that this may be one of the greatest artistic films of ourtime. I've been accused of being an "artsy-fartsy" person, so maybe that's just the artistic side of me talking.  But even if it is, there is not a single time when I have seen this movie that I have not been moved to tears, be it from the story or the beauty of the movie itself.First, let me address Ewan McGregor's performance.  Regrettably, the only thing I had seen him in prior to this was, ahem, "Star Wars: The Phantom Menace."  Imagine my surprise when the little Jedi belted out "Your Song," a favorite of mine, and promptly caused me to melt into a puddle of shapeless goo.  I still swoon every time I hear his voice.  Who knew Obi-Wan could sing, on top of act the part amazingly?  Not I, certainly. Opposite him, I could have chosen no one better than the lovely and talented Nicole Kidman.  Definitive Satine?  YES.  Simple as that.  Her voice and her actions made me truly believe and love the character, even when she wasn't entirely lovable. John Leguizamo was simply superb as Toulouse-Lautrec, especially for someone who traipsed about on their knees throughout the entire film. I agree with many of Hollywood's best and brightest when they say that Jim Broadbent's Oscar this year was not only for "Iris," but for this film as well.  Fatherly, comedic, and boss-like all at the same time, and managing to do it all with a large mustache and potbelly as well.One cannot mention the cast without mentioning the incomparable Richard Roxburgh and his incredibly hilarious yet amazingly imposing (at times) performance as the sinister Duke. Every singer, every dancer, every actor, every actress in this film was perfect.  Not a single hair was out of place.  Which leaves the director and magic maker himself, Baz Luhrmann.  Not many modern directors would set out to do a project like this.  Perhaps thirty years ago, but not now.  This was probably the biggest risk in his (and everyone else that worked on it, too) career.  Maybe the public is split down the middle, between those that love it and those that couldn't sit through twenty minutes of it, but this reviewer and movie viewer knows that this will go down in history as one of the greatest films of our time.

With no real plot and story within the first 20 minutes, I turned he TV off only to ask all my friends the next day what they thought of it, most people have agreed with my one line summary, and I hope you will too. Save yourself $5 and dont hire this out.

A wonder celebration of truth, beauty, freedom, and above all things love. Nicole Kidman is fabulous in this. She sings, she dances, she acts, she's awesome. And Ewan Mcgregor is incredible good looking in this. Definately a reason for the musical to make a comeback.

Review title: No laws, no limits. Just one rule, never fall in love!
Review_body: This movie is not only visual masterpiece, it is well acted, has a great story line and wonderful soundtrack. Not to mention that Ewan McGregor is not only very attractive, but has a GREAT singing voice. This is the best musical I have ever seen. Music speaks to you in a different language then words, and words that seem so simple can bring you to your knees when sung. This is my favorite movie!

Review title: Glitz and glitter, but just enough substance
Review_body: Sure, "Moulin Rouge!" has been panned as a one-dimensional chick flick with lots of pretty colors and flashy dance numbers but no true depth. However, the brilliance of the movie lies in it's delivery.  Essentially, most tragic love stories are the same.  This movie elevates itself to greatness due to the masterful direction of Baz.  The frantic pace only serves to dazzle us more; the blinding colors and chaotic musical numbers truly make this film a tour de force.  The characters of Christian, Satine, Loutrec, Zidler, and the Duke are delivered splendidly by obviously talented actors.  The difference between many love stories and "Moulin Rouge!" is that this film actually tries...everything jumps out at the viewer to deliver the Bohemian message of truth, beauty, freedom, and love in an eye-popping way.  Many who see this movie will be left breathless; and muttering the timeless, honorable theme: "the greatest thing you'll ever learn is just to love, and be loved in return."  Now that is the mark of a great movie. 10/10

Review title: A movie I didn't expect to like, but wound up loving.
Review_body: This movie transcends the way movies are made, Baz deserved the best director nod by a landslide over that Beautiful Mind director.  But whatever, what's done is done I guess(highway robbery).The movie's musical numbers fill you with so much joy and that sense of 'wow, that was pretty cool' feeling.  It's really an amazing movie.  The choice of songs somehow fit(save for a couple of songs, ie. that 'diamonds are a girls best friend' tune that gets sung over and over again throughout the movie I coulda done without) The storyline itself is of course, very 'Broadway' and thus, I don't mind at all that it didn't win Best Picture, but I still stand by my Best Director choice.I can sense a bunch of movies will come out soon attempting to copy Moulin Rouge, and frankly, I can't wait, here's hoping they don't ruin this newly realized genre'.

When I first saw MOULIN ROUGE, I wasn't sure what to expect.  Musicals have been on the rise thanks in part to EVITA.  MOULIN ROUGE broke all the rules and showed that a movie musical can work in this day and time.  EVITA, DANCER IN THE DARK, LOVE'S LABOR LOST, and HEDWIG AND THE ANGRY INCH all led up to this one great moment in time.  MOULIN ROUGE is stylish, creative and vivid.  Thus far, I have seen the movie 15 times.  I saw it eight times in the theatre (I had lots of dates at that time) and the rest on DVD - which by the way, is amazing in it's own rights and I suggest that if you don't own a DVD player, get it just to see this film and all the extra behind the scenes that go with it. It was a great shame that Ewan and Baz were not nominated for Oscars for their work on the film and showed Hollywoods lack of imagination (for the most part) in knowing great film-making when they see it. I can't wait to see what Baz will do next with the screen adaptation of the Tony Award winning musical RENT - not to mention the buzz that Baz may bring two of his movies, STRICTLY BALLROOM and MOULIN ROUGE, to the Broadway stage.  This man is bound for greatness.

I think my 'one line summery' summarised the basic theme of this message! I loved Moulin Rouge! Nicole Kidman and Ewan McGregor were great in it; I don't think they could have got anyone better! The singing was surprisingly good, in-fact as I write this message, I have the soundtrack for the movie on. I just can't get enough of this film, I think I may win the 'Saddo of the year' prize for how much I watch and listen to it! If you are a fellow Moulin Rouge lover then contact me - my address should be next to my name. xx BYE xx

Review title: The best movie i have ever seen in my life, after Braveheart.
Review_body: Before seeing Moulin Rouge, i never thought there could ever be a movie that would make me both laugh and cry, all in one minute. I am just so sad that i didn't have the chance to watch it in the cinema because i was on vacation. I think Ewan McGregor has an EXTRAORDINARY voice or as said in the movie "HUGE TALENT"!! i love the movie and i recommend it to everyone especially women.

Review title: Totally Suprising! Amazingingly Creative and Exciting!
Review_body: Wow!  That is the first thing I said after seeing this movie for the first time.  I actually had to be forced to watch this because I thought "Stupid musical, it will be boring"   Well boy was I wrong.  This movie takes you on an emotional rollercoaster ride.  On moment you are laughing hystarically and then next you could be crying.  Both Nicole Kidman and Ewan McGregor surprised me with their beautiful voice and of course acted wonderfully. But the real prize should go to Baz Lurman the director.  He beautifully told this story by creatively using fun modern music, weaving the images together masterfully.  This film is the definition of excellent direction. I am thoroughly in awe of Baz Lurman. PS-- he was robbed of the Oscar! and a nomination for that matter.

Moulin Rouge is spectacular, spectacular. It has a great plot, great music, and great actors. I can't believe Ewan's voice. It's gorgeous! I never knew he could sing like that.I like how this movie has many emotions. It goes from funny to dramatic in seconds. You can't take your eyes off the screen while watching this movie.The music sequences are great, too. There's a lot of dancing and action. As I said before all the actors have great voices. (Except maybe Richard Roxburgh- The Duke, but he doesn't sing much anyway.)I love this movie and recommend it to anyone. I wasn't a great fan of musicals until I saw this.

Sorry guys but what do you see in this movie?  I tried to watch this movie with an open mind and all that I got in return was a headache.  This movie is just unbearable trash.  What is the point of making a 2 hour long music video.  I think that this is what hell really looks like.  Stay far away from this movie.  Yikes!!

I absolutely love this film; it is my favorite of all time. Baz Lurhman is a brilliant director. Some don't like this film for its choppy shots and quick changes, but I think it is absolutely wonderful and original. I love the music, how they put modern songs in a movie taking place in 1899.Plus, even though it doesn't sound like it, Ewan McGregor and Nicole Kidman have wonderful voices. They have a lot of talent and the songs they sing are wonderful. Whoever put together the songs was very wise about their choices, because in scenes like the dance hall and the Roxanne scene the layered songs sound wonderful together.I think the best part was the green fairy sequence. That was brilliantly done, esp. how the fairy would be a little line and then stop, and it was if she was bursting out. All in all, I think this is the best movie I've ever had the pleasure of watching.

A film reminiscant of the most awful and shoddy operettas of the early 20th Century.This is a film loved by a generation of people who have never seen any of the brilliant cinematic musicals, and highly rated by society because, well...  because i think there must have been bribery involved.Why oh why cast Ewan Mcgregor a less than brilliant actor with an even worse voice as one of the leads?Serious music fans avoid.

Review title: a tale Told by an idiot full of sound and fury, Singifying nothing
Review_body: Sort of like Rocky Horror Picture Show on crystal meth but not as campy. Just right for hyperactive Boomers and GenXers who know nothing about real acting, real plot, real character development, and real music.  It is a tale Told by an idiot full of sound and fury, Signifying nothing.  I give it a zero.  It is total garbage and is totally over self-pretentious.

Review title: A musical about a writer in Monmarte, France, at the turn of the century
Review_body: This movie is incredible. I love everything about the dance secuences, crazy visuals, songs and charactors. I feel like I went there, and saw it, no matter how different the Moulin Rouge really was. I love the powerful acting and outrageous comedy. Ever since this movie, I always look for Ewan McGregor's name on movies at SilverScreen rental. One thing that bothers me, is at the end, when you-know-what happens, it's all dramatic, and silent, and then Christian just wails. I never seem to be able to keep a straight face.

i absolutely love this film. i can watch it over and over and never get bored. it is the ultimate chick flick and i fall in love with Christian every time i watch it. he is amazing - especially when he sings. i love the elephant love medley and it never loses its effect even after the first 20 watches - i still get goosebumps!! overall i would recommend this film to anyone who loves a great love story and anyone who doesn't end up loving Christian is crazy! brilliant film! zidler is fantastic and the richard roxburgh as the duke is indescribably great. the perfect hateable character! i cannot recommend this film enough - i have even chosen it for a film studies project!

Review title: A lavish and beauty spectacle of the heart.
Review_body: I really didn't think I was going to like this film, but it really just completely made me swoon to it-- the beauty of the scenery, photography, and the performers.  I thought Baz Luhrmann and Ewan McGregor were unjustly robbed of Academy Awards.  It just won me over, which wasn't an easy task.

It seems that most people either hate this movie or love it. I just can't understand how anyone could like anything about this movie. I admit I am not the biggest fan of musicals, but I can usually see how others can enjoy them and find something to appreciate. Musicals need good songs like West Side Story, good production like Oliver, or just silly fun like Grease. This had nothing. The hyperactive editing, garish colors and awful, awful music made this one of the worst movies I have ever seen, possibly worse than Battlefield Earth. While the whole genre is pretty goofy, a musical should at least have good choreography. It is impossible to tell if anyone is even dancing in this movie with all of the edits, camera angles, and effects. Many have mentioned how cheeky it is to use modern hits in this period piece. What most don't mention is how terrible those songs are. "Like A Virgin" is an awful song in any century!

One of the best love stories ever!One of the rare films that can make me cry[and this one more than once!!!].Everyone who can love truly can love this film and they should definitely watch this film.Because they are going to think of 'love' more differentaly than they did before.
it just awesome movie but it kind of sad at the end i just love the music and the production

Review title: The greatest lesson to be learned
Review_body: A story about Freedom, Beauty, Truth, and Love. Directed by Baz Lurhmann with terriffic acting by Nicole Kidman (Satine) and Ewan McGregor(Christian). An absolutely sad movie!!! My favorite movie!! The most original movie!!

I had some expectation of a decent movie when I rented this but was still very disappointed. I shut it off after about a half hour as I could not follow the plot. There was Music and Singing but the actors were not good at musicals in my opinion. Couldn't they get real singers to play in the movie? The costumes and actions were busy and disconcerting and did not keep me hanging on long enough to see the movie through. Since this movie, I realized that Nicole Kidman's acting and/or movies are not worth watching. The only one I would recommend is the one where she lives in the haunted house. Next time producers would hopefully use singers to sing and actors to act.

Review title: worst movie musical of the last 25 years (and that's saying a lot)
Review_body: Despite some rave reviews when it first came out, Moulin Rouge is totally inessential. The story is a standard love triangle, with no performances to distinguish it. Plot twists are utterly predictable. The direction is generally haphazard, cutting much too quickly from shot to shot (most movie musicals today have this problem, yet Chicago succeeds despite it).But worst of all is the music, a collection of pop standards rewritten for orchestra and vocalist. Some are almost unrecognizable, and there are interesting juxtapositions. But there's a reason it's called "pop music" -- it isn't any good musically. Most of the music is painful to listen to, without the energy of the stadium stage and the grind of drums and guitars. The gimmick is clever for 20 minutes and after that I was fast-forwarding to the end of musical numbers.I like movie musicals, but this kind of joyless cross-genre attempt to grab younger audiences will just drive them off when legitimate musicals are made into good movies -- such as Chicago. The most recent good example of the cross-genre movie musical, Madonna's Evita, is a much better film (and an infinitely better musical). If you want to rent a newish movie musical, get Newsies. The death of movie musicals has been declared prematurely, but another Moulin Rouge will certainly doom them

From classic love songs to modern dance-provoking numbers, Moulin Rouge has made itself an instant Luhrman classic. Baz's hard work truly shows itself in the sheer musical perfection of the movie. Starring classic songs such as Elton John's 'Your Song' in a dreamy night scene of Christian (Ewan McGregor) and Satine (Nicole Kidman) dancing romantically under the stars. A fantastic medley of the greatest love songs ever written, sung excitedly on the suburban rooftops and inventively named 'Elephant Love Medly'. The whole Bohemian aura of the movie is theatrically enticing, with clearly defined characters who play a large part in the inspiring setting Paris. On the edge of the love, truth and freedom crazed revolution, young writer Christian (Ewan McGregor) finds himself apart of a Bohemian play, and he's asked to write for them. He soon discovers himself reading his poetry to the club's star and beautiful courtesan Satine (Kidman), he instantly he falls in love with her and finds himself apart of a deadly love triangle with the clubs most prestigious patron- The Duke (Roxburgh) Throughout the film the camera angles vary from high panning shots of the musical to the intense face-to-face eye level romance cuts. Baz creatively uses black and white to colour scenes in conjunction with extreme wide shots to give the 'time travel' effect when zooming over the city in Paris. The editing and camera work all come together to form the classic Baz Style film that is easily recognized by any movie lover. During the scenes in the movie, it jumps from the present time to past rapidly with Christian (Ewan McGregor) typing the story as he narrates. It constantly zooms in and out of the Moulin Rouge to clearly portray the party vibe of the club. In the song 'Lady Marmalade' Harold Zidler (Jim Broadbent) jumps around the Moulin Rouge dancing with his burlesque women and keeping himself head of the party. Kidman makes her first entrance into The Moulin Rouge by coming down from the ceiling on a swing covered with glitter in an extravagant silver costume, she excitedly sings the world renowned song 'Diamonds are a Girl's Best Friend'. "The greatest thing you'll ever learn, is just to love, and be loved in return" this important yet memorable quote takes front seat in the movie along with Christian's (McGregor) love song chorus quotes throughout. The young writer's infatuation with love builds up over the movie, though it does meet some twists and turns and he finds out love is not always easy. A musical masterpiece portrayed perfectly on screen this one of a kind movie hit jackpot in both actors and writers, with heartfelt songs to display the emotion and eccentric dance songs to give The Moulin Rouge the true burlesque finish. The top of a movie lover's must-watch list of all time.

Moulin Rouge is the only(well sort of)musical i've sat through in my entire life.I thought the visuals and the soundtrack,made up for the lack of anything new script wise.Nicole Kidman and Ewan McGregor were good but i think Jim Broadbent and Richard Roxburgh really stood out. Anyway top film i hope Baz follows it up with something equally good.

I have not really ever enjoyed musicals, this movie was superb.I loved this movie, i could not get enough of it, i was watching it every day for a week. ewan mcgregor and nicole kidman did great in this movie. the movie was thrilling, suspenful,and so much love, but not a muchy love,a true undying love. to bad she had to die, that is the kind of love everyone is looking for. the songs were excellent, i had no idea that ewan and nicole could sing.anyway i think everyone should see this movie, it rates a 10 for me

This is the first and only movie up to now that i fell hopelessly and forever in love with just from its very beginning! all my friends (except one, who actually told me to see this film because it's already a classic) thought it was too melodramatic and maudlin, too sugary and mawkish, but for me it is more than a masterpiece. i was totally enthralled with it as early as the scene in which satine was hiding christian from the duke which is one of the funniest things i've ever seen in cinema (excluding a lot of memorable moments from "dumb&dumber" but this movie falls into a completely different category). i also adored the blazing style of all the dance scenes, all the colours and vibrance in them, the ingenuity of the adaptations of contemporary songs (which in other context, in other movie i would have thought inappropriate in the least) - my favourite is the tango of the argentinian. another of my favourite scenes is the one in which the duke is singing this elton john song - and he sings so heartbreakingly badly and makes such a face that somehow you start pitying him and, of course, you can never think of him as the bad guy in the way you think about bad guys in action movies for example.

Review title: A great film you won't want to miss
Review_body: When I first watched it I was expecting a good movie, but it wasn't good, it was fantastic!If you haven't watched it, go rent it, but I'd suggest to buy it, I can't see how some people think of this movie as a dreadful movie, well I loved it. The songs were great, the cast was beautifully done, my favorite actress, the beautiful Nicole Kidman as Satine who falls in love with a writer who is played by, my favorite actor, Ewan McGregor as Christian, funny how my favorite actor and actress star in the same movie!The musical performances are great, the acting and casting is awesome, I cry every time I watch this movie!All in all I give it 10/10's

Approximately half an hour into this movie I was trying to see my watch so I knew how long it had been going for.  It doesn't help that they tell you the ending at the beginning so that you know exactly what is coming.  Hate to be savage on an Australian movie but Nicole Kidman's wimpy, whiny singing voice was painful and the movie was trying too hard to be art-house that they let their artiness get in the way of the storyline.  I don't get the big deal about this movie.  It was boring and just dragged on.  If I hadn't have been relying on others for a ride home I would definitely have walked out before the end.

Review title: a story about freedom, beauty, truth and love.
Review_body: A young writer called Christian comes to Paris. There he meets Tolous and gets a job writing for the show "spectacular spectacular". Christian visits the Moulin rouge where he falls in love with the star, Satine. Satine mistakes Christian for the duke and falls in love with him. As the film goes on, they face many challenges to keep their love a secret and the duke interested. At the end Satine realises that Christian is in great danger. She makes him believe she doesn't love him and sends him away. But Christian comes back. When the show is over, the duke is out of the way and Setain and Christian are no longer needing to hide their love, everything looks great. Until the tragedy of Satine dying comes along. This film is the best musical i have ever watched. The songs get stuck in my mind. Better actors could not have been chosen.

Review title: Music, dancing, and above all - love
Review_body: "Moulin Rouge" is an amazing show of costumes, dancing, singing... little witty things you only see after two or three showings. Nicole Kidman is absolutely fabulous - who knew she could sing? Even if you find her annoying or stuck-up, Moulin Rouge gives her a totally different quality. Even if I never watch anything else of her's again, I will appreciate her role as Satine.Ewan McGregor is fabulous, and sings better than the majority of profession singers out there (his Scottish accent makes it better). McGregor, who is one of the world's best actors, in some admittedly unusual movies, sings, acts, and sobs like nothing you've seen before. No matter what you think of him, you owe it to yourself try this one out!Baz Luhrmann does a truly fantastic job on incorporating modern music into a classic piece; this should have won best picture, cinematography, sound, and costumes!The beginning makes you smile, the middle is a "feast for the eyes" (thank you, Ewan), and the ending will make you cry. Even if you don't think you'll like this one, "Moulin Rouge" is just too great to miss! I loved it, and almost everyone will!

Moulin Rouge is a great film and should be watched by all!Visually spectacular with great songs, great costumes and script. Nicole Kidman and MacGregor work excellently together as the Aussies. The set, itself, which is entirely inside a huge warehouse is great . This includes the big elephant and the dance hall.Although I must admit that you need 2 or 3 viewings to actually get what is happening and all the flashbacks that do occur! - As in the beginning it is sometimes hard to recognise that MacGregor is the man typing on the typewriter!10/10 - A must see by everyone!

Review title: Great Aussie actors!!! Poss spoiler maybe
Review_body: Moulin Rouge is a great film and should be watched by all!Visually spectacular with great songs, great costumes and script. Nicole Kidman and MacGregor work excellently together as the Aussies. The set, itself, which is entirely inside a huge warehouse is great . This includes the big elephant and the dance hall.Although I must admit that you need 2 or 3 viewings to actually get what is happening and all the flashbacks that do occur! - As in the beginning it is sometimes hard to recognise that MacGregor is the man typing on the typewriter!10/10 - A must see by everyone!

First of all, it's a great film. Some parts are absolutely spectacular. I think that Nicole Kidman gives a great performance as Satine, a courtesan at the infamous Moulin Rouge, and Ewan McGregor as Christian, the writer. My favourite part of the film is from the very beginning up to the elephant love medley. I adored the sequence at the Moulin Rouge where Satine sings "Diamonds are a girls best friend," (excellent singing throughout the movie, by the way, and all done by Nicole and Ewan.) I also loved the "pitch" where the Bohemians pitch their idea of a play to the wicked and evil Duke. Although many parts of the film are strong, I got bored with some of the musical performances and found myself skipping past them. Nevertheless, a GREAT film for anyone but the ending may come as as a shock.

I loved this director's kinky take on Romeo "+" Juliet, it was so great and even though at the time I completely despised Leo Dicaprio he spat out Shakespeare very well. Now, on to this movie. I wanted to hate it so bad, it came out at the same time as the first LOTR so I was naturally pitted against it because of the Oscars. I went on hating this movie I had never seen for being a musical. and also for reworking old songs in a new way (I had caught glimpses of the movie walking through the living room while my sisters watched it). Finally i sat down to watch the thing on a lonely weeknight, and was just totally ripped from my hate of the premise and placed firmly in the seat of one who would decry all who disliked it. The film reeks of freshness, the style is so unlike so much trash that is out in Hollywood currently. Yet while it seems over the top when viewed in a snapshot, the film as a whole is magnificent. I wont try and describe all the elements that I loved, you can see them for yourself (youll have to watch it more than once to get everything, the first viewing is a lot of you getting used to the style). If an 18 year old, at the time, die-hard action nut and sci-fi nerd can like this musical;anyone should.

Written for English class.Moulin Rouge! (2001) is a movie musical that takes place in the Moulin Rouge cabaret in Paris - Christian (Ewan McGregor), a young writer, falls in love with the cabaret actress and courtesan Satine (Nicole Kidman). Their love is doomed from the start, since Satine is set to marry the wealthy Duke of Monroth (Richard Roxburgh), who has promised to invest in the cabaret if he gets Satine in return. In spite of all, the two start a dangerous love affair.To some viewers the characters may seem unrealistic and hard to understand, but after learning more about Luhrmann's style in general, I believe that that is exactly what he was going for. Christian is a hopeless romantic, ready to do anything for love, while Satine is at first extremely skeptic and doesn't believe in true love. In Moulin Rouge! these two main characters aren't the only ones with strong personas - Harold Zidler (Jim Broadbent), the head of the cabaret, is comically melodramatic and jolly, while the Duke (Richard Roxburgh) is exactly his opposite - so snappy and angry it may feel overdone at times. All of the actors in this film do a fantastic job portraying such dramatic characters.One of the most powerful scenes in the movie is "El Tango de Roxanne". This scene depicts Luhrmann's style quite well - the entire set, (especially the lighting) and the dancing are very dramatic and truly engage the viewer. Furthermore, the editing jumps from one place to another very quickly. Luhrmann's style can also be heard in the songs - the song they are dancing to is the rock song Roxanne by The Police, released in 1978, combined with the tango "Tanguera" by Mariano Mores, released in 1953. The events of Moulin Rouge! occur somewhere in the early 1900s, so neither one of these songs would have been released back then.Moulin Rouge! has been one of my all-time favourite movies ever since I first saw it. I absolutely love everything about it, and what especially stuck with me were the music and the actors, who all did a fantastic job. Not to mention the ending, which left me speechless for days. The production design, as it is in all of Luhrmann's films, is breathtaking - every scene feels extremely carefully thought out.

Ya i can understand this being a musical an all,had to be a bit out of my league,but still,this is just utter disgrace to the 'musical movie' genre.Of course,it had a lot of "commercial" stuff to make this one worth the wait,but definitely not one to be missed.Well,it does have a flip side to it,as most movies do,all is not disappointing.Well, i have to admit that Nicole kidman as well as Ewan McGregor have put their best foot forward to make this a spectacle,it is (though not too pleasing to the eye),not a completely waste of effort.Richard roxburgh as the duke is quite believable as the "bad guy" here.Also,a thumbs up to Jim broadbent as the colorful Harold Zidler. overall,i would give this 6 on 10.

This movie was beautifully unique, and the vocal talents are passable, but alas, that's the only thing it has going for it.The plot is lackluster and trite, the music is nearly all recycled from existing places (which was HIGHLY disappointing, as I was looking forward to a new musical... ugh! even the lines are taken from pop songs!), and the manic pace does nothing to help these talented actors. The plot elements of love and endurance are absolutely lost under slapstick comedy and artistic camera experiments. Quite frankly, even in the midst of all the turmoil of the plot, I didn't feel a think for these characters. No affection, no pity.This movie came very highly recommended, and it is indeed lovely to look at, but there's no substance here at all. I emphatically dislike this movie, and I will not recommend it.

Review title: My only regret is that it isn't longer
Review_body: Interesting story line, excellent cast, excellent performances, excellent music. I've never been a fan of musicals, and I adore this movie to the point of occasionally re-watching it. I wait long enough between screenings to forget as much as possible, so I can watch it almost as if new. I'm never disappointed. I absolutely would and HAVE recommended it to friends.

I loved the film from beginning to ending. I wanted to use the bathroom before the film started at the theater, but then it did. I then stopped to watch it, popcorn and coke bottle in hand. Two hours later, I was still in the movie theater watching and crying as the final scene ended. This was the ONLY time I watched the film because I couldn't betray myself from escaping another movie-filled life.Then, Saturday night on September 13. I was tired of the paid channels programming so I clicked on the remote through channels, then I stopped on CBS. It was a film. I waited what it was. Then, the beginning started. I told my son that I watched this before and couldn't put in my mind where I have seen it. Then, the Sound of Music theme played, then I knew it. My son thought it was the Sound of Music. I loved every second of it again! I then downloaded the film and here I am reviewing. Moulin Rouge! is by far the best musical and one of the best films I have ever seen! One of the reasons movies exist!I would recommend this to movie-goers without a doubt.

Review title: Absolutely fabulous! My favorite movie of all time!
Review_body: Moulin Rouge is the best movie I've ever seen. It blends tantalizing visuals with a gripping plot. Nicole Kidman portrays her character perfectly. She surprises the audience with singing, comedy, and extreme drama. She gains the viewer's sympathy from her first scene and amazes with her captivating beauty. Ewan MacGregor is unbelievably charming and also is a surprisingly talented musician. The rest of the cast includes seasoned actors such as Jim Broadbent, John Leguizamo, and Richard Roxberg. The characters are eccentric and memorable,they range from immensely comedic to tragic. Luhrmann created a quality love story in the spectacular bohemian world of Paris at the turn of the century. Old songs are given new light and morphed into poignant musical dialogue that would otherwise be far too simple. The constant criticism of the movie as being just a series of reckless clichés completely overlooks the fundamental purpose of the film: effectively acounting for all of the conventional and unconventional views on love and art and culminating them into a deeply moving story. Having seen both Strictly Ballroom and Romeo and Juliet, it is of my personal opinion that Moulin Rouge takes the best qualities and doubles their effect. It is the originality of the movie that clings to the viewer long after the credits. Luhrmann and the all the cast should be applauded for their bold move to enter a genre that had long been considered out-dated.

This is, without doubt, the best film I have ever seen. The story struck a chord with me instantly and I was swept off my feet within the first 5 minutes. Satine and Christian's story is the most powerful cinematic love story to ever grace our screens. I was captivated by the darkness of it all yet inspired by the joy and romance. I think so many films are cliché and rather cheesy but this definitely isn't. Visually the movie is stunning and the songs are brilliant; a unique twist on the everyday musical. The script also doesn't disappoint. Nichole and Ewan do a a fantastic job of portraying the characters, nobody could get across the love that they feel for one another and the pain they have to go through to be together. You would be crazy not to give this film a go, it truly is just beautiful! The greatest thing you will ever learn is just to love and be loved in return. Enjoy!

This story is one of the best I've ever seen. Everything is wonderful: the actors and actresses, the extras, the songs, the colors... Ewan McGregor and Nicole Kidman are great artists, they can act and sing very well, and they are a magic couple on stage. Besides that, it's such a complete film, it's a musical, a comedy, a drama and a romantic movie, and both leading and supporting actors make it all work.When I first saw Moulin Rouge, I wondered if I could have a life like that, full of emotions and dreams, and if I could fall in love in such a romantic way. And I'm not getting tired of watching it again every time I can.So if you like dreaming, and you believe that love can change everything, you'll be glad to watch one of the best movies Hollywood has produced.

BEST MOVIE EVER! Moulin Rouge is about a dancer who is an aspiring actor(Nicole Kidman). Through out the movie she uses her sex appeal to advance her production (Moulin Rouge) she was star in that was about everything that was happening throughout the at the end she movie realizes that real love is worth more than money and falls in love with the writer of the production! this is the most colorful movie i have ever seen in every context! The dance and music is also great leaning towards a circus theme that is great in every way! I recommend would this movie to anyone because it has something for everyone! I give this film 10 out of 10 stars! Great Great Great! watch it and you'll love it I guarantee it!

This is a truly amazing movie!! Ewan McGregor (Star Wars, Trainspotting) marvels and Nicole Kidman (Cold Mountain) sparkles in this entertaining, sad, romantic musical.Christian (McGregor) goes to the Moulin Rouge to write but falls in love with a beautiful Courtesan (Kidman) and the movie is about how they have to hide their love from people such as the enigmatic Harold Zidler (Jim Broadbent: Bridget Jones' Diary) and the slimy Duke (Richard Roxburgh: Van Helsing). However, as all good love stories go she has to end it for their sake and then inevitably she dies.All songs performed by the stars in a movie that is truly legendary, and will be remembered forever.I love this movie and would recommend it to anyone who loves, romance but also to those who love music as this movie ingeniously uses modern musical number from people such as Sir Elton John and David Bowie, to Fatboy Slim and Xtina, making the movie so much more enjoyable. The acting is astounding and the storyline moving.

What you need to know about this film is that it is all about love. It is a story of lust, greed, jealousy and music, music expresses what words cannot and that is shown throughout this film. From beginning to end, I was completely captivated and this was because it was so quirky and beautifully scripted that I felt I was a part of the Moulin Rouge. Baz Luhrmann directed and helped write this musical and I have always been a big fan of his work.. The protagonists Satine (Nicole Kidman) and Christian (Ewan McGregor) are the unlucky and unlikely lovers as Satine mistakenly assumes that Christian is the Duke (Richard Roxburgh). Christian is in fact a young writer who travelled from London to Paris in search of inspiration and maybe love and Satine is the 'Sparkling Diamond' of the club who catches the eye of both Chrstian and the Duke. Satine wants to seduce the Duke so he can give her wealth but also help her to achieve her dream of being an actress. Early on we can tell that the two men will be fighting over Satine but it seems a greater threat is at large. The film takes its inspiration from 20th century music specifically love songs and even creates a medley of many popular love songs of the century. One thing I do love about this film is the soundtrack, the music intertwines perfectly with the plot and it really does help into showing us the characters true intentions.Obviously not every film is perfect and this film has its flaws but I think that is what makes it so honest and their love so captivating. The cinematography and the editing is beautifully composed, very quirky and quite dark for a film of this genre.Overall this film is a must see if you are a fan of romance, drama, comedy and above all else music. Also if you are a fan of Baz Luhrmann then I would definitely put this film on my 'To See' list.RJ x

Moulin Rouge is and masterpiece by Baz Luhrmann, the Aussie directer that changed modern cinema. He's directed Romeo and Juliet, and Stricktly Ballroom, but Moulin Rouge is my personal favourite out of the 3, but it's my favourite movie so that's expected. Here's whyStarting with the visual aspects, the costumes are breathtaking, surpassing other movies by leagues. The set is equally fantastic. It's too awesome to put in words.Nicole Kidman is breathtaking as Satine, while Ewan McGregor gives a wonderful performance as Christian the love-struck poet. Both display amazing singing abilities, performing all their own songs, with only a singing coach to help them. Not bad for 2 actors.Ewan McGregor says it all "I really think it will just blow everyone away. It really is a feast for the senses" Couldn't have said it better...

This film is very exciting. All actors are amazing, and I want to said "Nicole Kidman, you are the best actress of our century". It's just fantastic, how this story is so close to everyone of us and how we very often don't understand the life and it's power. The Power of the dream, the power of Love. The Year of 2001 is one of this golden years, which are coming sometimes to remind us for the greatest time of cinema, in this year was born "Harry Potter", in the same period was born and "The Lord of the Rings", "Beautiful Mind" too. It was one of the best years in the history of cinema. After this movie I'm feeling very sophisticated and feel how my hearth beat with power which we, peoples said "Love".

Nicole Kidman and Ewan Magregor are fantastic. this is a fantastic film from start to finish. This is a film you have to watch several times. When i first watched it i thought it was a lot to take in. Fantastic story and the songs are brilliant Nicole Kidman has a brilliant voice, Ewan Magregor has a great voice too. Absolutely fantastic excellent choices of songs for appropriate scenes.I must have watched this movie a thousand times one of my favourite films of all time, this is a classic for me. 11 out of 10 :) excellent top film. it makes you laugh and it makes you cry. Baz Luhrmann has created a masterpiece there is nothing else to say it is just bloody brilliant !

I wouldn't necessarily describe Moulin Rouge as a bad film, to me it's just weird. It over the top color and cartoony visuals just kinda turn me away. The only thing that saves this movie in my eyes is the music and the performance of Kidman and McGregor

This is one of my favorite movies of all time since it's original and full of excitements and those gorgeous scenery backdrops of vintage Paris and famous sites (like the Moulin Rouge) is just WOW! The visuals of the movie were really magical and very theatrical and mind blowing. The men and women (especially the lovely Nicole Kidman) have amazing costume designs and I can't really explain how I feel about the whole movie because it is just breathtaking to watch. I've never felt excited to see movies that much until I started watching a trailer for the movie and it had great strong dynamic performances and visuals were I felt I will actually feel like I am anticipating for a movie release which is rarely. The plot was pure genius and had great depth to story telling and the lead actors Ewan and Nicole were truly top notch and their chemistry makes everyone fall in love even more. All of the musical scores and songs sung by the actors were brilliantly done and I would recommend people who have not watched the movie to SEE IT! It is the most amazing thing you will see.

Well, some movie has to be in the very bottom of everyone's ranking list and this film is my choice for the lowest ranked movie I've ever seen.
I really don't know where to start, maybe I just hate musicals. I watched it in 2002 after the film being so hyped. I remember I felt scammed and wanted my money back.

Review title: The worst movie I've seen for a long time
Review_body: OK, there are not a lot of things to say or write about this movie as there are not a lot of things to say or write about it. I just "watched" it a few hours ago and my ears are still aching. This movie is loud. Everybody is yelling and running around. I really cannot say I watched this movie but I tried. And I tried hard. After about 30 minutes I fell asleep. Fortunately the screaming voices of the fat and ugly Moulin-Rouge dancers awoke me. I started forwarding to the next scene that seemed to be of any importance. Unfortunately it was the end. So I got back to the Moulin-Rouge jumping and screaming dancers and tried again to find something interesting. Actually I reduced the rest of the movie (about one hour) to 5 minutes.My tip: Reduce the whole thing to 10 minutes and make a music clip out of it. Or even better: cut all the dancing scenes, just keep McGregor and Kidman as main characters, slow all the pacing down and give it an open end. Oh sorry, someone just told me Dior already had this idea but Ewan McGregor wasn't available for the shooting.My unanswered questions: 1st - Where is the praised passion in this movie? You can find more passion in the eyes of Cary Grant kissing Eva Marie Saint in North by Northwest than in the whole Moulin-Rouge thing. 2nd - What is so sexy about this movie? The naked flesh you see from time to time?I still don't regret to have partly seen the movie. I discovered Ewan McGregor's lovely voice.

Its great a drama movie from beginning till end. Amazing songs. Totally in love with this movie. The actors are so believable in love, it makes me cry Every time I watch this movie. My favourite movie ever!
A stunning treat for the senses with good performances all around.

Excellent movie. I've watched it so many times and I just can't get bored. The music is wonderful and the atmosphere is magical. It's full of symbols like those of the free and caged birds, Toulouse's make up, weather changes, verses from well known melodies. It is difficult to compare it with other musicals but I remember another masterpiece My Fair Lady. I was happy to realize that now the actors were not dubbed anymore, a thing that unfortunately happened to Audrey Hepburn. All the actors were magnificent. Beautiful animations! I really love it! I only wish it could have taken some Oscars but being deeply Australian may be an explanation.

Review title: Moulin Rouge is a film you HAVE to see
Review_body: When the film Moulin Rouge came out in the cinemas in September 2001, I had just turned 12 the month before, and I never really went to the cinema, so I can't think what motivated me to go to see this film. When I saw it****************OH MY GOD****************** I had never come out at the end of a film feeling so....SPARKLY. It left such a magical feeling inside me, which sounds ridiculous because it's just a film. I thought the colours, the detail, the characters and the story were amazing, and the music was out of this world. It was like it was the movie I had been waiting my whole life to see, my dream. Until then I had never heard of any of the actors in it, and I became comically obsessed with all of them. My favourite is Nicole Kidman, she is the best actress ever.

Review title: One of the best non-Disney musicals
Review_body: "The greatest thing you'll ever learn is just to love and be loved in return."Moulin Rouge! is directed by Baz Luhrmann and stars Nicole Kidman and Ewan McGregor. This movie tells the story of a young poet named Christian (Ewan McGregor) who plunges into the insane world of the Moulin Rouge, where he meets and falls in love with the club's most popular and beautiful star, Santine (Nicole Kidman).The only musicals I have ever really enjoyed have come from Disney. I find a musical every now and then that wasn't made by Disney and although I may really enjoy that movie, I have never found one that I have thought was an outstanding movie. That has now changed. Moulin Rouge! surpassed my expectations and I have definitely say that in my opinion, this is an outstanding movie. The songs where all great and memorable, the acting was fantastic and the movie itself looked amazing!My main issue with musicals is that I find that many of the songs begin at awkward times, the songs aren't memorable enough to remember and that many musicals have songs that I simply don't like. All of the songs in Moulin Rouge! are great and are all very memorable! All of the songs fit what is going on at that moment in the movie. One thing I would like to say is, who the hell knew that Ewan McGregor and Nicole Kidman had such great singing voices? They should definitely show off their talent more often!The songs in this film were great and so was the acting. I have only seen a couple of movies starring Nicole Kidman and Ewan McGregor before watching this and I definitely want to watch more of their movies! They both put on great performances in this film as Santine and Christian! Their chemistry was great and I would like to see them work together again in the future on another movie! We also can't forget about the performances from the rest of the cast, especially Jim Broadbent and Richard Roxburgh, who I definitely think deserve more credit than what they get! Richard Roxburgh was great as the The Duke and Jim Broadbent as Harold Zidler was a crazy performance and was one of the best supporting actor performances I have seen in a while!Moulin Rouge! was a very bizarre, crazy, depressing, happy, exciting, emotional experience. I have not enjoyed a film this much in a while! I know that not everybody will agree with my opinion as there are a lot of people out there that don't like this movie but if you haven't seen it, I personally highly recommend it! It is definitely one of my favorite musicals that isn't made by Disney, one of my all time favorite romance films (a genre I don't enjoy that much so I'm surprised I enjoyed this film so much) and one of my favorite films! This is a very different film but it's one that I don't think you should pass on!

This is a beautiful motion picture, which takes us to the fantastic and magical world of the Moulin Rouge. The music, the dancing, the plot, everything is just delicious. If you didn't watch the movie yet, don't wait any longer... go, rent it, buy it or something and watch it, because it is worth it. Moulin Rouge is my favorite movie... it's a "must see". I hope you like it. It's Wonderful. I am very sad as I didn't watch it in the "Big-screen", but I have seen it twenty or more times. I can't help myself, I'm always singing the songs that are sang in the movie. Ewan MacGregor and Nicole Kidman are the perfect couple for this one!

This. This. This. Words. Uh. The greatest cinematic love story I've ever seen. The greatest song score ever produced. The proof that 2001 was one of the strongest years in history, and that Oscar rarely notices true greatness. For proving that rationality is a unnecessary bitch, that tension and music are as needed as anything and especially at the same time. And for proving that a happy ending can be anything you can imagine, with everything collapsing to the ground at once, eyes watching, hearts stopping, you think, no, and then... :fade to white: A film I didn't expect to love, a film I didn't expect to stay within my soul. Yet here we are. A+

I never knew I could love a movie as much as I do Moulin Rouge. Honestly. People like what they like, but I am tired of hearing people say stuff like, "It's so weird." People who have no basis for their comments sound undereducated and closed-minded. Baz Luhrmann is an excellent director because he doesn't care about making generic movies that are not memorable. You can always tell he is the director when you see one of his films and I love that about them. Nicole and Ewan and the rest of the cast are perfect in their roles, too. I absolutely love the music they picked for the movie and that makes it fun to watch. LOVE IT!

Wow. That is my general opinion of this movie. I thought it was absolutely wonderful! It is beautiful and artistic! The costumes, music, storyline, and actors are beautiful. I loved every aspect of this movie! It was great. I love the passion and how it can make a person laugh at the same time! Nicole Kidman is an astonishing actress! She definitely brings beauty and life to the movie!! I really like how part of the storyline is almost silently revealed at the beginning of the movie. It is so very sad, and it makes me cry every time I watch it. Satine's death is so very sad!It truly is a powerful movie and it deserves to be highlighted by those who love, like, and maybe even adore it! Once again, I say that Nicole Kidman is wonderful in this movie, and she and Ewan McGregor have wonderful chemistry throughout the entire story. All the songs have wonderful placement in the film, and I absolutely adore "Come What May." It's a beautiful song, and it represents everything that everyone hopes for in life and in love. So...if anyone who hasn't seen this movie is reading this, I recommend this movie with every fiber of my being!!

Review title: Come what may love is endless
Review_body: an amazing film, too great to be real. what i love the most is the love story. the way Christian describes his feelings, the way they dance, the way they feel in general! although the ending is indeed ever so sad the movie is excellent! how Satine is dying as she is unaware of it, she still loves Christian with all her heart. we should be lovers, come what may are songs that i fully enjoyed singing, and listening to as they describe what real love feels like. as well the settings of this movie a brilliant and so are the costumes. i could watch it for ever and never get tired of it. i have to tell you i really dislike the duke he just wants what he likes the most even if that person doesn't like him, he doesn't really care as long as he's got satine he's happy. very selfish from him isn't altought the actor who plays the duke does it amazingly great! well to conclude this film i would like to say that what i love most of it is this quote 'the greatest thing you'll ever learn is just to love and to be loved in return'

Review title: Could watch this movie forever and ever....
Review_body: Only one word can describe this movie: extraordinary. This movie is not like ordinary movies its exraordinary. The background is great but only the that really matters in a movie like this is the story, no story really equals no movie. The story doesn't fail and neither does anything else in this movie. The songs are brilliant the acting is brilliant, everything is brilliant.Not looking at the art aspect of this look at the acting aspect. It had Nicole Kidman and Ewan MCgregor. Even though some things may seem a little but weird, in the long run the offness of this movie is whatmakes it extraordinary.

If I was going to be charitable, I'd take into consideration that Baz Luhrmann is not a cinematic director, and most of his experience comes from the theater. Unfortunately, given that Luhrmann did prove that he was capable of making a somewhat competent film with Romeo + Juliet, he gets no sympathy. Luhrmann acts like a child given a complex new toy with no instructions how to use it. Throughout the history of filmmaking, directors influence the attention of the audience by letting the actors' performance naturally become the focus of a scene; Luhrmann apparently regards his actors as too bland or his audience as too dim to understand where attention must be paid. To that end, every single scene is a mess of jump cuts, overused camera tricks and forced, ham-fisted acting. Shaky/walking cam? Check. Lens flares? Cartoonish sound effects? Soft focus? Multiple angles of the same scene? D-r-a-m-a-t-i-c-a-l-l-y s-l-o-w-e-d d-o-w-n m-o-v-e-m-e-n-t and RAPIDLYSPEDUPACTION? Fade-ins, fade-outs repeatedly breaking the fourth wall? Check, check, double-check. All of these happening once in a movie is enough to wreck it, but these happen so often it's as if Luhrmann was just goofing around in a consumer-level video editing software with a bunch of footage from other films.The result is not a fulfilling journey into an otherworldly and hallucinogenic world, but a wearying, tedious slog through a vile bastardization of turn-of-the-millennium pop culture and hackneyed film tricks.It's not even campy fun.

Moulin Rouge is a refreshing break from today's world of test-marketed, demographically targeted, homogonized hollywood garbage.  Loosely based around the myth of Oprheus, it's obviously the realization of Baz's dream rather than the result of committees and rewrites based on test screening report cards.The first half of the movie is dazzling and inventive, shockingly fun and surprisingly light on its feet.  The movie slows a bit in the second half and gets more serious, but for me it still pulled it off quite nicely. Sure, it doesn't succeed all the time, and I would have edited it down about 10 minutes (mostly in the rehersal for the show-within-the-show), but so what?  This is not a *perfect* film, this is a *very, very good* film.I completely understand why some people don't like Moulin Rouge.
