The raw passion of this movie makes you feel the emotions of the characters as though you were there with them. The dancing and singing are fantastic. As far as I'm concerned, the story in Moulin Rouge is the best love story in the world, and beats out even Romeo and Juliet. This movie has everything, even humour, which I wasn't expecting. I completely loved it and recommend it to anyone.

Review title: Most amazing, better than The Notebook
Review_body: I hate musicals usually. and i had scene the ending twice before wanting to the whole movie until my neighbor wanted me to watch it. After the first viewing i couldn't stop singing the songs. Amazingly enough i own the movie and watch probably twice a week. If you are looking for a romance movie but is fun and outspoken this is the movie for you. I am actually watching the movie right now. Whats amazing about this movie is that Christian (Ewan McGregor) ruins the movie in the beginning but you forget he's telling the story. You will be amazed at how this movie was put together extremely fast in the beginning and slows down dramatically in the middle so you get lost in this story. I recommend someone doing a sequel because after you see it you don't want it to end. I recommend buying the Soundtracks or you will be depressed.

This review is about truth, beauty, freedom, and, above all things, love. The truth-better films are made by film makers who aren't concerned with ticket sales, just their vision. The beauty-well, that's the film itself. The freedom-we must allow films to take us places. And love-that's all we really need, but it can't conquer all.As a film "critic", I try to keep myself at a distance from the films I review, but every now and then, I see a movie that I become totally enthralled with. "The Shawshank Redemption" is one of these movies, and "Moulin Rouge" is the latest ."Moulin Rouge" is simply one of the most pleasant movie-watching experiences I've ever had, since Ive extensively started watching film in 1995. It is a bewildering, magical, funny, touching, and romantic tale that combines the four ideals that I expounded upon on the outset of this review. Director Baz Luhrman (Romeo + Juliet) has blown me away once again. At it's simplest, "Moulin Rouge" is a rock musical, featuring everything from Nirvana to old school Madonna to the Police, and it all fits PERFECTLY. After I saw its soundtrack listing, I bought the CD, and it has been getting nonstop rotation in my player ever since. But labeling "Moulin Rouge" as a musical limits it, because it's a visual dream and sometimes nightmare."Moulin Rouge" tells the story of Christian (played magnificently by Ewan McGregor), a naive young writer who preaches the four, before-mentioned, ideals like they are his personal creed, because, quite simply, they are. Due to an impromptu meeting with four Bohemian musical writers, especially a dwarf (don't ask), played by John Leguizamo, Christian gains access to the titular nightclub, where he meets the club's "sparkling diamond", Satine (Nicole Kidman), a performer/courtesan, who instantly enraptures our young protagonist. The only problem is that Satine has been promised, exclusively, to the Duke of Worcester, who has promised that as long as Satine is his, he will fund the Moulin Rouge. Also, as we, the audience, are shown early on, Satine is slowly dying from tuberculosis. Not surprisingly, this is a recipe for disaster, but Luhrman stages it all with a fun house intensity that never stops until the end credits roll.I only have one regret after seeing "Moulin Rouge", and that's the fact that I will never have the experience of seeing it for the first time again, because it truly is an experience. The first thirty minutes speeds along at almost a sickening pace, much to the point that people nationwide have reportedly walked out. Good. If they can't take it, I don't want them. What Baz Luhrman has made here is nothing short of a masterpiece. It's that good. It is the closest thing I have ever seen capture what it truly means to be in love. As one of my movie-watching companions honestly stated: "I want to fall in love like that."Also, I'm kind of bias about the movie, because it stars the love of my life, Ms. Kidman. When she first appears in the movie, dropping from the heavens on a swing, I started swooning. Her performance was the best I've ever seen of her, at that's saying a lot, but every actor in the movie fit his/her role perfectly, and that all comes back to the director.Not much more can be said of the director, Baz Luhrman, but after seeing "Pearl Harbor" last week, there's truly a contrast. In "Pearl Harbor", you had a director and producer who were aching to create another "Titanic"/ "Saving Private Ryan" in order to win the awards which their film won't even be nominated. In "Moulin Rouge", you have a director who, quite adamantly, put his heart, soul, and every fiber of his being into his film. You can tell how much he loved making this movie in every frame of it. Well, if you haven't guessed it yet, I really liked "Moulin Rouge", and, if nothing else, I leave you with a quote from the film. "The greatest lesson you'll ever learn is to love and be loved in return." I love this movie.

i think moulin rouge was a real break through film,perhaps ahead of it's time. i'm surprised it isn't a huge hit. although in an age of middle of the road hollywood films, where car chase scenes, and gore rule, it could be just to original, and artsy for most folks. at first i thought i would be annoyed by the cover songs, but much to my surprise, i found them very well done. visually this movie is incredible. i loved the cast, especially nicole kidman, she looked like old hollywood star's did. i was delighted by her comedy sexual antics. great spoofy edge to the whole film. it was a bit like gilbert and sullivan meets busby berkley on acid. i felt like i had been there for the summer of love. a must for anyone who likes theater, or musicals, incredible sets, great dancing, the costumes were oscar worthy as was the set design. if i had trouble with any part of it, perhaps the editing required a seat belt. i loved it.

very visual, great songs, the acting was superb. nicole kidman and ewan mcgregor belong together in this film. great costumes and its a must see film!!! enjoy this film, you will experience a high and the "love" they felt for each other.

I've watch it ten times so far and I'm not one bit tired of it!! The songs stay in your head long after the credits are done. I for one am still singing 'Your Song'. Who knew Ewan McGregor and Nicole Kidman could sing?!? To everybody, go watch it even if you hate musicals and you'll change your mind!!Can't wait for the DVD!!

It all started in 1899 when Christian (Ewan McGregor), a young English poet, travels to Paris to pursue his writing career. Soon after arriving in Paris, he meets a group of Bohemians that talk him into writing a musical that would be performed at the Moulin Rouge, the most famous underworld night club in Paris. Later on, Christian had a meeting setup with Satine (Nicole Kidman), the courtesan of the night club. Christian meets with Satine and he falls head over heels in love with her, as she does him, but there was one small problem. Satine was told by Harold Zidler (Jim Broadbent), the club's owner, that she was meeting with the Duke (Richard Roxburgh). The Duke was interested in investing in the club and to make Satine a real actress for a small price, to have Satine in his possession forever. Satine was thrilled to have fallen in love with the Duke, until she realized it was not him, instead she had fallen for a penniless writer.
Love is the central and most powerful theme of Moulin Rouge. Not only is it shown between two people, but it is also shown with Satine and the other dancers at the Moulin Rouge. They are all in love with the thought of being real stars one day that they will do anything to get there, including work in a night club. The director of the movie does a wonderful job making love the central theme with lighting and angles. The lighting dims around the background activity and extra lighting goes onto the characters during intense romantic scenes. Also, the director films at many different angels in the movie. He switches between first person angles and third person angles. He does this to allow you to not only feel the main characters emotions, but you also get to feel the background characters emotions. The movie, Moulin Rouge, will take you on a crazy journey of love and grief, and will have your eyes glued to the television the entirety of the film.

Nicole Kidman and Ewan McGregor are fantastic actors, but come on!  How is this movie supposed to hold anyone's attention?  And I must disagree with other viewers, those constant references to modern songs are real groaners. I kept waiting for the cacophony to stop, but it never did.  Eventually I had to switch it off.Ideal for people who like listening to two radio stations at once.

This is my new favorite movie. I loved it. My cousins had told me they had loved it. So they invited me to see it with them. It was probably the best movie I had ever seen. I thought I had loved movies before. But they all look like garbage now that I have seen this. The only thing that comes even close to this is Disney's "The Lion King", which is nothing like Moulin Rouge, but is the closest I can think of to pure excellence other than MR.Even though I had seen the plot a million times before, it was special this time. The costumes, cinematography, coloring, etc. were all great. But nothing could compare to the singing. Nicole Kidman was terrific. But Ewan McGregor was exceptional. His voice had just melted in my heart. His voice itself actually made me cry(and I rarely cry), not just the movie(which is sad). I loved the way they would use modern songs. They fit so well. I especially loved "Like A Virgin", which was very funny.So overall, this is an excellent movie. *10 out of 10*!!!!! See it!!! Many, many times!!!

unique combination of la boheme, phantom of the opera, and rocky horror picture show.  i laughed at all of the current songs used in an 1899 setting, but started enjoying the movie when the characters became interesting.  Great production numbers, but still maybe more of a strange movie than a unique one.

I just thought to elave my comment on this film!This is a film of few, not many films have such an affect on people globally, its within the exclusive group of films that will live a lifetime including grease and dirty dancing, in my personal opinion of course many people may disagree.Nicole kidman and Ewan Mcgregor played their roles so realistically which is normally hard for many actors and actresses and to sing also many of the Hollywood A list would struggle. This film i have watched over and over and never get bored, it has changed my view on love and life , and although many people will disagree because its what they do, i think this is one of the greatest films of all time

Review title: Few words to a great film
Review_body: This film is excellent, although my English is not... But I want to say that Ewan McGregor and Nicole Kidman have great voices and Moulin Rouge is one of the best musicals I have ever seen. I agree that they are very talented and carismatic movie stars but I have a complain. I want more CDs and films with Ewan and Nicole singing!

Review title: Beautiful,Brilliant masterpiece!! one of my favorite Musicals!!
Review_body: Moulin Rouge is brilliant, the excitement of this movie keeps you on the edge of your seat at all times. It is a beautiful love story that is not a typical situation which makes it even better. The music is amazing and most of the songs people are familiar with which makes it even better. The costumes and makeup really set the tone and allow you to imagine what it would be like if you were attending a show at the Moulin Rouge. This film is very different from most musicals and i think that's what sets it apart. The biggest take away from this film is that it is very entertaining and you can watch it over and over again. Would deffinantly comment this movie to anyone!

The problem I had with Moulin Rouge is that it almost seems like Luhrmann shot two movies - one good, one bad - and had a blind person splice them together. The romance between McGregor and Kidman is very good, the chemistry is excellent. Their stuff works. What doesn't is the over the top musical numbers, especially the "Like A Virgin" number - oy, vey what was Baz thinking on that one? Cut about one-third of the musical numbers and the movie would rate around an 8.

Keeping true to his extravagant filmic style, Baz most definitely has created a fantastic piece in Moulin Rouge!  This is quite possibly one of the most beautiful love stories I have come across, thus far in my career as a film student.  Don't listen one minute to the uptight "professional" critics who declare this piece is "ruined" because of the abrupt editing style it has adopted.  The music is phenomenal, and the acting is superb. If you haven't experienced Moulin Rouge yet, go...NOW!  And, I hope you enjoy it as much as I did!

Review title: Brilliant, visually stunning and completely spellbinding
Review_body: Now THAT'S entertainment! What a brilliant production by Baz Luhrmann (Director & Writer) and Craig Pearce (Writer). Congratulations to all Crew and Cast, this movie will go down in my book as one of the best ever. The visual impact of this movie held me from start to end. Musically the combining of all the different eras was just spellbinding. Nicole and Ewan were magic together. There were times when I felt the need to clap the performances. To me - 10 out of 10. Can't wait for the stage show!!!!!

Ignore the media critics who are more than willing to applaud the particulars of Moulin Rouge, but seem afraid to simply say "I liked it" (e.g. Joe Morgenstern's review in the Wall Street Journal).  This is a brilliant, unique, wonderful, satisfying movie experience.  You can't just watch this film, you get involved in it.  For maximum benefit, set aside your expectations and give yourself over to the mezmerizing joy of this exceptional work of art.

I'm writing from Italy. Is the first time I write something here, so, apologize me for my english and all the rest, ok? Moulin Rouge is one, or perhaps THE MOST, beautiful film I've ever seen... full of poetry, imagination, it's fresh, well done and directed and actors are really great!!!... overall, my favorite one: Nicole!!. Music is fantastic, with some reminiscences of "The sound of Music" with another great, Julie Andrews!!. The biggest tribute that cinema has given to itself!!

Fresh to the scene, young writer, Christian played by Ewan McGregor arrives in 1899 Paris, France. Christian connects with the theater troupe and lands a job writing an extravagant musical play to be performed by the local artists and ladies of the evening. One of which is Satine played by Nicole Kidman. Christian falls in love with Satine - Satine is cautious because her business is to sell love, not fall in love. Enter The Duke, played by Richard Roxburgh, who will fund the theater endeavor. Aside from his investment, he wants Satine, who will be the star of the play, to become his lover. Satine goes along with the proposal for the sake of the play; however, she is not interested romantically in The Duke. Satine falls for Christian the writer, true love. Despite the fact, Christian doesn't have a penny to his name. The Duke becomes jealous, and mayhem is afoot. The audience is left wondering, will Satine go to The Duke or Christian. There's an element of dramatic irony as the audience knows that Satine's days are limited as she is inflicted with the consumption, otherwise known as tuberculosis. Satine remains on the fence as to reveal her true feelings. The Duke increases the stakes stating he will have Christian killed if she doesn't go along with the original agreement to be The Duke's lover. Satine agrees to stay with The Duke to protect Christian, leaving him confused and heartbroken. Christian's theater friends contribute to a jumble of events during the opening night of the play. After the dust settles, Satine is in Christian's arms.The theme of this film is that one cannot purchase true love. When a person pays for intimacy, there will always be doubt if it was given truthfully. If there is doubt, how can there be trust, and without trust, there is no love. To complicate matters, The Duke invests his own money to produce the musical play expecting more than ticket sales in return; I.E., Satine's affection. Hanging in the balance are the theater actors yearning for the show to go on. ¾ of the way into the film, Satine is told by Moulin Rouge's manager, Mr. Zidler played by Jim Broadbent that she is dying from consumption, otherwise known as tuberculosis.
Another film with a similar theme is entitled, Indecent Proposal produced in 1993. Indecent Proposal has the same theme in attempting to buy love for a million dollars. This film has a bit of a twist, in that the main character, Robert Redford, approaches a married couple asking the husband if he can have a one-night affair with the wife.There are a plethora of cinematic elements that unite the film. During the tango scene, theater spotlights were used on the dancers to create harsh illumination on their faces and crisp shadows. This heightens the tension between the characters and dilemma as to the outcome for who Satine will choose, The Duke or Christian. The musical number where Satine is lowered from the ceiling on a swing, upon which the camera circles around her quickly every 360 degrees, reveals the audience full of men, yearning for her attention. This accentuates the frenzy of the performance.Many books and films attempted portray the notion of buying love, hoping, thinking, wishing it would be successful. We see this presented across many genres and for a vast array of target audiences. One could say that this theme is universally appealing and intriguing. As an audience member, we're compelled to watch because we're hoping this would be the one time they solved this dilemma.

Recently no film has touched me so much, emotionally, since Green Mile. Very convincing and penetrative performances by the entire cast. It's a pity that the film will lose some of its greatness when viewed at home. It is truly a magical experience to be had at the cinema. One of the best films of the year.

Review title: Haven't stopped thinking about it since the premiere...
Review_body: Truly one of the most unique theatre experiences of my life... the humor, music, drama, and visual thrills suck you out of your seat and twirl you around for two hours before setting you back down so you can sit and just say "Whoa" like Keanu.  Some might dismiss it as escapist... I embrace it as such.

Review title: The most capturing, amazing and most exciting love story ever!
Review_body: Mouling Rouge is the most beautiful love story I have ever seen. It has charm, magic, love, perfect directing and cutting... And the voice. Ewan McGregor is an emotional actor. He expresses emotions like no other actor before him. In "Moulin Rouge", he does it through singing! He expresses so much emotion in his singing, it shows how great an actor and a singer he is. Nicole Kidman is captivating, but easily draws second next to the charm, the voice and the talent that is Ewan McGregor. This story is not a movie. It is a dream. For two and a half hours it's like your sucked into Christian's mind, and you watch his dream. The most romantic dream ever.

Review title: Never in 28 years as a movie-goer...
Review_body: Never in 28 years as a movie-goer have I heard a packed cinema stand and clap at the end of a film.  What a feeling this movie generates, a visually spectacular (spectacular!) experience with a beautiful story line and a love to last the ages.  The use of modern day songs and lyrics kept the audience amused and at the edge of their seat to see what song they could recognise next.  And who knew that Ewan McGregor and Nicole Kidman could sing? These were the words whispered while filing out of the cinema by hundreds of movie goers through their now subsiding tears.  The whole cast surely surprised and mesmerised alot of people with their seemingly unlimited talent but none more-so than Nicole and Ewan.  This movie was beautiful in every way and I would strongly recommend it to all ages.  I loved this film and believe if the promotion of it is right it may become of Sound of Music notoriety.

Review title: Great Movie, Superb From Start To Finish.
Review_body: What a movie, gripped from the opening seconds.  A real rollercoaster, you get sucked into the characters straight away.  Ewan Mcgregor can sing quite well, as can Nicole Kidman.  Fast editing, and a thumping soundtrack, keep you glued to the opening 10 minutes, getting you intrigued into this strange world that is before you.  The plot is simple and easy to follow, good fun, and very touching.In all if you liked Shakespeare in Love and Romeo and Juliet, you will love this. If you like classic modern songs, you will love this (see the old men singing Smells Like Teen Spirit).Great fun, go and see it, take a girl, she will love it too.

Moulin Rouge was definitely a surprise packet.  The unexpected 'Sound of Music' outburst by Ewan McGregor had the packed cinema bewildered at the beginning of the story, but the appearance of Kylie Minogue as the green shot fairy was entertaining and unexpected.  Nicole Kidman provided a suberb performance as Satine, with her wonderful rendition of 'Diamonds are a girl's best friend' which was delivered with a deep yet beautiful voice. Moulin Rouge was a cross between 'Romeo and Juliet' and 'Strictly Ballroom' with it's brightly coloured sets and wicked sense of humour.  This movie is definetly a must see!

What I liked is that Baz thinks outside the genre of what a musical should or could be.Credit should also go towards the editor/s, but I wonder if there were a few too many cuts (didn't want to blink in case I missed something).Enjoyed the cinematography, design and costuming immensely, with Satine the courtesan, based on the Orpheus myth...and there is a definite buzz about Baz.Good luck to all when nominations are announced in the various award ceremonies.

Everyone should see Moulin Rouge. It was so extraordinary and what an experience! Everything was great, the style, the color, the story, the acting, the costume, and of course the MUSIC! If your not a musical fan, still just come along for the ride even just for the experience. This is a movie unlike anything you've ever seen, you will be blown away just like what happened to me.

Review title: Best of the Year!!! Must be Seen in a theater
Review_body: Moulin R is a movie about love. This is a type of film that have to be experience.Some people might complain that the film is full of cliches and is overblown but that's the appeal of the film, it acknowledges how love sometimes become silly and trite and how we still celebrate it in spite or because of it. This film reaffirms that no matter how silly love is, no matter how we know it might hurt us, how cliched it is, we can't deny that we'd rather experience it.This film is beautifully made with great acting from Nicole, Ewan and all the other Supporting Casts especially Jim Broadbent. The editing is wonderful, the art direction, the costume, the songs, acting and the Directing deserve to be acknowledged come the Academy Awards.One of the best film I've ever had the pleasure to experience in my life, Moulin Rouge is a sure front runner for the Best Picture of the Year! (it would be a shame if its not acknowledge)My rate for MR, 11 out of 10

I had total changed my mind about Nicole Kidman. She's not bounced any more between man-desired target, or just a blurred female character. McGregor has such a wonderful voice that he might referred him as  "talented". Watching this movie would be a wonderful experience if you are a fan of Broadway. Though the story has been displayed out in the first place, people would still rather pay for it for the dazzling costume, background design, and for the most of all, the love story. Due to the great performance of Jim Broadbent, and the way the camera moved, laughter filled the front part of this movie. Spectacular movie, spectacular recommended.

Review title: Over produced and unmemorable - is Baz Luhrmann... Mel Brooks?
Review_body: Baz Luhrmann's long awaited film Moulin Rouge has been unleashed - and what an unmemorable, over produced disappointment.The curtains opened and I waited for an innovative and spectacular movie experience. Presented instead with what might as well have been Mel Brooks meets 'The Sound of Music' (complete with table cloth 'Mother Mary style' on the fat man singing 'Like a Virgin').Jim Broadbent is excellently cast as Zidler (the owner of the Moulin Rouge). Satine (Nicole Kidman) as the head dancer/courtisan/actor gives her very best but ultimately her performance (and lip-synching) is lack lustre. Richard Roxburgh playing The Duke of Monroth is unbelievable having no authority or presence on the screen.If an unoriginal cheesy sound track with manic edits, motion sickness inducing cinematography and Mel Brooks style humor is your cup of tea, you'll love it.One star out of five.

Review title: Not likely to be anything like this again
Review_body: I'd just like to add my voice to the majority who loved this movie. Definitely the best movie I've seen in at least the last five years (and I go to the movies around 100 times a year).  I've seen the movie five times in five days and will probably wind up back at the Ziegfeld tonight.  Went with two friends last weekend and they HATED the movie.  But there you are. And though I see that most love this movie, I'd be interested in knowing if I'm the only idiot who's paying to see it again and again.  And here in NYC, it's $10 a pop!

Review title: A series of skits incoherently jumbled together.
Review_body: I am one of those people who is often sucked in by the hype surrounding a film and as such when it fails to live up to the publicity I can sometimes become very disappointed.Moulin Rouge, at least in Australia, was hyped to the hilt. Posters with declarations like "This is a story about Love", "This is a story about Truth" were around for months. The movie advertisements promised plenty with high octane editing, magnificent costumes and an overwhelming visual and aural energy. The publicity promised a story as sensual and passionate as the images and sounds the film contains. As such I went in with high expectations of something that would grab me by the throat and drag me into the seady, sexy, dirty, passionate world of the Moulin Rouge. I wanted to become involved, I wanted to see the pure, simple Christian become defiled and debased as he was seduced by Satanic Temptress Satine. I wanted unfair brutality thrown in the face of kindness, complexity into the face of simple ideals and to be burnt by dirty human characters not bored by the flaky caricateurs I see in this film.The storyline goes like this: Christian, poor writer from London comes to Montmartre Paris presumably to bathe himself in the (allegedly) bohemian atmosphere and lifestyle, the epicentre of which was located at the Moulin Rouge. At the Moulin Rouge he spots Satine, weird red headed woman and star of the Moulin Rouge show. Christian is smitten and in quick time (and thanks to an implausible "twist of fate") winds up meeting the courtesan. Within a few short minutes the two amorous beasts are "in love".But how could it ever be so simple? Christian can't have Satine without a bit of a custody battle ensuing between himself and the vaudevillian Duke of Worcester, and of course Satine coming down with a "tragic" case of tuberculosis. It all gets too irritating and too stupid. Humourless lines like "You have to hurt him to save him" are juxtaposed against (occasionally hilarious) covers like Madonna's Like a Virgin, which contrasts with the deadly serious Your Song, and the menacing Roxanne. All in all the film should probably leave most in the audience cold, but I doubt it will. More like a fireworks show set to music it can't be seen as a regular movie but more as a series of loosely connected skits, some of which work on their own, some of which don't, but taken all together they just don't fit properly. The performances apart from Nicole Kidman's are all pretty good, although there is little to no chance for real character development. Richard Roxburgh is probably the highlight with his comical exasperation one of the few emotions you can actually understand and identify with.

This movie was brilliant...and even better the 2nd time around.  It is truly what one goes to the movies for; to be transported to another time and place.  You hate to leave when it's over.  Please, please, marvel in it's excitement and love of movie-making.  I hope more directors have the courage to make movies that are out of the mainstream Hollywood standard.

Review title: A kaleidoscope of colour, movement and drama.
Review_body: I don't like musicals but I loved Moulin Rouge. How many movies do you walk out at the end wishing to see again? This is definitely one to see again (and again).Baz Luhrmann has created a film work of art that sets a new standard for others to strive for. It's not possible to take it all in in one sitting.  Like a perfect feast! Nicole Kidman and Ewan McGregor are outstanding in their leading roles and Nicole has the beauty of a translucent pearl (Tom who?).See Moulin Rouge and weep for any love you ever had and lost.

i loved the Moulin rouge it was sad but at the same time funny and Christian sung like an angel (sigh) i just loved it. I never new that Nicole Kidman could sing that well she was really good the songs went really well with her voice. I think she played the part really well especially at the beginning she made a really good "sparkling diamond". i thought that the duke did a really good job i found him quit scary at times. He had really good facial expressions. Christian had a really sweet sort of charm to him and made me feel sort of in way nervous for him but as soon as he started to sing that just slipped away. He gave me goose bumps every time he started singing especially the hills are alive with the sound of music line and the this is mine song. All up i thought it was a fun enjoyable film with a really good story line and the people playing the characters were chosen perfectly.

Baz Luhrmann has taken the formula of classic musicals from a bygone era and injected them with a HUGE shot of adrenalin (or absinthe) to bring us "Moulin Rouge". And what a cinematic experience! There's lots of color, noise and movement that is almost too much to take at times, and it will leave you gasping for breath. I could go on and on here, but I won't. My advice is just to go and see it and judge for yourself. You won't be disappointed. Baz and 20th Century Fox should now be negotiating "Moulin Rouge 2".

I know this is probably one of those love it or hate it movies...but I'm just here to give my opinion. I thought it was one of the most amazing films I have ever seen. Everything about it just fit together perfectly. I would recommend it to anyone that has an open mind and is looking to be blown away...if not by the plot and dialogue, then at least by the set design and direction.

A story about truth, beauty, freedom, and love And loving it is hardly a challenging task when this magical story is displayed on the screen. Moulin Rouge throws a surprising twist on what seems to be an overused theme of "love" in Hollywood. Is it overused? Well, after watching this film, I found myself reconsidering the meaning of "love" as a cinematic theme and concluded that my previous definition was to be taken off the shelf; it is now well expired.It is a movie I entered with ambivalent to low expectations. For all I knew, I was in for another ride down the musical roller coaster, and this one was going to make me really sick ("oh no, here comes another long song about love, where's the barf bag?") Instead, I was treated to one of the most phenomenal stories ever captured on film, told with such creativity and originality that I knew there had to something wrong with it. How am I so easily falling for this fantasy/comedy/musical/drama/documentary(wait, did I say documentary? Well yes, this was a fantastic narrative that was really told biographically, so in a "let's-not-get-too-technical-about-film-terms" sort of way, was a fictional documentary).And I thought I'd seen and heard it all just when I realized, "wait, I did." Most all of the songs performed were readapted famous singles already made famous by such artists as Elton John, Madonna, The Police, and Nirvana, yet I found every performance to be beyond delightful, entertaining, amusing, and most of all, inventive; these performances pieced together every mood of the story, collectively seducing me, and with no sense of time, I was in love with this movie.Moulin Rouge sets not only a standard for musicals but a standard for the entire film industry. When the next movie comes along with musical performances that seem to actually improve the original song, more than impressive booming vocal performances by the two leads, a story that carries the viewer a fantasy world that for once feels so real, I'll be the first person to buy the ticket. But wait, on second thought, I must keep in mind the old saying, "if it ain't broke, don't fix it." This film deserves to be that single original gem, and should never be sought to be improved, recreated, or just copied in the form of another "unoriginal film", instead, this cinematic achievement should be set aside and just appreciated and glorified for all that it has accomplished.

Review title: Visual Feast and master expression of deconstructionizm
Review_body: A beautifully executed visual feast.Let me just say that this movie has no original pieces in the whole movie. However, the originality of the movie comes through in its unique and post-modern arrangement of the other people's creations without becoming overly cliché.The basic plot of the story is simple; boy meets a girl, boy falls in love with the girl, some conflict, and resolution.However, with its master cinematography and customs, this movie shines.I had two problems with the movie. The first 10 min of the movie is just too confusing and annoying. It can be seen as a techno. aspect of the movie, But I didn't like it.Secondly, to overcome awkwardness of musical, they used a lot of popular in-pop music. While this added to the humor and will appeal to teen-agers, little less pop-music and more original arrangement could have made this movie solid 10 for me.Overall, a great meal that satisfies your mind as well as your taste buds.

When I started to watch this movie I got scared at the beginning. I was thinking "oh no, not another stupid, bad made movie" and I was about to just leave. But it got to me, grasping me harder and after a while I was sitting and enjoying a movie like I haven't done in a long time. This movie is extraordinary and I have only one word for it, "Love". I love it. Maybe it's because I'm a sucker for music but this movie is combining both decent acting and a great variety of songs. If you like musicals then go and see this. It's one of the best movies out there for the moment.

Review title: Marvellous postmodern pastiche and surprising singing skills.
Review_body: Moulin Rouge was a joy to watch.  I had not seen any previews or advertisements for the film, but had seen the John Huston film of the same title about Henri de Tolouse-Latrec.  This film, while sharing the title, was not about Tolouse-Latrec, but about love and, more importantly, about the power of the narrative.  This postmodern pastiche of song lyrics and stunningly dynamic images reinforced the concept that our lives, emotions, and actions are all the story that we are constantly writing.  Some great symbolic actions, such as the character Chocolate catching Nicole Kidman's character twice, once literally and once figuratively, highlighted the idea that the lives of the characters were text.  Other uses of narrative as reality, songs used as dialogue for example, invested the film with wit and meaning.  Ewan McGregor's voice was surprisingly good and Nicole Kidman was no slouch in that department either.  The film also appeals to a wide range of age groups--for the same reasons, too.

Review title: Contemporary music was pointless and why no Art?
Review_body: There is a more than adequate repetoire of music from the turn of the century that would have been entertaining and appropriate to the storyline. The use of contemporary music was pointless and annoying.  However, other than this significant flaw, Moulin Rouge was an entertaining film.  It would have been nice to have some exposure to the wonderful art of the period by Toulouse-Lautrec as he was a significant character in the film.

In my humble opinion this movie will draw a line across the world. There will be two sides. People who love it and people who hate it. I loved it. Go see it right now!!! I did not see one flaw in the entire movie.

I went to this movie not knowing what to expect but I was pleasantly surprised.  In the beginning it seemed like the random complexity of a Fellini film. Once the story line developed, it really came across as a cleverly written musical parody of the past 2 decades of pop-culture music with a love story intertwined.  Nicole Kidman and Ewan McGregor both carried the parts they played well and with great aplomb.  What was really shocking was their voices.  Their screen presence as singers surprised me as I never really pictured either of them as a real vocal talent.Summary:  Good movie (even for the guys to see) and the special effects and cinematography were phenomenal.Trebor

I was so incredibly disappointed.  This was truly a waste of both my time and money, and an insult to the glorious movie musicals of the past.  Not one original song--instead a long strain of every recycled old pop song you never want to hear again.  And the vocalists certainly did not help the matter.  Ewan McGregor, usually an excellent actor, suddenly loses all acting skills as soon as he opens his mouth to sing.  (As to his vocal abilities, he certainly leaves much to be desired.)  Kidman, though making a slightly better showing, was uninteresting and lacking in true vocal training, proving that it takes more than "star power" to have a vocal prowess that can carry a musical.  Definitely not Kidman's best work.  The story itself has potential, and the cinematography is unique and artistic...but the movie goes downhill from there.  This is a devastating mess of a movie.  If you're going to make a musical, for goodness sakes, PLEASE actually write an original musical score, and cast REAL SINGERS, not just "big names." Such a shame--done right, this movie could have been fantastic.

Congrats are due to Baz Luhrman for succeeding in creating a truly modern musical.  I was not sure what to expect going into this film, with so many reviews being very harsh of the fact that modern songs were used in a film that is set in 1899.  Yet, that is precisely what makes the film a "modern" version of the classic musical.  I can't wait to see it again!

I don,t understand why they had to change camera shots so often, but I have seen strobe lights that are slower. Hopefully they didn't spend too much on costumes, as the camera changed so fast the eye could not focus on anything. After 25 minutes of this I started to time the camera changes ( just shows how it held my attention) At this time they changed on average of 2.3 seconds. The opening number was much faster, probably 100 different shots in 38 seconds. If they are nominated for anything it should be for the poor sap that had to splice all those tiny bits of film together.

This movie has immediately gone into the list of my all time favorites, and I think of myself as pretty damn picky. First of all, how cool is Baz Luhrman, who has created such a daring, visionary work of ART. The stars, Nicole and Ewan prove themselves more than equal to the huge stylistic challenge that is given them in this movie. The visuals are stunning,as is the soundtrack (alright, I did get a little bit of motion sickness till I got used to the demands that were being placed on me as an audience member)...The supporting cast is sensational. Who is this guy Richard Roxburg? Where did he come from? I swear I was laughing so hard at his Duke I nearly peed my pants (a real high point for me was a duet of Like a Virgin with Roxburg and British actor Jim Broadbent). I also found the film deeply moving. I was a mess at the end of it. It's like, you make a decision during the film to either go with it or not. Well I went with this film like I haven't done in years. Brilliant, brave movie-making.

Review title: See this movie in the theater so you can get the full effect.
Review_body: The first half hour or so of this movie is completely amazing!!  My date and I both had huge idiotic grins on our faces- my cheeks actually started to hurt from smiling so much.  The fast pace of the movie, the jumpy camera work, and the vibrant colors were stunning.  I really enjoyed the fast dialogue, the clever musical numbers, and the way crazy characters would pop up from random places.  That being said, when the movie calmed down towards the end it lost most of its charm.  It went from being overpowering and engaging to sappy and predictable.  The finale was a letdown: not because of the tragic ending to the love story but because it lacked the intensity that the beginning of the movie led you to expect.

Review title: Best movie I have seen in years...
Review_body: This is a non-stop rollercoaster ride, the best movie I have seen in years. I will not give one second of the movie away, but I will say that this is a movie one can see a thousand times and each time will see something new. Sit back, relax and enjoy this musical and artistic extravaganza.

See this movie. Two hours of kinetic energy that transport you into a world of color, song and dance.  From the opening Twentieth Century Fox titles you know this is going to be a different kind of movie. It dares to clash and stand out and scream and go on and on and on, until you give in to the spectacle, and find yourself just one of the many patrons of the Moulin Rouge staring wide eyed and trying to catch your breath.  Run-ons abound, but that's the point. This film has no periods or commas, no gentle transitions.  It's about constant movement.Besides the glorious dizzy speed, Moulin Rouge is a well constructed and clever story, circling around a love triangle amidst a play that mirrors the events of the production as they unfold.  I was reminded of Tim Robbin's Cradle Will Rock, another great movie that used a production of a play, to reveal and test the convictions of characters.  Both films use art as a reflection of the artist, and the artist as a reflection of his art. Both explore the financial needs of a production giving way to its integrity. The difference between the two is, Cradle is more cerebral, Moulin is more emotional. Hyper-emotional.  Romantic.Moulin Rouge is about love, and what we are willing to sacrifice to keep that love. I loved this movie.

Review title: The best opera I've ever seen
Review_body: One should always be suspicious of promises that something will be "like nothing you've ever seen", but Moulin Rouge is a breathtakingly original work of art.  As I watched it, I could not help thinking that this is what opera is all about.  Everything - the actors, the music, the costumes, the sets, the cinematography - contributes to the development and expression of the story.  The plot is indeed simple, but it is archetypal in its simplicity, and speaks volumes on the themes of the movie - truth, beauty, freedom, but most of all love.  I am reminded of opera because of Wagner's esthetic of trying to create Gesamtkunstwerke - complete works of art - and this movie goes much further toward that ideal than any opera I've ever seen.  Most of the musical numbers are a collage of songs and each snippet that is recognized evokes some distinct memory or emotion.  These are distilled packages of emotion that add to the sea of sensory stimulus that washes over you as the movie unfolds.  The director had a unique vision and surrounded himself with remarkable artists who seem to have been challenged to be at the height of their creativity.  I was stunned by this movie and wept as the last credit rolled by, not because of the sadness of the story, but because it was so beautiful.

This movie was absolutey amazing. It reached all najor points within film. The music was astonishing and the acting and singing absolutey fab! Nicole and Ewan were very chemical in this performance and it was a truly brave step from Baz!
The best movie I've EVER seen! Just can't stop watching it over and over again. It's so funny, romantic, melodic and weird (in good sense).A MUST!

After having now seen this movie twice, I can honestly say that "Moulin Rouge" will go down in history as one of my all-time favorites.  Baz is a cinematic genius and has created a masterpiece.  From beginning to end this movie drew me in, made me think, made me hope, laugh, cry, sing out.  This movie should be seen by everyone.  I realize not everyone will like it but it should at least be given a chance...

Review title: One of the Greatest movies I have ever seen!!!
Review_body: Moulin Rouge has to be one of the greatest movies I have ever seen.  The acting is superb, the characters are all so very lovable, the music is awesome, and Baz Luhrman does an outstanding job of bringing all the different elements of this film together to create a fantastic film!!!  I have seen this movie five times at the theater already, have the soundtrack and plan to buy the movie on DVD.  I recommend this to anyone who likes Musicals and comedies and romances.  This is has to be a four star, two thumbs up, can't miss movie.  I love it!!!!

Review title: Totally moving. A fabulous blend of music, song, cast, and story.
Review_body: I consider myself enough of a fan of mainstream cinema to know what makes a good movie.This is it.Baz Luhrmann and the cast and crew have combined to provide the ultimate musical presentation - you feel like you are actually watching a stage show as part of a theatre audience. The story and its telling are superb (if not new). From the first appearance of the curtain you become gripped by the emotions of the characters AND your own recollections of the various songs included in the magnificent soundtrack.I felt a wave of blissful goosebumps at several points as I was so moved by the performances of Nicole and Ewan (and Jacek Koman as well).Moulin Rouge is a reminder of the power of cinema.

I'm serious. Get over all the crap floating around about how it's cut too fast, it's too colorful, it's got too much music, it's trying to revive an out-dated movie form. Flooey. Sure, there's great camera tricks; unbelieveable production. Overkill, overkill, overkill on all your senses. But that's only to make the solid core - the real story - smack you all the harder when it's ready. God bless Baz, he understands love, and loss, and being human. Go see this movie. Go see it again. Buy the dvd. Consider yourself blessed.

Review title: 20th century answer to the popular opera
Review_body: I keep seeing occasional comments about this film where some under-educated, action film addicted, toxic, cultural cretin thinks this is the worst movie ever.  Ooooh...that just irritates me. Bless their pea-pickin' hearts, they just don't get it.Open your mind. Educate yourself.  I think this is a superior film.  I won't call it a musical.. it is more of the 20th century answer to the popular opera (as in popular drama) of the 18th & 19th centuries before Opera became the exclusive desmesne of the elite.  All my students will be writing essays about this film describing how early modern theatrical movements like Futurism, Dada, Symbolisme, Surrealism, Theatre of Cruelty, and Brecht are used and fused with 20th century popular culture enthythematic contructs to create a coherent and effective whole. I can't wait! Although, I'm sure they will groan. Too bad.I've seen it twice now and I found it even more thrilling the second time around.  The only thing I HATE is that the "soundtrack" is NOT a soundtrack at all.  Many songs are missing or in totally different forms than they are in the film.  Small background pieces are brought to the forefront and central pieces are left out altogether.  The sale of the soundtrack as a soundtrack is a fraud...it's still good but it's not a soundtrack!

Review title: This is a great piece of artistic work!
Review_body: I fell in love with this movie the first time I watched it.  At first the movie felt weird and fast paced.  The catchy songs, beautiful dancing and costumes, and the specticals of the sets were amazing.  The love story of Satine and Christian is timeless and very moving.  I fell in love with Nicole Kidman's character and the way she portrayed Satine.  Both Ewan and Nicole have suprisingly beautiful and passionate voices that the first time I watched the musical, I doubted it was even them singing, like they were actors lip-singing to a pre-recorded tape.  McGregor's final scene with Nicole is the best I've seen him act.  His heart felt emotion he portrayed needs a 2002 Oscar nomination.  He's one of my favorite actors because of that very role.  Nicole Kidman is timeless herself and with this part as Satine under her belt, she'll only be ever more successful in her acting career.

I don't think there's any way I could talk about this movie without gushing to tell you the truth but it was definitely worth my ten bucks to say the least. While I don't think its for everyone this was by far the most fun I've had in a long time. If you're sick of cheesy Hollywood movies take a look at Moulin Rouge. It doesn't try to pretend that its reality but rather takes the art of storytelling to a whole new level, leaving you breathless as the credits roll.

The movie was a lavish blend of acting, singing, and sets.The only warning: most of the fun to be had was identifying the numerous songs - and a vast amount are from the 1980s-1990s - so if you didn't listen to popular music then, you may not pick up on some of the references.

This movie touched my heart. I've never cried at a movie before, ever, until I saw this. Now, I adore the film for it's stunning visual effects, vibrant colours, characters you feel close to, and most of all, it's beautiful story. I definitely recommend this movie to anyone who is a movie buff or anyone who believes in true love. This movie was wonderful and I'm going to be the first in line when it comes out on video!

Review title: can can and modern music set in 1900 France... AWESOME!
Review_body: this was a really good movie. i had heard mixed reviews from my friends and decided i must see it for myself and make my own conclusions... my conclusion? it was "spectacular spectacular" to take a line from the movie.the beginning was hectic and frantic and exciting, and throughout the whole movie, there wasn't a single moment when i wasn't avidly watching the screen to see what was happening or the actors' expressions. the costumes were superb, the setting excellent... i very much recommend it. i loved the way they used modern songs. when i heard nirvana's "smells like teen spirit" i was in shock. when two of the characters starting doing a rendition of madonna's "like a virgin" i cracked up... i couldn't help it! and i loved the way one of the characters sang sting's "roxanne." it was a great movie musical, with lots of comedy AND romance AND drama... in general, it was "a story about beauty, freedom, truth, but above all, love." i'm definitely buying this when it comes out on VHS/DVD.

Review title: Moulin Rouge was the most fascinating movie.
Review_body: Moulin rouge was an awesome movie. I laughed and cried. It was beautifull. The tragic love story between a writer and his dying lover. It was a very artistic movie, and very moving. I cried when I went to theaters to see this movie.

If a movie with a lot a singing en dancing, no action and a huge love story isn't your thing. Don't go to the Moulin Rouge. But if it IS!! This is a movie you must see!You'll recognize a lot of tunes, great acting, great sets and of coarse: a great love story. Beceause that's wat it's all about in Moulin Rouge. Go see it!

I don't think I've seen a movie that mixes vocal music, instrumental music, dance, and imagery so vibrantly and so successfully.  This movie is by far the most exciting musical I've ever seen or been in.  The way that the music and images are constantly moving you along as an audience member is unbelievable.  This movie has the potential to revolutionize the way Hollywood makes movies.  Everything meshes together so well, even the "pop" music, to create the most artistic picture I've seen.  This film shows how movie making can be the greatest art form of them all because it has the chance to combine all other previous forms of artistic expression.  Music, costumes, dances, elaborate sets, beautiful words, and great acting combine to produce a very fulfilling movie.

Review title: This film should down in history as the complete example of form over substance.
Review_body: This film should down in history as the complete example of form over substance.   Although interesting to watch why someone wasted 4 years of his or her life on this film is a mystery.  Baz keeps on about the story when of cause there isn't one - I suppose if he says it often enough he'll convince himself that there was one.  One of his collaborators (or should that be partners in crime) said that the 'story' was decided by the songs that they could licence.Nicole Kidman looked just like Cyble Shepard from some musical she made in the 70's and the 'baddie' Richard Roxburgh was doing a Tim Brooke-Taylor impersonation (from the 'Goodies' and Willie Wonker) Jim Broadbent looked like the Gilbert character from Topsy-Turvy and the great McGregor just looked like he hadn't a clue why he had agreed to do the film.Upon saying that - the sets and costumes were great - but the cinematography... who can tell - as far as I could see there wasn't a shot longer than 20 seconds in a 2-hour film.  That is even worse than that Bruce Willis thing about the asteroid.  As for the F/x you can be the judge.  I've seen better on a pop video - in fact that's what is, a 2-hour pop video.

If Shakespeare could write a new play today, and Cezanne could design the set you might end up with something like "Moulin Rouge".  This is a sweet little nightmarish dream sequence from beginning to end.  The music, interwoven throughout without noticeable effort to chisel it into the plot, was beautifully done.  I was moved to tears by the performances (and this time it wasn't because the acting was terrible). I loved this movie.  It was purely flawless.

The BEST Combination of Art, Music, Pop, Acting ( not to mention directing! ), Action, Seduction, Betrayal, and above all these.... Love, that I have ever seen. The next Rocky Horror picture show cult classic.. You'll burst into song with "the Hills are Alive With the Sound of Music" and "Like a Virgin" at work!

In a time when movies are produced sheerly to make a buck on whatever the "hippest" and most contemporary fad is in effect, Moulin Rouge stands out.
Ewan McGregor and Nicole Kidman deliver stand-out performances--as do John Leguizamo, Jim Broadbent, Richard Roxburgh and well... the whole damn cast was great, really.The story may not be the most original, but the style and deliverance of it is very much so.Baz Luhrmann deserves a great deal of praise for this flawless, beautiful film. A little wild, weird and "out there," but that's what movies are supposed to be, right?Go see the latest Titanic incarnation if it suits you (ahem, Pearl Harbor) or the latest Indiana Jones rip-offs if that's your thing (Mummy Returns and Tomb Raider) or maybe even the new, modernized version of E.T. (A.I.), but for those with a genuine appreciation for film... Check out Moulin Rouge. It is: "Spectacular, Spectacular!"

Review title: Good for the old guys too
Review_body: Some comment has been made that the high ratings map to young people and there may be something to this. My 10 rating is for the pure entertainment value. I think I have seen all of the all time great movies. Moulin Rouge tops the list for entertainment value and that is worth something. It is a good job that my daughter has not seen this because it gives my brother and I a good excuse for a second viewing. And I am looking forward to that I can tell you. Score two 10s from the over 50s.

Review title: Overwhelming visual feast and awesome musical numbers
Review_body: Well every now and then a movie comes along which blows me away, I think the last one to do this was Forrest Gump.. Evita came close but just fell short of amazing.. Moulin Rouge never lets up with its zooming cinematography and combine this with the searing score and electric on screen chemistry between the two stars, the goose bumps never seem to stop! I think I'll be seeing this again and again and again.. Ewan was a bit of a surprise with his heartfelt performance of Elton's "Your Song" and Nicole shone with her previously unknown pipes. All in all, WOW!!

Review title: Moulin Rouge Review: Nothing Less Then Perfect!
Review_body: Personally, I think this movie is by far the best I have ever seen. Besides the music being absolutely amazing, not to mention by a certainly praiseworthy group of music artists, the whole of this film is no less then `spectacular, spectacular!' The selection of wild, exotic colors blended with the explosive charisma of an all star cast is perfect for one truly entertaining viewing. The cinematography is sheer genius, with some of the best transitions I have every seen, accompanied by some smooth, dazzling special effects. The captivating story line, a purely emotional voyage of dramatic standards, provides a sensation of amplified feeling only captured in those moments of true love. All of this combined with the radiant use of turn of the century clothing, set to the beat of modern generation's musical influences. With a superior cast, this group of inspiring performers outdo themselves again and again throughout the film. Also, I have to mention that the cast vocals are totally stunning! Even the soundtrack does justice to the essence of this movie. I'm sure you'll never expect what is ahead if you haven't seen this flick yet!!

i loved this movie.  i cried-more than once.  it made me feel.  it made me think.  i never see a movie twice-but i will with this, so i can live in that world a little bit longer. i highly recommend it. i also ran out and bought the cd-ewan mcregor makes me swoon-id buy a cd just of him.

Review title: Love lifts this movie up where it belongs!
Review_body: Wow, words alone can't begin to describe the stunning display that is the movie, Moulin Rouge. After seeing this movie for the fourth time the only thing I could say was, "When is the next showing?" This is one of those movies that become the treasured favorite in your memories. The movie dances and sings in the hearts of all true romantics.

I'm not too fond of musicals, I don't like soppy love stories with predictable endings and I am not a frequent visitor of posh brothels either. Still, I was simply dazzled by Moulin Rouge.The first fifteen minutes of the movie were very fast and flashy, almost music video-like. Some (middle aged) people right next to me in the cinema started shifting around their chairs uneasily, but I'm sure they got what they waited for after a short while anyway. I didn't mind the beginning at all, I thought it was a very clever way of portraying the chaotic and lively atmosphere in the famous nightclub.After the initial chaos died down a bit, the viewer got a tragic love story about the poor English writer Christian (McGregor) who falls in love with the posh dancer Satine (Kidman) in the famous Parisian nightclub Moulin Rouge. However, she has to be the lover of a very rich duke who pays for the production of Spectacular spectacular, the new Moulin Rouge show. This is a story about a poor sitar player who falls in love with a courtisane, but she has to marry the wealthy maharadja. The parallel is clear, I think. Satine and Christian start a secret affair, but the jealous duke gets suspicious and does anything to stop the passionate love affair between the two. The premiere of Spectacular spectacular is a tragic climax of the love story: will Satine choose for the duke's money, or follow her heart for the first time and leave Moulin Rouge together with Christian?It is not the story that makes Moulin Rouge such an interesting picture, it is in the incredible way it is told. Fabulous camera shots, interesting use of classic and modern pop songs (Madonna's Material girl and The Police's Roxanne will never be the same) and most of all, very good acting and singing of the two heroes, Kidman and McGregor. Never knew they could sing at all, so I was a bit sceptical about this aspect of the film beforehand. But I must admit I was quite impressed, particularly with McGregors efforts. Give 'em both and Oscar, and the person who cast Miss Minogue: give him two (for his guts).

I found "Moulin Rouge" to be a most engaging and enjoyable film.  I think Baz Luhrmann is an incredibly gifted director, and he's assembled a top notch cast to inhabit this cutting-edge film. Ewan McGregor displays his finest acting ability to date (not to mention a superb singing quality), and Nicole Kidman has discovered new heights of acting not previously displayed.

Review title: The most entertaining film I have ever experienced!
Review_body: Never before have I been to a movie where I could just not stop smiling. This is certainly one of the greatest movies of the modern era. From the opening Fox studios intro to the gripping climax, the film transports you into to the colourful, exciting and magical world, know as the Moulin Rouge. i just want to go and see this film again and again and again. The use of modern music diced into the late 19th century era is done with sheer perfection and brillance. The mind of Baz Luhrmann is one that must astound anyone who has the pleasure to be associated with him. Ewan and Nicole are perfectly matched. It is certainly Nicole's greatest achievement as an actor. 10 out of 10!

Review title: "Never fall in love with a woman who sells herself... it will always end BAD!"
Review_body: First off, the music for this movie is absolutely amazing! Buy the soundtrack. The chemistry between Nicole and Ewan in this movie was stunning, and the scenery was unbelievable. The story starts off a little strange, and it's the kind of movie you have to watch twice to get a lot of the little details and innuendos that are hidden in the flashing camera angles and song lyrics. But after the first time you see it, you'll want to see it again and again. The beginning is a little tricky to get at first. You already know the ending before you even get to scene 2. But throughout the movie, you fall in love with all the characters, songs, and the storyline. It's the best love story of all time, and I urge you all to watch it. You'll laugh, you'll cry, and you'll always be left wanting more.

I have never cried at a romantic film before (Gods honest truth, I am really that hard-hearted)and only once before did I cry at a movie and that was when I was four. Could not believe just how well, Luhrmann pulled off this musical. Really excellent film and who would have thought that Ewan Macgregor had such a good singing voice!

First of all, I have to say that Moulin Rouge is my favourite movie of all time.  The energy, the emotion, the music, it's everything you need in a film.  And then there's Ewan McGregor.  Well what can I say, except that come what may, i will ALWAYS love him!!!!!!!!!!

love the whole film!! specially the parts with Ewan Mcgreggor in *ahh swoon* ^-^ but i also all of the costumes Satine gets to wear!! in "Spectacular Spectacular' and in a normal day, especially the beginning where you see her for the first time and she is wearing a silver dress with a top hat and then gets changed to a big dress with feathers!! n i think the idea of putting a 'movie' on inside a movie was a brilliant idea!! Genius!! i also love Toulouse because he says 'The Sthparkerwing Dimondth' and 'The Childwen of the Wev-a-Woothon'!! and i think its a really good twist at the end when Satine dies!! but then Ewan is crying!! :( xx

I cringed throughout this film. How on earth could it have been made? Who could possibly enthuse about it? The cast looked as embarrassed as I felt for them.God preserve us from Hollywood plundering the past; from unoriginality, from remakes and from travesties such as this! Bury it please in a deep hole.Unfortunately I was on a flight somewhere when this film was aired. I survived merely by the expedient of disconnecting the headphones.Anyone ever see the British TV sitcom "Goodnight Sweetheart" starring Nicholas Lyndhurst? Well - it was pretty much like that; 'modern' songs reused in an historical backdrop. It doesn't work. Ever. m No disrespect to Mr Lyndhurst and his writers: the plot of the TV series is somehow explicable and works - in a way. "Moulin Rouge" doesn't. Full stop. End of story.

Review title: one of the most magical movies that I've ever seen...
Review_body: The Moulin Rouge is one of the best movies that I have ever seen.  It has everything that one could possibly want in a movie--action, romance, comedic interludes, and a wonderful soundtrack.  One of the best things about this film how is it filmed.  At times this can be over-powering but in a good way.  Some scenes are choppy to add depth and to give the film something different from the main-stream to the film.  Ewan McGregor and Nicole Kidman each to a very good job with the songs in this film and I was surprised with how excellent they actually sounded.  When Ewan first sings, "Your Song," it's unexpected how wonderful his voice is.  This film is beautiful and everyone should give it a chance.  Don't let the negative comments that I've heard be the deciding factor as to whether you should see this movie or not. Give it a chance and you'll be pleasantly surprised.

Just saw it last night and loved it. The chemistry between Ewan McGregor and Nicole Kidman was great, and the story between their two characters was moving. I liked the balance between the drama of their story, the music, the crazy choreography, and the humor. Plus, very clever little touches that made me smile when I noticed them, but they didn't distract me from the main story. Great visuals, too. One of my favorite movies of all time.I think Baz Luhrmann is a very good, very brave and creative director. Moulin Rouge is a somewhat familiar story told in an original way. I walked away from the theater in a better mood than before I saw it, feeling fulfilled, I guess. In my opinion, this film is what filmmaking is all about!

Review title: The most amazing movie of the year!
Review_body: I see very few movies in the movie theater.  Most of them are not worth the $10 it costs, when I can rent it in a few months for $1.99.  This movie I have seen twice, and I'm already looking for another day next week to go see it again!  It gave me chills. I listen to the soundtrack over and over again.  I call it "Moulin Rouge Radio - all Moulin Rouge, all the time." If this doesn't get nominated for at least several Academy Awards, it will be a travesty.  Note: This movie is not for everybody.  You have to like: a)Musicals, b)Ewan McGregor c)filmmaking, or any combination of the above. I don't think liking Nicole Kidman is enough, because that usually means guys, and they don't generally like musicals, but if you are on the verge of going...go!  There are some very funny sections ("Like a Virgin" is hilarious!)  I do think a lot of people are mislead by the commercials and ads they are seeing, because I have heard of a lot of people walking out after the first 15 minutes.  Again, it's not for everybody.  But it is for me and that's all I can say.

Review title: This film is the best musical produced in Hollywood in a long time!
Review_body: This film takes you from the normal boring world to the bohemian world of the Moulin Rouge at the turn of the century. The colors and amazing music in this movie thrilled me and surprised me beyond measure. I was truly pleased with this movie and I would recommend it to anyone who enjoys music and love. A very good and exciting film.

Review title: Brilliant use of romance, absurdist and music
Review_body: Moulin Rouge was a fantastic film that brilliantly used music from artists like Nirvana, U2, Elton John and The Police. The songs were incredible, the set(typical of Luhrmann's shows) was an over-the-top spectacular show and the acting was first-class. Nicole Kidman gave probably the weakest performace of the cast and she was excellent. Ewan McGregor gave arguably the best performance of his short career, and the entire cast brought in a remarkably powerful performance. If you like romance, drama, absurdist comedy or popular music, this is the film for you!

Review title: One of the greatest movies I've ever seen
Review_body: Today was the seventh time I wenna see this movie and enjoyed it as ever. It's hard to say something about this movie to those who haven't seen it yet. I am sure that only those who's seen this movie can share this feeling. So beautiful, unique, and powerful. Also it has so many things to offer that I found something new in each time I viewed. Ewan and Nicole's first meeting scene with his singing(who's ever imagined that he could be so sweet and cute?), Elephant Love Medley(so clever and dreamy sweet, and as someone said already, it sounds like they were made just for this movie.), and their love secret song "Come What May"...are all unforgettable. There are also so many witty comedies including the "so exciting, so delighting" scene introducing the story to make the duke invest, and "Like a virgin" scene, and much more. If you've seen this movie already, try to see it again and you'll be moved in another ways. If not seen yet, you don't wanna miss it out. Because it's a musical, it's much better to experience it in the cinema rather than at home with a small TV screen and speaker. I also definitely recommend the sound track that is just as excellent.

Here is a film that is not only visually appealing, but may bring back the musical genre. The interesting aspect of Moulin Rouge is that either, one does not like the film or one does. There seems to be very little middle ground. That ability to draw out emotion, to create talk days, weeks after the viewing is wonderful. Nobody will be talking about Tomb Raider three weeks from now, but Moulin Rouge, well, this baby has legs. Another interesting aspect of this film is that while other successful and entertaining films, Shrek for instance, was created to appeal to a wide audience, thereby not asking for the patrons to involve themselves with the story as it will be laid out for them, Moulin Rouge asks, no demands, that you get involved. If you fail to get involved then you will fail to understand the beauty of two people in love. That it is not all visual, but also psychological, tactile, and dare I even say olfactoral. Then again to understand the film, maybe Christen (McGregor)was right, you had to have been in love to understand love. And I do mean true love. Not the shallow kind of love many are in today. BTW I have nothing but admiration for the use of the songs portrayed. I love the idea that songs we all listened to, reflected on, and talked about as a culture was reflected in the story. I believe their use just allows us the ability to understand the story and charactors better. As Toulouse Lautrec once said (to paraphrase), I love the Moulin Rouge, because its ugliness is so beautiful. Check out his art as it brilliantly captures the time.

Review title: worst film I have ever seen "total trash" a waste of viewing time
Review_body: I was totally disgusted by this film.The Aztec Mummy is an Academy Award winner compared to this "TRASH".I've Never seen a worse film than this.The people at FOX who were behind this garbage should be Imprisoned for life and forced to watch the film every waking hour of their lives.Everyone I know who saw it has the same opinion and tell others not to waste their money seeing this film.I can't get over how these people can put out "TRASH" like this and think that they can get away with it.I would have demanded a refund from the theater if I had paid to see it,thank goodness for free movie passes.This film Ranks a rating of "DON'T WASTE YOUR TIME and MONEY".

This film has enchanted me. It shows how is the society in that hard period of the history in the suburbs of Paris. The power of the money can't buy love, but it can but the death :( I think the ending of the film is perfect, just what I think it's the best final. It would have been unreal if Satine had survived. I love the part when Christian do what she ask him for doing it: Tell their story. I also love the songs, they are famous songs mixed with new rhythms and voices. And they fix perfectly with the plot of the film. In my view, every teenager(and adult) has to watch it, it teaches a lot about love, truth and the society.

This film has totally revitalised the movie musical, but without subscumbing to cliche's and still remaining original. Songs are tight, camera is brilliant, acting is right on par. If my guesses are right it SHOULD come out of next year with a swag of Oscars, and just as many nominations.I think John Liguizeamo (sp?) as Toulouse, Jim Broadbent as Zidler and Richard Roxybourgh (sp?) as The Duke, will all come out with an Oscar Nomination for Best Supporting Actor, and the winner will probably be Toulouse.The score will win. The camera and editing should win. And it SHOULD get Best Picture, making it the first musical to win the award since God Know's When. Absoloutley a must see for anyone, even if you hate musicals, you'll LOVE Moulin Rouge.

Review title: Spectacular! Spectacular! A unique masterpiece to be seen again and again!
Review_body: I have now seen Moulin Rouge more times than I should say and I have noticed something new and unique every time.  This film is so intricate (and beautiful) that you cannot possibly absorb it all in one  viewing.  Luhrman (along with his Bazmark production team) really is a visionary and his films push the limits in such amazing ways.  The music, the sets, the choreography - all of it is awe-inspiring.  Ewan McGregor proves his versatility as an actor yet again by bringing such a heartfelt innocence to Christian - and  the man can sing!  Nicole Kidman went from being just another actress to me to one of my favorites - she takes on the role of Satine so honestly and proves that she not only has a comedic side but a great voice as well.  Together the two of them light up the screen.  In a year of mostly mediocre films (with a few notable exceptions) Moulin Rouge is totally refreshing.  It not only promotes truth, beauty, freedom, and love but is a perfect example of them as well.  Luhrman himself said that it was time for a new kind of storytelling and he was right!  Open your mind and enjoy one of the most original movie experiences in years.  A bohemian storm is brewing!

I absolutely adored the movie and plan to see it again, and get the DVD when it comes out...it was great!!..I never knew that Nicole Kidman had such a wonderful voice...and I'm glad to get to see that side of her :-)...I would definitely love to see her in another musical...again..I thought it was wonderful.

It has been some time since a musical has graced the big screen the way that this film is. I think it is great. This film touches all emotions. A must see. Even if you are not a 'musical' person you should still give this a try. The first ten munites are a turn off for some...but hang in there. Don't let this turn you. It does not set the tone for the movie as a whole. Give this one a shot. You'll like it.

A yawn, I've seen this movie twice. The first time, I didn't like it. The second time I went to see if I could actually like it. Turns out I disliked it more the second time.People ask me if it's because it's not my kind of movie. I do prefer certain types of movies (american beauty, america psycho, fight club... that kind.)but I can watch any kind. I just tend to like drama/thriller.
Moulin Rouge is a drama?! How? The only dramatic sequence I can remember is when the narcoleptic is singing Roxanne which is also the same scene when Satine is at dinner with the Duke. That's the only drama. That was one of my favorite scenes... Along when they're singing/explaining to the Duke what the play, Spectacular Spectacular is about... Cute, fun, bouncy scene.The plot was WEAK. Boy meets girl, the two fall in love... This is a problem, though, because the girl just happens to be unwillingly attached to someone else. How many times has this been done? With a slight different twist? It's BORING.There were NO likable characters besides Christian. Odd for me, because I tend to like the 'bad guys' and the 'villains'. Christian was the complete opposite. He was innocent. He was sweet. And McGregor can SING. I've never seen any of his movies besides this. He put on a great performance in this ho-hum movie. I will definitely be checking out some of his other work.All in all, this movie was below mediocre. 2/10

Review title: Awful doesn't even begin to describe this movie.
Review_body: It made me laugh, it made me cry....unfortunately, all in the wrong places.The first few minutes of the film were promising--interesting use of color, music, cinematography....but from the moment that Nicole Kidman's rendition of "Diamonds are a Girls Best Friend" turns into Madonna's "Material Girl," the movie goes downhill.If half of the budget spent on sets and costumes would have been spent on original music and few lessons on dialogue writing the movie might have been entertaining.  If you want to see what a musical should be, check out TCM and start up the microwave popcorn.  The only good thing about my Moulin Rouge experience was the fact that I saved $5 by seeing it at a second run theatre.

As someone who is not a fan of the movie musical and having paid no attention to the film during it's making, I was skeptical about seeing it at all. I gave in and last Sunday I went to see it thinking "what's the worst it could be? - after all, I lived through Evita".Moulin Rouge turned out be be more than I could ever have imagined. It is beautiful, truthful, entertaining, moving, funny, sad, and ultimately very fulfilling. I just came back from seeing it for the second time and will likely see it many more times before it leaves the theaters (I want everyone I know to see it, so I'm taking them to see it).Go. See it.

Review title: It was fantastic, I loved it!!
Review_body: Okay, well I'm not usually into musical movies, but i loved this movie so much!
