Ewan McGregor is a really good actor and shows it through his character, Christian, well I thought so anyway and Nicole Kidman is the same with her character, Satine, who comes alive to the audience from the very start. Despite what people have said i think they did a great job and they can both sing very well, Ewan has a great voice, as does Nicole I encourage anyone to go see it, the kids would love all the colour and dancing, and the adults would enjoy the sad love story and the older songs redone by all the actors. Baz Luhrmann has again made a fantastic movie for everyone to enjoy!
From the moment it starts you are captured. Hold on because you are about to take the ride of your life. Humor, Love and tears surrounding by energy and sound unlike we have ever seen before.

This is a highly over-rated, strangely beautiful, ultimately chilly mess of a film on whom the talents of several fine actors was wasted.  Mr. Luhrmann has too much money and not enough patience.  If nothing else, his frenetic editing left me dizzy, wanting things to slow down a bit (especially in the big production numbers) so that I could actually take it all in.  The Roxanne Tango is amazing.  See it at your own risk.

I love the movie. I found the start of the movie very confusing as there were bright scenes flashing quickly & I got a headache. But it was really good!!!!!The end was very sad :-(If she had TB, she wouldn't have been able to sing and then go *cough cough*.Also, if Tolouse was a dwarf, the guy who played hum wasn't. I LOVED Richard Roxborough. I really recommend seeing Tolouse Tonight on the club moulin rouge web site. The interview thingys are hilarious.

Moulin Rouge, was, as mentioned in one of the other comments, the foundation of story's, plots, and themes today. 'Love' being the entire theme of the film, to call the film 'A new Idea' you would definatley have to go back in time, to before the world...With that in mind, it was the most enjoyable and fantastically, well-put film I've seen in an extremely long time (Never!!!)...
The extremely simple theme of love, gave Luhrman the ability to play, match, and create a fantastical story of - guess - LOVE, but not only this. Early in the film, the statement "This is a story about Truth, Beauty, Freedom, and above all LOVE." The love, passion, anxiety, jealousy, and finally truth in the film was put wonderfully into a fast moving, high pitched, musical!!!The soundtrack... What can I say???... Superb!!!... The use of old time songs, both in the film, and the soundtrack, was 'mastermind'!!! Generally, with a musical or slightly musical theme, the soundtrack doesn't reflect the movie what-so-ever... This sountrack, brings the story right into the music. Each song is a reflection of a scene, or theme in the film and therefore, cannot be compared with any other...After the huge fuss of movies like 'Titanic', Moulin Rouge is absolutely under-estimated. The critics were hard on the film, due to Kidman's recent break-up, and the pressure put on her to perform brilliantly. Thankfully!,those who did go and see it are always happily surprised...BUT! - a large amount of people have found that you have to see the movie at least twice, due to the flash-backs, and fast-moving plot, and for those less used to it, or those who don't really fancy it, the second time is vital...You cannot comment on the Moulin Rouge without having seen it twice - unless you are used to fast moving plots and can easily understand them...Without seeing this movie, I don't think anyone can be allowed to have a 'favourite movie'...This is DEFINATELY the best movie in the world... See it, or be deprived...Enjoy... from ash...10/10!!!

Review title: Frank-N-Furter meets Groucho meets Pee Wee Herman
Review_body: I left the theater feeling like I had seen The Rocky Horror Picture Show, Pee Wee's Playhouse, the Marx Brothers' Duck Soup, and MTV -- all at once. Needless to say, such an amalgam was sometimes disconcerting. In fact, that combination was too much for the film to carry; it often failed to come together.References to songs of different eras seemed silly at first but grew on me as the movie progressed.  (One must ignore dozens of anachronisms if one is, as I was, determined to get some pleasure from the film.)  Despite some fine special effects, the first twenty minutes somehow manages to be the most boring.  And, some dialogue was laugh-out-loud ridiculous.  What kind of lyric is "even though my make-up's flaking..."?I found the "Roxanne" scene the most compelling because it worked narratively, musically and visually.While the film would lose something on a smaller screen, I don't think it's worth the full price of admission.

Review title: The most beautiful love story you'll ever see!
Review_body: So few movies today are able to evoke every emotion in just one sitting. Moulin Rouge goes above and beyond. It starts out crazy then turns into this beautiful love story. I've already seen it twice and the soundtrack never leaves my player. Ewan McGregor and Nicole Kidman have the most beautiful voices!!! GO SEE IT!!!

Review title: This was the best movie I've ever seen!!
Review_body: OMG!! This is the best movie that I have ever seen and if you haven't seen it yet then I suggest that you get off your butt and go see it now!!! It has a little something for everyone. There's drama, music, romance, a little bitta action and totally hot characters. They couldn't have done a more perfect job with the casting- and who knew a hottie like Ewan Mcgregor could sing like that!! I won't say any more but if you haven't seen it you MUST SEE IT!! It'll keep you coming back again and again.

this was the worst movie i have seen in a long time..it put me to sleep a few times..i kept trying to watch to maybe see what the whole hoopla was about with the blind critic's praise.....but realized that it was a massive propaganda by the studios to give credibility to a terrible waste of time and money.....

Well, I don't know where to begin, besides saying that I have never felt so powerfully about any movie besides Moulin Rouge.  There was nothing wrong with this film.  The music, the design, EWAN!....EVERYTHING!  I have seen it four times and once it is released on DVD it is going to be added to my DVD collection.  I think everyone should watch Moulin Rouge at least once.

All movies have a message right? At least, they are supposed to. If one came and asked you what the message from Moulin Rouge was, you would know even if you hated the film. It was typed out for you right at the beginning. Ever seen a movie do that?The Moulin Rouge sets the stage for an immaculate story to take place, and also encompasses the history of France, and the Bohemian culture. Special effects aside, we can learn a lot from this film. Definitely, this film set the standard for musicals of the future. Although I can't imagine why anybody would resist its divine pull, if after the first half-hour you aren't hypnotized by the spectacle, go ahead and leave. You aren't ready to see it yet.Baz Luhrmann's fall-out-of-your-seat wonderful film takes apart the French Can-Can movies of the '50s and reimagines them for a new century. With jaw-dropping set designs, computer legerdemain and a soaring soundtrack of orchestrally reconfigured pop standards, the film brilliantly bridges a hundred years of cabaret, vaudeville, India's "Bollywood" extravaganzas and MTV. Who would imagine that a movie with such a rich story and no explosions or cars could have super-charged effects. Mr. Luhrmann wouldn't settle for less.Truly, Baz Luhrmann is a genious, and that is why i made my name- just for this review. And all you who think this movie is a waste of time: I'm sorry you don't appreciate art, and know that you should broaden your horizons before slamming something you don't understand. The movie wasn't written for you anyway. It was written for those who DO believe in true love.-Mark-

(warning: possible spoilers ahead)How can a movie that has a cliche plot, undeveloped characters, cheesy settings, overdone costumes, and no shots that last longer than 3 seconds get voted to be such a great movie?  I have no idea.  I barely sat through the movie and finished watching it only due to a crazy new year's resolution.  It actually hurts to watch it.  What most describe as "a beautiful mix of color and music" is really, well, not.  The closest thing I can compare it to is mixing beautiful colors of paint until they turn into ugly greyish-brown color that may remind some of waste and excretions. The only reason I'm writing about Moulin Rouge! is because I hated it so much and actually, I'm disgusted with myself to even write anything more. Please don't see this movie - it has no value as a piece of art whatsoever.

This may well be the worst movie I've EVER seen.  I'm very happy I only spent $4 for a matinee showing.  I can't imagine what the director was thinking.  Even if you were to buy into the fact that musicals don't need plots, the music was terrible too!  Don't waste your time or your money on this one!

I LOVED this movie to death!!  I saw it eight times in the movie theater and I know every line.  I just can't get enough of the excellent song and dance numbers.  Seeing Ewan McGregor dance around on his knees and get so very involved with his work is absolutely delighting.  I loved it all!!  I would definitely recommend it to everyone although I must say that those who don't like musicals tend not to like this movie.  But it is definitely a movie that should be marked in film-history.

The plot isn't original.  The songs aren't original.  The attempt at making the viewer dizzy by changing scenes quickly makes the movie feel like an two hour advert for itself.This movie reminded me of one of those sappy cheap lip-sync song and dance acts that amusement parks provide to parents who don't want to accompany their children on rides.This is one of two movies that I walked out on in my life.  Life's too short to be spent watching movies like this one.

Moulin Rouge is the kind of film that makes you aware of the true possibilities of modern cinema. From beginning to end, this film is an amazing aural and visual feast. It defies cinematic convention, and instead delivers one of the most inspiring pieces of entertainment that I've seen in a very long time. It grabs a hold of your spirit and takes it on one of the wildest rides around. Nicole Kidman and Ewan Macgregor literally light up the screen, and they can really sing! The use of contemporary music in a musical period piece is brilliant! The cinematography is amazing, and the visual effects are captivating. At the heart of this artistic masterpiece is simply a tale of truth, beauty, freedom, and above all love. And boy is it fun! Kudos to Baz Luhrmann! For the first time in a long time, I left the movie theater with the feeling that someone had actually made some effort to challenge my senses! Warning: If you've become accustomed to the regurgitated rubbish that hollywood has been putting out lately, you might be put off by Moulin Rouge's ORIGINALITY! On the other hand, if you're feelingadventurous, take a chance on Moulin Rouge. It's different, but that's a good thing.

I think i have seen this movie more then any other movie. It is just so touching and it could really be a true story about a girl like that. Honestly whenever I think about this movie, it makes me so happy! The storyline is great and has a great background. The music is one of the best soundtracks...ever. I love the music more than any other song. Especially "Come What May" and plenty plenty more! SO I'm just trying to say is this movie was great! There might be some parts in the movie where it is a little wild,crude, but that is just at the beginning so I wouldn't worry about it to much OK? And one more thing about this movie, it is so worth seeing! So go out and see it! It will change you, like what it did to me! In a good way..

Loved it from start to finish.  Breathtakingly original, stunningly beautiful.  Can't wait to see it again to catch the bits I missed..... I want to see the actors who I didn't recognise the first time around. Everyone was superb.

Review title: Moulin Rouge is a modern masterpiece
Review_body: Moulin Rouge is a cinematic marvel of modern editing techniques and classic Movie Musical flair. Combining the pageantry and wonder of the movie musicals of the 40's and 50's with the digital effects of today, Moulin Rouge manages a visual masterpiece that can only be described as tasty eye candy. Ewan McGregor and Nicole Kidman are surprisingly good in their vocals, lifting common pop songs from the past couple of decades to an elevated Musical Score format. The film plays at a quick pace that may be difficult for the older viewing audience to grasp, but is definitely in line with what today's younger audience comes to expect from combined music and video. I strongly recommend this film to anyone who likes creativity and love stories.

Truly one of the worst films I have ever seen in my entire life, strip away the incessant hideously garish performance (I'm sorry, but some fat guy dancing around singing a butchered version of Madonna's "Like a virgin" does absolutely nothing for me) and there is no film!There is only one good thing I can say about Moulin Rouge and that is that Ewan McGregor has a great voice, which unfortunately does nothing to rescue the plight of this film.It amazes me that so many people are saying this is a great film. At my local cinema, as soon the story indicated that the film was finishing over half of the cinema were already leaving the theatre, myself included! The only reason I didn't walk out earlier is because I would have resented paying money for not watching a film and now I can tell other people not to bother!

I am obsessed with this film.  I cannot stop thinking about it, singing the music, dreaming about it. When I saw the movie for the first time, I said that I would not go back to see it again because it was TOO much!  Too depressing, too agitating, too visually stimulating, too cacophonous!  But, that I might return to see it just to hear music.  I have seen the film a total of 13 times before it left Hawaii and I would continue to see it if it were still playing here. The story is beautiful.  The writers have done a wonderful job. I cannot imagine any other director doing this movie in any other way than how Baz directed it.  Nicole and Ewan are magical.  I cannot praise Ewan's singing abilities enough.  He has such a beautiful voice! This is truly a "Spectacular Spectacular"!!!

Review title: drivel set to music. love, truth, beauty, blah.
Review_body: i hated this movie.  cliched, sentimental drivel.  bad music, with the exception of the use of madonna's "like a virgin," bowie's "heroes" and elton john's "your song", which was unfortunately ruined by it's incessant use in the film.  the music for luhrmann's "romeo and juliet" was infinitely superior.ewan macgregor tries his best, but can't save the overly sentimental pap of the script.however, i was impressed by the scene in which zidler sings "like a virgin" to the duke. i found the gender-reversal of this scene to be original and entertaining, in stark contrast to the remainder of the film.

I really think "Moulin Rouge!" should have won the Oscar for the Best Movie in 2001, and perhaps Nicole Kidman could have won the Oscar for the Best Actress, but I'm not so sure of that. "Moulin Rouge!" is that kind of movie that you only see once in a lifetime. Jim Broadbent himself says that no one he knows has ever done a movie like this one. "Moulin Rouge!" is a movie, it's true, but it's a SHOW. Completely... Delicious to the eyes, to the ears and to the heart. The music is amazingly touching. As Ewan McGregor says, some of the lines are just to simple to be spoke, they have to be sung, and they turn into something beautiful. The voices of the actors are very good, and adjusted to their personality. All the colour in the costumes and scenaries, turn this movie into a masterpiece. Baz Luhrmann did an amazing job, he achieved something that no other director had ever achieved: Turn a movie into a small little sweet chocolate, that totally praises your heart, and everytime you eat it, you discover something new.Congratulations! =)

Review title: This film made me feel like a child..
Review_body: When I took this film in local videostore, I didn't expect it to wake the child in me. It took me in a whirlwind of emotions, from happiness to sadness, from wonder to amazement.. I like to compare these feelings with the time I watched 'Hair' for the first time. A breathtaking experience. I didn't sleep till 8 am 'cause I wanted to see the other DVD ( special features, etc. ) immediately after seeing the film. For me it is certainly one of the best films ever.

This film is absolutely spectacular!! Such witty humour and gut wrenching sorrow has never beheld our screens, until MOULIN ROUGE! The most fantastic film of our time! I went to see the press release of this film on a whim, never in my wildest dreams did I expect a display of such splendour. The film was both moving and wonderful I cried through the credits and all the way home (a good few miles from Leicester square). Ewan McGregor's voice was superb and Nicole Kidman just shone!Baz Luhrmann, You are the master! What a success!

I really enjoyed watching Moulin Rouge! and I'm not even into musicals. Ewan McGregor and Nicole Kidman's performances make it worthwhile; I was a great fan of theirs already, but had no idea they could also sing (and so well). The whole film, costumes, dance, jokes, etc., is excellent, and it's so good to watch a movie which doesn't evolve around just car chases, big explosions, martial arts fights, etc. (which seem so common nowadays). The only downside to me was that, although I can understand English quite well, I could hardly understand the actors' lines during the big dance scenes, so had to read the subtitles and miss a little of the (outstanding) visual production. The choice of songs was brilliant, felt really good hearing "your song", "show must go on", "up where we belong", etc... Definitely, a must!

what a terrible movie - badly acted (with the notable exemption of Ewen McGregor who was the only good thing about the movie). I believe the movie relied too much on being clever and surreal rather than relying on what were interesting locales and an interesting story that didn't require so much razzle dazzle - extremely disappointing and overrated movie

The movie is too loud, the actors are bad, the songs are horrible....the movie is a horrible nightmare. It was one of the worst movie I've seen in the last couple of years. Don't waste your money for that movie.

Review title: Made me register and vote at IMDB
Review_body: Wasn't expecting too much but was blown away by the visual spectacular experience and the overwhelming force of pure enjoyment that this film emits.It's now up there with some of the best films I've ever seen and certainly the most fun, joyful and enjoyable film imaginable.

This film is a show.  Forget Broadway, this is it.  A vivid, mindblowing extravaganza of a rollercoaster.  Spectacular Spectacular indeed.  The use of the songs is wonderful; Nirvana, Bowie and Elton John in the same film. It just has to be seen!!

This movie is excellent. I first watched it at my girlfriend's house, and liked it very much. However, one thing became very clear to me. This story is based either on Alexandre Dumas's play "La dame aux camelias" or the subsequent Verdi opera "La traviata". Despite the apparent thoroughness of the story, it is a wonderful representation of the play, I found no mention of the inspiration therein, or even its author, in the credits. Perhaps someone can clue me in. Am I missing something, or did the producers here fail to recognize that Dumas deserves credit? If anyone is wondering how I know this, it is through extensive study of the afore-mentioned Verdi opera, La traviata. In Moulin Rouge, I have even found similarities between the lines in the screenplay and Francesco Maria Piave's libretto written for Verdi's opera. Intrigued, I purchased a copy of La dame aux camelias and read through the text, and watched Moulin Rouge. There were so many similarities there that it was astounding! Seeing as the producers of this film (to whom I am eternally indebted for a wonderful movie and even more wonderful memories) failed to give credit to Dumas, Piave, Verdi, or even the character about which Dumas wrote his play (based on real life!) Alphonsine Plessis, or Marie DuPlessis, it should most definitely be noted that as wonderful as the movie is, it is something of a fraud. Well, perhaps that's a bit severe, but at the very least, I think they should submit something, somewhere, saying that they had neglected to give credit to Piave or Dumas, seeing as they took lines from both of them! Just a thought.

Review title: A wildly energetic, fantastically filmed musical extravagance
Review_body: Having had no idea what to expect, I was fascinated and stunned by this film. It's billed as a musical romance, I think, but that's like billing "Star Wars" as a space adventure - it just doesn't describe it.There will be some who don't like "Moulin Rouge!". Much like there were some who didn't rate "Toy Story", "Star Wars" and "Gone With the Wind" when they first came out. Go with an open mind and you will love this film.The only thing that didn't work for me was the story, because there was nothing new in it. But you don't go to this film for the story.Mere words can't capture the spectacle of "Moulin Rouge!". A picture paints a thousand words, but this picture needs 10,000 to give it adequate description. Suffice to say: expect wild music, amazing choreography, stunning camera work, superb costumes, incredible sets, wondeful post-production work ... and you'll still be over-awed by the complete effect.

Um.. wow. When I first watched it on a big screen with larger than life sound, I was slightly turned off at parts. Maybe I couldn't take in all the information and process it in such a short time that the director allowed. Maybe I was trying to apply past experiences to this new one, and failing. By the end of the movie I was going over what I had just seen and I was stunned. Stunned by the skill of the director. How does one, or many for that matter, orchestrate such a magnificent scene, such as Christian's first night at the Moulin Rouge? Then how does one string hundreds of similar scenes together to form such a `Spectacular Spectacular' Movie?I keep going back to the first bedroom scene where Satine and Christian fall in love and think to myself. Oh my god, I really like that Elton John song. I must have replayed that scene a hundred times by now. For this scene alone it is worth buying this movie.

This movie by all is the best I'm in love with this movie!! it portrays love in many ways helping people to understand it even if their not romantic Nicole and Ewan portrayed their characters brilliantly With their own voices combined it makes it more original. Even if their not amazing pop singers they both can sing like! The characters Satine and Christian are just amazing the pain that was shown in the first few minutes was sad!! but as it lifted into the comical scenes u were lifted and moved with it!! i cant write much more i just am speechless by this movie it is my favourite of all time partially of the actors and actresses and the original song Come What May which is amazing and beautiful lyrics and music. ten out of ten i know the script off by heart i swear!! plz just watch people if u love amazing movies and want love!!!

Last night, I saw Moulin Rouge! for the second time since it began its theatrical run. My girlfriend and I were pretty much alone in an old, delapidated, small-town movie theatre--you could hear the speakers annoyingly hissing with age during the previews. Suffice it to say that I was not expecting my second viewing of the film to be as powerful as the first. I found that the opening bit of craziness at the Moulin Rouge (with Zigler screaming, etc..) was a bit grating. Yet, once Ewan and Nicole start singing to each other, the movie grabs ahold of you and doesn't let go. These people seem to be so in love, it's incredible. I can't wait for the DVD to come out so I can be won over again and again by these two actors' brilliant performances.

I went to see this last week and thought it was the most fantastic film ive ever seen and being a film buff, it had a lot to compete with. Ive never wanted to pay to see a film in the cinema twice but I would for this!-absolutley fabulous!!

This movie was La Boheme - with a serious twist.  I thought the parallelisms were sweet.  I loved the tome and atmosphere of the movie.  The stage came alive and you felt like you were there.  And just as the Moulin Rouge played popular music of the day.  So did this.  The scenery took you back to a place you'd never been and the music was intended to make you feel as if this was your Moulin Rouge.  As if then were now and vice versa.  T.S. Eliot's "objective correlative" if you will.  The problem is that I felt thrown off by the medley of popular love songs.  It felt out of place, out of time and out of character to me instead of drawing me in - which I believe was it's intended purpose.  Still I have a good deal of professional respect for the gutsy decision to take that chance.  The movie itself is full of lively vibrant characters and the scenery and costumes  are gaudy to the point of storybookish.  Worth seeing, if only for the sake of interest.

This is the best movie that I have ever seen. After seeing it the first time, I thought it was very good. Then some other friends wanted to see it, so I decided to go see it a second time. It was amazing! I ended up seeing it 3 times the first week, and I have seen it 11 times now in the theatre. It is the most visually beautiful movie that I have ever seen, and the more you see it the more you love it. So for everyone who saw it once and didn't really like it or you are just indifferent. Rent it when it comes out on video. I guarantee that seeing it again will make it a movie that you can't get enough of. This is the best movie ever made, great acting, great singing, great movie. If you have seen it, see it again; if you haven't seen it, SEE IT!!!!

When I visited the cinema, I was surprised this film is a musical. But the actors are all great and the ones who sings have marvelous voices, the music and the pictures were combined harmonically together. The story wasn't new, but with the new versions of the known songs the film get this special kick. I think it is a 'must see' for those ones, who love music and won't be afraid of a musical.

Review title: Trite, horribly cliche, and couldn't even have ori...
Review_body: Trite, horribly cliche, and couldn't even have original music for being a musical!  The entire movie is so over the top cheesy and two dimensional. The characters are made out of cardboard and never grow.  The message of the movie just keeps hitting you on the head over and over again in the same manner.  I can't believe everyone likes this movie so much.  My girlfriend and I moaned through the whole thing and almost walked out for fear of yacking.  I usually like musicals and am tolerant of cheese in a movie, but this one is just pure special effects fluff.  There is not even any good dancing, just short clips of a couple of moves that are strung together. But, I guess I'm glad that you all like it so much.

I think Moulin Rouge is one of the best musicals I've ever seen in my life! I'm only thirteen but i think it's spectacular! It's original,I haven't seen anything quite like it,it's colourful, the costumes are amazing and i don't think the castors could have found anyone more perfect to play the parts of Satine and Christian. Also, the quality of acting coming from the other actors was breathtaking. The first time I went to see Moulin Rouge,I missed the  first twenty minutes of it.My close friend had been to see it before me and told me i'd missed the best part.Nicole Kidman coming down through the ceiling on a trapeze.Nicole Kidman being my favourite actress since forever,I went to see it again five times. Now i can't wait to get the soundtrack and video. I'm absolutely amazed at Moulin Rouge because it made me laugh and cry every time.

Review title: The greatest thing in life you can learn is to love and beloved in return
Review_body: The sentence in the movie is a sentence i will always remember:The greatest thing in life is to love and beloved in return. I will always remember this movie as a movie that is different from others. A lot of songs and scenes that you cant compare to other movies.The humor in this movie is great , the famous songs of madonna for example are well integrated in this movie.Ethan Hawke plays his part very well , although Nicole Kidman is stealing the show with her devotion to this movie..I must say that this is a movie that i will never forgetLUMOSand then there was light.....

Review title: The creativity of this movie and love story are extraordinary... superbly written and performed. AWESOME MOVIE!
Review_body: This is a movie some will love and some will hate, but personally I just think it's awesome... the music is powerful... Ewan McGregor and  Nicole Kidman just blow you away. :)  The Duke and others give the story a hilarious twist here and there too.  Buy the soundtrack! A 10 all the way!

This is one of the most powerful movies I have seen in a long time - it is really sad, but it makes your blood pump - I had goose bumps all the way - not your usual musical.  I would recommend it to anyone - which strikes me the most is the fact that the actors sang the lyrics themselves - voices from Heaven!

Review title: I am in absolute love with this movie
Review_body: This movie was by far the best this year, actually I thought it was the best movie since Romeo and Juliet in 1996. If you are fans of Romeo and Juliet you will looove this movie. I saw it four times and if it was still in the theatre and I had money I would see it again! I love the way Baz uses his camera as his paintbrush and shows us all the emotions and feeling the characters are experiencing with it. Ewan McGregor was amazing as the sweet and innocent Christian (Just look at his eyes!!! They are so genuine!). Many people are complaining about the simplicity of the plot. Well, quite honestly I didn't even notice. I was too astounded by the beauty and wonder of the film. I thought the plot was good actually. So what if it's been done before? Romeo and Juliet had been done a million times and Baz still found a way to make it brilliant and original. He did the same with this film. I don't see how anyone could dislike it.

Review title: I have waited 25 years for this movie!!!
Review_body: This is the best film I have ever seen. I'm a big fan off the great musicals like "Singing in the rain", and I have waited many years for this. I was goosey all over so many times that I can't count them all. Encore, Encore, Encore!!!

Review title: Seen it twice in a week and bought the soundtrack
Review_body: Never before have I enthused over ANY film as much as this one.  I came to this site because I wanted to see if others enjoyed it as much as I did. I'm delighted to say that the majority of people feel the same way as me. I knew it was a Baz Luhrmann film, so I knew his approach would be different.  So from the very beginning, he caught my attention.The film has everything, humour, wonderful singing, great songs produced entirely differently to how you've heard them before.  Yes it's a simple love story, but what's wrong with that?  It was delightful to sit back and just be entertained, without having to concentrate on following the plot. I've now been to see it a second time this week and have bought the soundtrack, which is getting played non stop. I'd recommend this to anyone who enjoys musicals.

After my wife had already seen it twice, I had to come along. And I don't regret that. A classic love story in a new, original, outstanding way. The music, costumes, art direction... How do they do it!? Just see it. You don't know what you're missing.

The main attraction of this film for me was supposed to be Nicole Kidman: to be able to see in a big picture long close-ups of her... but now that I have seen it twice, I consider the whole film even better than Nicole alone. I love this kind of romantic stories with happy ends (yes, I consider that the end is happy despite of all). There is humor, beauty, good music, dance, color, good actors, good singers, etc.I strongly recommend this film to everyone who likes good cinema

'Moulin Rouge!' is one of the best films to ever grace the silver screen. With its amazing special effects, beautiful songs, and talented cast, it is truly a masterpiece.  Although Baz Luhrmann's creative style may not agree with everyone, it's worth a watch (or six) - if only to hear Ewan McGregor sing!

Attention! Only for real musical fans! This is a must see! Some might get taken aback and shocked by the unusual editing, strange camera angles, harsh make-up, and the overflowing emotions, but this all is what it's meant to be about: truth, beauty, freedom and love!!!!!!! And much more fun: no boundaries, no limits, no prudery, and the key message for everyone: fight for LOVE, no matter what the circumstances are! Just a quote for everyone around the globe: "The greatest thing you'll ever learn is just to love and be loved in return!" Excellent spectacle, excellent actors, excellent story, excellent visualization, excellent musical flicks, excellent artistic achievement of an excellent artistic mind: Baz Luhrman! Thank you for the amusement and for the feeling!

Review title: I am really over the moon with this painting style movie!
Review_body: N.Kidman is fantastic and J.McGregor too and everybody who is involved in this brilliant chef-d`oeuvre. Amazing treatment for sufferers (like me (with my experience of 6 years as ECU doctor)) from "Dancer in the Dark". Thank you Mr. Lurman for your bright mood to bee really genius. The same I can say about everybody who sculptured "Moulin Rouge"!

This movie is truly a piece of art, but not only that. The mix of music is a piece of art as well. I see it as a tribute to different well known music artists and their songs. And who would have known that Nicole Kidman and Ewan McGregor could actually sing that well :-). For people who liked 'Strictly ballroom' and 'Romeo and Juliet' this is a movie your going to love.

Hi Moulin Rouge lovers!! This movie is the most tragic love story I have ever seen. In close second Romeo & Juliet. Moulin Rouge was a sad but quite funny movie with great acting bt THE HOTTEST GUY EVER Ewan McGregor and Nicole Kidman. A movie has never made me feel like that did and I cannot wait until it is released to own. Unfortunately I have only seen it twice do to the lack of major movie theaters lack of playing it. The critics hacked this great love musical and they don't understand the hard work and awesome songs that went into it. Luckily I was able to get the Moulin Rouge soundtrack and never get tired of it. This movie gets 2 thumbs up, 10 stars, and my ultimate seal of approval. My advice watch it as many times as you can as often as you can!!"The greatest thing you'll ever learn is to love and be loved in return."

Review title: An in-depth look into the real burlesque life!
Review_body: Moulin Rouge is a movie full of music and wonder. Nicole Kidman plays the lead actress, and shows off her vocal talent.It's a musical drama in which Ewan McGregor falls for the famous and most wanted burlesque dancer, Nicole Kidman. This sappy love story will win your heart immediatly. Enjoy!

Review title: Perhaps the most important movie of all time...
Review_body: Keeping my lack of historical perspective in mind (in that I must consider the present to be the most important part of history) this is potentially the most important movie of all time, if its message is followed.  Sadly, it will very likely end up as one of the last champions of life and love before the wave of mediocrity crashes over the world and drowns these gems of true movie-making.

Baz, To think someone or even more than one person didn't get this film (even your other films) but especially this film - The Moulin Rouge... The only thing is to love and be loved in return... the greatest thing... really.that.simple.thank.you. thank.you. thank.you... i.gave.you. a.standing.ovation.in.Montreal...to think some people missed the message really gives credence and importance to your film - and thank God most got it.I love you.sir.a fan.Okay, what I mean is... great film.inspiring.emotional.

Review title: A bit like MTV meets Titanic ...
Review_body: I was a little puzzled for the first half hour, because of the combination of a Music Video and "slap stick movie", but just before it was just to much, it all made sense ! Suddenly it turned out to be a very gentle description of a loving couple... An ordinary love movie, yes, but in a very hot and flashing package! Perhaps something for a couple in the middle age that seen it all, to enjoy?

This is such an original idea for a movie that I was blown away the first time I saw it. It made me feel all the emotions that a movie is supposed to make you feel and all in under two hours. The vibrant colors and cinematography of this movie made it that much more entertaining. Not to mention the believable electricity between Ewan McGregor and Nicole Kidman. I was taken into this fantasy world of song and dance effortlessly by Baz Lurhman and it left me longing for more!

I just saw Moulin Rouge for the first time last night, and I had high hopes for it. I knew it was a musical, and I'd heard raving reviews from friends, telling me that this movie was something I NEEDED to see.Well, I have to say, I don't regret watching it, but I wouldn't say it's something that anyone really needs to see.First, I'll just mention things I DID like: The visual effects, the overall setting, was beautiful. Everything about those were beautiful, and if effects and set design interests you, DEFINITELY see this film, because you won't be disappointed. I also thought that, on another note, the acting was good, too. There weren't any horrible actors, but no one really shined. I'd say, if anyone, Ewan McGregor did great. On that same subject, the singing was fantastic all around. I was VERY impressed.However, the film just fell apart other than that. First off, the whole concept somewhat eludes me. What genre is it, exactly? For a while it seems to be almost a comedy and then, periodically, most notably the ending, was a complete tragedy. Was this intended to play with our emotions? If so, they failed in that aspect, as I was just confused.Another thing that has been debated over and over is the song usage. I personally would have preferred the music to be what it was at the real Moulin Rouge at that time period in France. The set, and the effects engross you in that time, but the music just brings you right back. I really didn't like the use of modern music at all.One thing I didn't really see, which would have made it much better, was a chemistry between Nicole Kidman and Ewan McGregor, or even a better... passion between the two of them. When I get really into a certain couple, or just really like one, they don't just have a good story, there must be a level of chemistry. And I just didn't sense it between Satine and Christian. They certainly had a lot of romantic scenes, but I've felt a LOT more chemistry between characters that rarely, if ever, get romantic scenes together (Ex: Mulder and Scully from The X-Files). I apparently missed the passion between these two.All in all, Moulin Rouge's was interesting, and certainly entertaining, but I just didn't think it was as great as some of the reviews make it out to be.

I loved Moulin Rouge it was the greatest movie, I can not wait until it comes out on video. I honestly thought that it was so entertaining Nicole Kidman, and Ewan McGregor have really good voices. I don't want to spoil this movie, I am sure that if you love singing and dancing & musicals that you will love this one!!!!!

This movie was so amazing! The voices were beautiful and so were the scenes. Amazing cinematography and imagination. Wonderful music and plot. It made me laugh, smile, want to sing, and yes, even cry. I recommend this movie to anyone and everyone. See it with an open mind. Know that it's not "normal" and that it will be "strange," but it will go beyond your wildest dreams and make you want to see it over and over again. Nicole Kidman and Ewan McGregor were amazing. Who knew they could sing like that?! After seeing it once, you (like me) will want to add it to your film collection.

Review title: So boring I did the crossword.
Review_body: Moulin Rouge is a one joke film. Once that joke has been used several times it becomes tedious.The film has no trace of originality, and the plot is the worst kind of farce. A better example of a doomed love triangle has to be Shakespeare in Love which is much fresher and wittier than this.The singing is weak and goes on endlessly. It's a pity that Jim Broadbent , who was excellent in Topsy Turvy, was so poorly used in this film. Nicole Kidman, supposedly a courtesan, was about as alluring as a cold fish.The disappointment came from having heard such rave reviews about it. I am afraid that I could think of several hundred better films than this. Could anyone seriously say that this is the 'best film they have ever seen' as I have been told? Alfred Hitchcock must be turning in his grave!

I love this movie.  I first saw it in the theaters and I loved the music and the spectacle.  It's so trippy!!  Then a friend of mine bought me the DVD for Christmas and now I love the story as well as the rest.  I have watched it so many times with all my friends and I love to watch them watch it so I can see how they react.  I am very grateful to Baz Luhrmann and the cast and writers and all for bringing back the movie musical.  I hope the trend catches on and I hope they make a play from this movie soon!!

Moulin Rouge is one of the best movies I have seen. In addition to being visually stunning, the song and dance bit is very entertaining. McGregor and Kidman have great chemistry, and the tragic love story blends well with the modern day songs chosen. This movie is terrific, and after seeing Romeo and Juliet you will definitely notice that this type of visually spectacular movie is Baz Luhrman's style of choice. A must-see!!

I fell in Love with Moulin Rouge.  I have seen tons of movies but nothing like it. it's amanzingly unique! What I have to say is that I love the way all the songs have been used and adapted in the movie.  I believed in love again thanks to Nicole and Ewan...

The first time I saw this it was truly mind-boggling, in the really confusing sort of way. I couldn't follow it at all. Regardles It made and impression so I had to watch it again. I did and it was mind- boggling but in the amazing unbelievable way. This has seriously been the best and most original musical I have set my eyes on. The outrageous characters accompany an equally outrageous set. It seemed like every single song, scene, and sentence conveyed the director's (movie's) message. It truly engaged my mind in seeking an answer to the age old question... what is the meaning of life? Why are we here?... The best part about the movie was when it was over my mind had satisfactory answers. I knew I hadn't really learned anything I didn't know before but the trip was worth taking.

in what do you believe? i guess everyone of us believe in love, beauty, freedom and verity! and this movie show us how these 4 things could bring peace and delirium, goodness and evilness, sadness and happiness. this movie isn't just a story about love, is a demonstration through music, through images guided by an amazing direction and photography of how love can change our point of view in life, our vision af what's around us!Not just a cold explanation of a story, in this movie story and images are melting, each one using the other one to show what love is! and above all the moulin rouge, symbol of freedom and craziness, just what's love is. Great Baz!

I have never seen a movie like this, my first thought was this is different, I  usually dislike any movie with singing all the way through it but I must say I enjoyed this movie so so much it is one of the greatest. I enjoyed it because it moved me inside I felt I was within the movie and the music was excellent I have bought the CD and now I want to buy the Video so I can keep it forever as I think this is a movie that I will never forget. The costumes, the scenes made you feel like you were transported into a world of fantasy. Absolutely Unforgetable and truly brilliant.

I saw Moulin Rouge twice at the cinema and now own the DVD.  I must say, out of the majority of movies I have seen, this one is the most unique and dazzling of movies I have ever had the privilege of viewing.I would recommend seeing this on DVD.  There is so much extra footage - you can even see some of the songs from different angles!!

Earlier this year, two friends of mine and I decided to go see a movie. Seeing as we already saw the other big blockbusters Pearl Harbor and The Mummy 2 (like everyone else in the world), we thought we'd take our chances seeing Moulin Rouge.  After reading a few negative articles about it beforehand, as I was buying my ticket and walking into the theater, I thought this movie was going to be a complete waste of my time and money... I have never been so wrong.  Director Baz Luhrmann has the gift of taking his audience into a world we could never imagine.  At the begining there are so many twist and turns and suprises, you feel as if your head is about to explode, but he then slows it down to a pace where the audience is able to "act" like they are calm, but their adrenaline is still vastly going. Uniquely, Luhrmann takes 19th century pop songs as the musical basis, remixes from the Beetles, Elton John, David Bowie, and Madonna's "Like a Virgin" are just a few.  Nicole Kidman gives a beautiful performance as the heroine Satine.  Her dancing, singing, acting, all lovely combined; I could not think of anyone better for the role.  The real surprise, however, came at the point where Ewan McGregor (know to many as "that one dude in Star Wars"), began to burst into song.  His voice resembles that of a mix between Elton John and Sting (sorry if you disagree).  His acting performance shines through and through in each scene, and during the "Elephant Love Melody", any woman would wish it was her up on the screen and Nicole out of the picture.  But then one comes back to reality and realizes that unfortunately, this is only a movie.  One with dazzling special effects, beautiful costumes, amazing scenery, breathtaking performances, and soulful singing.  If Moulin Rouge does not win an Oscar in 2002 for best picture as well as in many other categories, I will not only be surprised, but disappointed in the Academy that they do not know an Awardwinning movie when they see one.

Review title: fantastic blend of visuals and audio - thoroughly enjoyable
Review_body: This movie is a fantastic blend of sumptuous visuals of 1900 Paris (and then some) and sharp entertaining audio from present day.  It captures your imagination immediately, and sweeps you into a fantasy world of sites and sounds. The eye-candy is amazing, and the vocal performances are rich.  It was meant to be a one-time rental, but we have watched it over and over, seeing new things each time.  A wonderful film.

I absolutely adored this movie!! I had heard great reviews from many people but had not seen it for myself till recently and I had to watch it again when it was finished! The story was touching and the spectacle was amazing! It was colourful and attention-holding! The songs were appropriate and humourous with interjections of "modern" songs in what was supposed to be a story that took place in 1899! The performances of Ewan McGregor, Nicole Kidman and John Leguizamo were incredible! The viewer must maintain a suspension of disbelief however, since this movie follows along the lines of a great musical... but to fall in love with this movie is what I have done, and as Ewan's character says... love is all you need!

Whoever wrote this screenplay should be shot.  There were some unique camera effects, but they made no sense in the context of the movie.  The usage of modern music was strained at best.  All in all, I couldn't stand to watch more than the first half hour.

Review title: A powerful, musical romantic-tragedy. About a pennyless writer(Christiann)who falls in love with the "Sparkling Diamond"(Satine). Who is the lead of the Moulin Rouge's Can Can Dancers. He indulges
Review_body: This movie is Spectacular Spectacular!! It gives you great excitment and is very enthusiastic. But, it is very surprising that Nicole Kidman and Ewan McGregor could ever sing! How come they never did before? It is a romantic love story. However, the one thing I learned from it was........just to love and to be loved in return.

I really loved this movie.  I had no interest in getting up for anything during this movie.  I can't say how long I have been looking for a movie that reflects my interest and taste.  It's been a REAL long time.  The only thing that usually comes close is a Cohen Brothers production or foreign.I remember reading reviews when this first came out in the theatres that you are either going to love or hate this movie.  I can see why.  This is very much done in a theatrical style rather than cinematic.  The fourth wall and distance in locale are ignored, so if you aren't familiar and comfortable with that stage technique, you will find yourself confused.  Think fantasy, not reality.I loved the music.  Again, you will often hear that it contains covers of pop music.  However, they are done in musical theatre style.  So if you don't like musical theatre, don't bother.  Also if you tend to be a bit fanatical about covers.The costumes and art direction are top notch.  But, they contain the surrealism of the theatre.  So, if you have a real aversion to high art, skip it.In a nutshell, if you are looking to see a Julia Roberts movie, rent one. This isn't it.  But. if you are looking for something a little deeper and artistic, see "Moulin Rouge!"

This is one of  the most enjoyable movies I've seen in years. A bit of everything..Great Music, dancing, humour! I loved the set which looked like a painting come alive. I laughed at the start..and cried at the ending..

Review title: Self indulgent direction leads to Trainwreck
Review_body: The story was O.K....and if I could edit out all of the director's self indulgent garbage this movie might actually be watchable.  It would only be about 20 minutes long, but it would be watchable.The camera spins and whirls and the edits jump from one pointless, bizarre angle to another with such blurring speed it numbs the mind.  You can tell that the director and editor know this is distracting, as anytime something that is important to the story happens the camera angles return to normal, and the awful adaptations of contemporary songs fade to nothing.Kidman and McGregor are great, as is the rest of the cast.  The direction, however seems at times non-existant.

Review title: Ewan McGregor and whole cast are fabulous!
Review_body: Moulin Rouge! may be highly regarded as a nonsense picture but if you really immerse yourself in the characters and realize that it IS a musical, the reaction you are left with is total aw.Besides being hilariously funny, Moulin Rouge! is a deeply moving story and touches my heart very closely.  The songs are performed magnificantly and the acting by the whole cast is outstanding.  Putting aside the fact that Ewan McGregor is my favorite actor, he and Nicole Kidman do a wonderful job of expressing the facial characteristics and acting qualities that bring this movie to life.  Do not take other's opinions, see this movie for yourself and decide.  This movie was not meant for you to feel as if you were "there" but actually is crafted to remind you that you are watching and enjoying a movie...a very superb movie.Keep heading for the stars Ewan!!!!!!

Not being a fan of musicals, I was rather unsure about this film. But when I heard that Ewan McGregor and Nicole Kidman were in it, I thought that it deserved a chance. After hearing the rave reviews from friends, I finally sat down and watched this puppy. Mindblowing! It's the only way to describe the movie. Beautifully filmed, with romance and music that tugged my heartstrings in all the right ways. The performances by McGregor and Kidman were dead-on and Jim Broadbent was pure genius. Plus, that Unconscious Argentinian was quite funny. Sit down and watch this movie, you'll be glad you did.
Cheers!

I didn't know whether to cry, laugh, or run out in horror. Cry at the truly awful acting singing, laugh at all the scenes that took themselves too seriously, or run out in horror or it all. It was as if the movie set out to be an art film much too deliberately. In the back of my mind, I thought, surely, this movie must get better than this. So I stayed.I have read that this film was bold, innovative, emotionally moving, musically glorious. I apologize to all those who loved it, but I cannot share your joy. Unfortunately, it left me cold, and gravely disappointed in the plot, the weak characters, and the truly horrific acting and singing.Particularly bad, was the "love song", which resembled the result a web search for love songs that was then strung together. Ack!

This film is a wonderful work of art in every sense. From the theatrical opening sequence, to the brilliant colors and dazzling sets, you realize this is not just another movie musical. A story of love and the hazards thereof, that is as old as time, yet brought to life with the use of modern songs and music. Many of the tunes were originally solo performances, now broken into duets that seem to breathe new life into the lyrics. The direction is crisp, moving forward with the speed and agility of the lovers themselves. This cast is without question universally talented. The singing is strong, the dance clean, and the acting passionate and powerful without going over the top. Worth watching over and over again!

Review title: Is it sick to love a movie this much?
Review_body: This is my favorite movie of 2001.  The sets, the acting, the singing, the costumes ... My God, it's so damn good!  Goes to show you that a musical can still make it today's world.  And who knew that Nicole and Ewan could really sing?  I was never much of a Nicole Kidman fan before.  Now I can't get enough of her.  See this movie, twice!

This movie will definately be one that I buy, It was beyond excellent. It was moving and funny and sad all at the same time. Ewan McGregor did a devine Job with Nicole Kidman. I have an obsseion with Ewan and He is beyong excellent in the movie and his voice is outstanding. This is the first movie I have seen with him in it and some of the facial expression he makes while singing can really turn you on.

I am amazed at how bad this movie was and how my wife and I could barely make it through the first 30 minutes, saying to each other, "perhaps it will get better..." It never did! To watch this and enjoy it, you have to be either very drunk, on drugs, or disturbed psychologically. Just think a very colorful, in your face 2 hour music video that makes no sense. I understand what the director was trying to do, but why he did it this way and why it earned so much praise just boggles my mind. I think the director telegraphs his desires for the audience near the beginning, that everyone get as high on absinthe as its characters do. Only then, will this ridiculous movie be appreciated. Spectacular Spectacular? No! More like Stupid Stupid.

Review title: Everything You Could Possibly Want In A Movie Reinvented and Served Up Hot!
Review_body:
Moulin Rouge has taken it's place at the top of my favourite movies of all time. It makes me lift my skirt above my head and show my knickers to the world it's so wonderful. It has so much packed into it, and it's all combined skillfully by brilliant director/writer Baz Luhrmann. Comedy, music, singing, tragedy, amazing costumes, beautiful sets, amazing special effects, a fast paced and consistant tone, sexuality, violence, brilliant acting, beautiful people, a 360 world of truth, beauty, freedom and love. It will leave you with feelings I can't even describe in words.
The most amazing thing about this movie is that you notice something new everytime you watch it. That's been my experience, in any case. There is just so much to see, that even after seeing it 15, yes, 15 times I still notice something new. For example, did you notice that when Satine and Zidler come out from the girl's dresses after changing that Zidler is actually in his underwear? Took me 15 times to notice. He's covering his naughty bits and everything.Nicole Kidman is amazing. Ewan McGregor is brilliant. They are truly two very talented people who deserve all the recognition in the world.Of course I love this film. Having said that, it's very true that this is one of those love it or hate it films. Some people cannot stand this movie. It's either one or the other big extreme of enjoyment of this film, and I haven't met anyone who has fallen in the middle of loving/hating the movie at the same time. People get snagged on the simplicity of the plotline. See below about the "red curtain" filmmaking style. Keep in mind you may just hate it, and it's a personal thing. But keep in mind that I will hate you for hating this movie. Oops. Did I say that? This sentiment, however, is shared with many. People are so attached to this film that anyone who just didn't like it "just because" become absolute morons in the Rougehead's eyes.I cannot reccommend this movie enough. You must see Moulin Rouge. It is so different from everything out there. This "red curtain" style of filmmaking that Luhrmann embraces (placing a simple plot in a heightened world) is a truly magnificent thing. He's done it before (Strictly Ballroom and Romeo and Juliette) but never on this level. See it and learn from what it brings to the medium of filmmaking.

No doubt about it: This movie is gorgeous.  But all the fancy director's tricks, the magnificant sets and costumes, the splendid screen presence and chemistry of its main characters and Ewan McGregor's voice can't mask a weak script, little character development, and very little good music to call its own.  (I mean, if you're going to rip-off someone else's hits, make sure you can do them one better.)  This is strictly eye candy.  Not only is much of the music awful (we were laughing hysterically for a couple of days as we sang a few words from one of them at my house), but also the choreography is uninspiring (just take a few looks at "Singin' In The Rain".) The one fine, original song was the ensemble piece sung when the cast was trying to sell its production to the buyer.  As a long-time fan of musicals, I was disappointed and even angry at the waste of talent in this film.  No doubt about it: The best film musicals of the past decade or so have been Disney-animated films. Just on the basis of music alone, this falls far short of the high standards set by Howard Ashman (may he rest in peace), Alan Mencken, Tim Rice, and Elton John.  Want to enjoy Moulin Rouge?  Then turn off the sound.

*Almost* a brilliant valentine to twentieth-century popular culture, set at the end of the nineteenth and produced at the dawn of the twenty-first. Unfortunately, it's a visually stunning but unwatchable mess, with a couple of fantastic musical numbers thrown in ("Like a Virgin," "Roxanne"). Clearly the director needed the discipline of (e.g.) a script by Shakespeare. You can tell anybody this is your song. But don't.

Review title: A really bad, inane, MTV mishmash.
Review_body: My wife and I watch as much of this mess as we could stand, about 25 minutes.  It is an utterly inane riot.  The mix of songs was a laugh, but not funny.  Time Magazine said "You've never seen anything like it".  I hope I never have to again.  I cannot understand how Nicole Kidman was nominated for an Oscar for her over the top role.  The whole thing was just awful. It had nothing to do with 1900 Paris.  Of course, most of the audience wouldn't know the difference.  So sad.  It was a wonderful time.

It has taken me quite some time to get around to watching this film. I always thought of it as a 'chick flick' but kept hearing such good reviews that I thought I'd give it a go and buy a copy. After the first half-hour or so I realised that I hadn't stopped smiling since the beginning and it continued to blow me away until the end. This film is simply like nothing else I have ever seen and is constantly jaw-dropping. It is definitely one I will watch again and again. I can understand if people don't like this film (even though I don't usually but still enjoyed it) but the people who hate it with a passion really confuse me. If you hate this film so much that you have to post comments full of swearing then I think you ought to go see a doctor. At the end of the day it's only a film. The best film I've seen in AGES!

Review title: What a let-down. Could have been titled "Great Expectations"
Review_body: I love a good musical. Based on all the glowing reviews about this movie, we rented the DVD and sat back to experience. Wow! After about 30 minutes, we began wondering if this was really it. I kept expecting it to change gears and shift into the "wonderful musical" we had heard/read about. Instead, we were treated to the first movie in years to be turned-off before it was over.This movie/musical is a hodge-podge of snippets from many movies and songs of the past 30 years, or so. From "Hello Dolly" (now that was an entertaining musical) to "Sound of Music". From Madonna's "Like a Virgin", to Nirvana's "Smells Like Teen Spirit". It appears to have been put together like a collage. Someone cut-out a number of songs, and routines from previous movies/musicals, and pasted them on a poster-board which then became the outline of this musical.Thin plot line. Voices of the leads that lacked depth. Very impressionistic. The most positive thing I can say is that Nicole did look rather nice in some of the costumes she was wearing.All in all, I think of this as the "Scary Movie" of musicals.

Moulin Rouge is a movie unlike any other. It tells the simplest of stories in a most unsimple way. This movie is so original and so amazing, that is must be seen more than once to truly take in all of its greatness. It's a shame that the Academy went with the "been there, done that" A Beautiful Mind, and ignored the originality that is Moulin Rouge. Nicole Kidman is fantastic, and deserved the Oscar for this performance, which shows all of her range, from comedy, to singing, to heartbreaking drama. Ewan McGreggor is also very good, as is Jim Broadbent, who really won his Oscar for this performance, despite what movie he was nominated for. Moulin Rouge is a spectacular film that dared to be bold and original, and offer up something new and fresh to movie goers. It succeeded in giving us a movie that will be around for a long time. It's just a shame that as usual, when someone tries something different, the old guard stands up and shouts that they like things the way they are, and take every chance they get to bad mouth the new thing, and attempt to keep things the same. To you all I say too bad, because while there are lots of you out there, the majority has seen the light, and this movie is being embraced like none I've ever seen before. Its 8 Oscar nominations are a good indicator of that. To anyone who has not seen this movie, give it a chance, it may surprise you, as it did I, in the most spectacular spectacular of ways.

To view this movie, one must prepare to lose oneself in the greatness of Baz Luhrmann's imagination.  I had initially seen this movie in theatre and could not just watch it once.  I had to return again and again.  And every time I was there, I would lose myself in the world that is the Moulin Rouge! And now that I have had the opportunity to include it in my own DVD collection it has not left my player for very long.I have been a fan of Luhrmann's since I had the opportunity to watch "Strictly Ballroom" and that in turn led me to see "Romeo + Juliet" But after watching "Moulin Rouge!", I am convinced that this man is a genius. The costumes and the set design compliment his vision of Paris at the turn of the century.  Plus his choice of the colours, the lighting and the shading, highlight or accent the emotions and the drama of each scene as they unfold.And where to begin with the score?  To hear modern songs sung in the style of a "rock opera" just absolutely blew my mind.  Your senses will soar every time a character breaks out in song.  The medleys are inspiring and you could see that each actor put himself/herself on the line to perform the numbers.  Their dedication is evident, and makes the songs more powerful and wonderful. The chance they all took to sing with such emotion and strength, is something to admire and be amazed by. And don't worry, the choreography is not out done by the music, rather it's on equal ground.  The dance sequences are absolutely magical and tell a story itself.
If you take a step back to just lose yourself in the movie, you will have a moment of clarity and fully understand what Luhrmann is all about.  The vastness that is his imagination is captured in all of the elements that make up the masterpiece that is the Moulin Rouge!But this film would not have been as brilliant or so inspiring if it wasn't for the cast, and especially Nicole Kidman and Ewan McGregor.  They were so real that the audience could not help but feel what the two forbidden lovers felt, and saw what they saw.  The talent that these two possess is unlimited and they definitely gave Satine and Christian the depth and development that they richly deserved.If you dismissed "Moulin Rouge!" the first time around, don't pass it up on your next opportunity.  This is definitely a movie that will leave you breathless by the time the curtain closes.  And you will want to experience that intensity all over again.

ohhh but it is sooo "original" and "one-of-a-kind", is what I heard and what i read.. allow me to clarify the situation.. the creators of this film obviously possess some talent.. and lots of money..but! every aspect of this film is completely annoying.. the characters, the set, the music,the editing.... ect ect.. made me sick to watch it

Review title: couldn't believe two hours could be so long!
Review_body: I couldn't believe two hours could be so long. I kept waiting and waiting for the movie to end. From the first ten minutes it was downhill and it kept going downhill. Everything but the kitchen sink - from Nature Boy to Camille. Nothing original anywhere. Jim Broadbent was hideously miscast and the whole movie looked like a bad acid trip from the 60's. No wonder the musical is dead.

Wow! This film gets better every time I see it. I think women will like this movie more than men.  You certainly have to appreciate music to really enjoy this film.  I for one was amazed when I realized both Nicole Kidman and Ewan MacGregor sang their own songs.  Much to my surprise, they EXCELLED at it! Kidman sizzles as Satine! MacGregor additionally is a Huge talent(ha ha) and shouldn't be overlooked.  His voice dazzles me.  I love Ewan's character Christian and his "anything is possible with love" approach!  Nicole does a marvelous job with transforming Satine from a call girl to a woman in love after Christian sings "Your Song" to her.  Her entire demeanor changes after this and from that point on I am hooked!  This scene is very funny as she tries to hide Christian from The Duke.  Baz Luhrmann does a fantastic job with this movie!  This movie will make you laugh and cry.  I recommend watching this movie more than once as I notice something new every time. I have to tell you that this is one of the most entertaining movies that I have seen in awhile. Enjoy!

When this movie first came out I was not interested at all, but then I watched it the other night on PPV (nothing better to do) I was totally BLOWN AWAY!!!  I laughed till my guts ached, I cried (I sobbed!!) and I watched it again the next night!  Fantastic!  Ewan McGregor was marvellous! I want more.

This is no longer just a movie, it's an addiction.  It seems impossible to get tired of this movie, with all its amazing momentum, lush color, and unique vision.  The music pulls you in, and everything else keeps you coming back.  Watch it once to be amazed, and again to appreciate.  I do acknowledge that this movie may not be for everyone, but I do think that it deserves to be seen for more than a novelty.  It deserves to be appreciated for the achievement it is.  WATCH IT, LOVE IT.

For those who think of this film as a disaster, do not have any sense of art.  It is just like those people who do not understand what is so intriguing about a dark hard to see image on canvas, you have no understanding.  Ah yet people are entitled to their own opinions, my request is to sit down and think.  Put yourself in the place of that particular person.  The film was nothing less than extraordinary, superb, spectacular spectacular.  Never will you ever see a film quit like this.  I must say I was taken back at first, but yet I watched on and after it made me think. Never have I seen two actors draw you into a film like these two did. Never have I felt as if I was personally there and felt their pain along with their love.  I've watched it over and over again, only to find out more about the film.  This is and will be one of the greatest films made.  No film can make you laugh and cry the way this one can.  Do not watch the film for pure entertainment; watch the film to be put into the film.  It almost makes you feel as if you can not live your life locked away... you never know when your life could be taken next, it makes you appreciate people and loved ones more, especially significant others... my request is to sit down watch it and be involved, then you'll understand why those who love the film love it.

Moulin Rouge took my breath away and left me wanting more! A love story so tender yet filled with excitement. The voices of Nicole Kidman and Ewan McGregor reach out and caress your soul.I felt as though I were in the audience of a 'spectacular' stage production! Absolutely stunning! A must see for any Musical fan, I find myself humming the songs since watching it a week ago.The Sound of Music has been replaced by Moulin Rouge as my favourite movie of all time!

Review title: I Might Not Be Musically Inclined But.
Review_body:
I am going to compare `Moulin Rouge' with `Shakespeare In Love' because both of the movies are about a struggling young man and a stunning(and stunningly skinny) beauty sought by a wealthy and callous other man. Both movies are about the love between a writer and a performer within a play. And both movies represent young love with physical passion and sexy young stars.  I admit, the movies cannot be compared in movie making ability, because the styles are so different (MR is more creative visually and stylistically, but SIL is more creative with language, and incorporating-and changing history), but they can be compared on their representations of love.  SIL actually is better at showing true love than MR.  SIL's love affair makes MR's look like over-dramatic puppy love.First, the scenes between Christian and Satine in MR don't display as much love on a intellectual-as well as physical level-as the scenes between Viola and Shakespeare.  Viola's intellect is comparable to Shakespeare's. Viola is actually more realistic than Shakespeare. She realizes-before him-that she can cherish what she has with Shakespeare forever, but must marry Wessex in order to allow Shakespeare to continue to create what they both love-plays. Indeed, their love is based on a greater love. In MR, Christian seems somewhat educated, but Satine doesn't even realize that coughing up blood means you are going to die-especially without treatment.  Not that Viola and Shakespeare give the impression of intertwined souls, but Christian and Satine just seemed like merely horn dogs who substitute dramatic posturing for love and still think it's the same thing.  Viola and Shakespeare really cared about the play they were creating; they truly wanted to create something together that other people would truly care about.  Christian and Satine created a half-baked play to bolster Satine's career and protect their affair from the duke's immense `intellect.'  Both Christian and Shakespeare were on deadlines but Shakespeare actually cared what he was writing about.I guess one could argue that Christian and Satine shared a love for the Moulin Rouge, since they were only shown to love another within the vicinity of the Moulin Rouge.  But that means that Viola and Shakespeare's love was even more varied. They not only love each other in the playhouse and Viola's bedroom, but outside a church and beside a river.  They did not need a certain surrounding to support their love. Shakespeare didn't care if Viola looked like a woman when he kissed her either.  That either shows true love-or Shakespeare was really horny or kinky or both.
Another argument is that love cannot include jealousy.  The Bible does mention that love is not envious.  Shakespeare is never jealous when Viola is involved. (He is only jealous of Marlowe.) He knows she loves him and not Wessex.  What says more about love than when a person trusts the person they love enough not to be jealous?  In MR though, Christian gets jealous of the Duke because he doesn't trust Satine's love for him.  (Which is incredibly stupid of him because why would Satine even like a dolt like the Duke? Maybe Christian and Satine are an intellectual match after all.)Another thing-Viola wanted to act because she loved it. She didn't even care about the recognition because she acted under the name of Thomas Kent. Satine on the other hand, wanted to act to be a `star.'  Which character shows more true love and passion?  (This argument assumes people think passion for oneself is not as noble as passion for creativity and other people.)

What I found most offensive about this film (besides the grotesque faces jumping at me every two seconds, and the icey-chill of that overrated Nicole Kidman) was the way they portrayed Toulouse-Lautrec. If you know anything of the artist, and then see the beautiful portrayal of him in "Moulin Rouge" (the 1952 version) by Jose Ferrer, you can't help but be offended by this new version presenting him as a grinning, hyper, bouncing munchkin who's meant to be a mere sidekick to the mediocre main characters.

Review title: very brave. very beautiful to look at. acting's not too bad.
Review_body: I can't remember much of my first viewing of this film - only that I was dead to the world outside of "Moulin Rouge", had some kind of goofy smile plastered on my face all the way through and that my head was reeling by the end. I had come, after steeling myself for disappointment, to be pleasantly surprised and moved - not by the plot or acting, it must be admitted, but by the sheer visual impact of the film and the evident enthusiasm with which it was made. It's a gutsy production, and I admired baz for taking it on. It was not until later viewings (when I finally had room in my brain to process something other than the intoxicating sets, costumes and songs) that I began to appreciate the acting and the plot. Kidman's performance, in particular, had left me strangely cold after the first viewing, while I found McGregor adorable in the wide-eyed innocent role. It is only later, when I finally became familiar with the character of Satine, that I realised Kidman actually turns out a better, more delicate and subtle performance than McGregor. Her character is far more complex and underneath the surface, far more intense, and must have been a greater challenge. Satine is Christian's first love - he will eventually move on. But for Satine, more world-weary, Christian is her first, last, and only chance at living a life with love. All her emotion is invested in this relationship - it is her key to freedom. So, while the plot is simple, classic (and on first viewing appears cliched), it is still a powerful story, pulled off by some pretty decent performances from its actors. After watching the film a few times, you realise that a more complex or even more unfamiliar plot would have made the whole thing into a REAL mess - it would have been too much to juggle and sustain along with all the stylistic elements which, let's face it, make the movie. 1(for plot) +3 (for acting) +5 (for creativity and courage to try something fresh and original)= 9/10
This movie is the best movie ever. It makes me happy to see a movie that really uses art when making film. This doesn't happen too often, so that's what makes it so special. Moulin Rouge rocks!!

This movie was amazing. From the frist seconds to the last scene I was hooked. I was a fan for Baz before this with his films "Strictly Ballroom" and "Romeo and Juliet" and this is just iceing on the cake of his red curtain. I can't wait until "Rent" comes out later this year. In my oppinion, Nicole should have won best actress hands down, and Moulin Rouge should have won best picture. If you hate this movie, your eathier to blind to see the magnificent talent put into it, or your just an idiot who doesn't understand the story line.

This film has to be one of the most amazing, ambitious and beautiful films ever made. It captures the essence of a Red Curtain Production, and splashes it onto screen in dazzling, jaw-dropping fashion. The actor's talents and hard work is seen easily in this film, and director Baz Luhrmann has proved to be one of the most influential and creative filmmakers of his generation. Someone with so much vision could easily be called a genius, and it is disheartening to see that he was not nominated for "Best Director" by the Academy. If you have not seen this film already in theatres (which you have surely missed out), I cannot recommend it more for rental. The actors, director, everyone involved pulls you into the vivacious and vibrant world that is the Moulin Rouge, and makes the viewer never want to leave it. If the performance aspect is not quite fulfilling to one, the technical views should astonish some, with gutsy editing and the best costume, set and art direction I have seen to date. GO SEE THIS MOVIE!

Many people I heard of, think that Moulin Rouge, is a boring and stupid film... Why? I believe it is a "one of a kind" musical. The special combination of old and well-known songs but also the re-making of famous old songs is amazing! It is one of the best, if not the best, musicals I've ever seen... Nicole Kidman and Ewan McGregor are indeed very talented at singing, dancing and acting... Baz is an excellent director with a lot of talent, knowing his work pretty well.
