The story of Moulin Rouge begins with a despaired young man, Christian, typing at his typewriter, alone in a dark, shabby apartment he clicks away the tragedy that the audience is about to watch. Flashing back he runs into others in his building he is convinced to write a play for the famous Moulin Rouge, a nightclub in Paris. There he is mesmerized by Satine, the star of the show, and that night they begin their elusive love affair that would eventually bring down the walls of conventional romance. Although they attempt to keep it secret they can't hide their feelings from themselves or others around them. From this, the investor of the club, the Duke, finds out and gives Satine an ultimatum, continue to see Christian or shut down the nightclub. She makes the choice to give the writer up and star in the show one last time before leaving to marry the Duke. In the end Christian cannot take that the love of his life abandons him for fame and confronts her on opening night. Face to face with him Satine can no longer keep up the charade, she confesses that she was coerced by the evil Duke and falls into Christian's arms as the curtain drops. But, this is the point where a happy ending turns to tragedy. Satine, having consumption, dies there as he holds her tightly. In the end we relay back to the old broken apartment and the final thoughts of the man, heartbroken, alone and depressed from losing the only first love he has ever known.Obviously my short synopsis doesn't give the extraordinary value that this plot line deserves. The story flows very well and feels complete in the end. There are only a few questions or plot holes but they don't take away from the main story. Stunningly the feature is completed in only 127 minutes, which is typical for a musical and not long at all. Usually sitting in a movie for 2 hours can be daunting but with such a compelling fun story it doesn't feel like a task. No matter how many times I watch it, which is probably close to 50, I still get thrown for a loop with the ending. I love watching every scene and seeing the story unfold time after time. Something else I enjoy a lot from this film is the time period. Set in the middle of the Bohemian Revolution in 1899 Paris, France it takes you back to a time where art, freedom, love and beauty brought together a beggared society just trying to find their place in the world. It is very accurate towards that era and the production team worked very hard to bring it together. Although they filmed most of it in a studio the set they built represented what the real Moulin Rouge would have been like in 1899. To mimic the lifestyle they placed the time at night, which was when most of the indigent, lowlife traversed. They kept the inside of the Moulin Rouge bright and glowing to show that it was the main focus and a sort of "saving grace" for the vagabonds that ventured there. They bring to life its high point just before it burnt down in 1915.Not only is the setting fantastic, the costumes live up to the same standards. With a variety of time period garments such as can-can dancer dresses, men's coattail suits with top hats and elegant bustled dresses, it brings an attraction and as the French would say gena sa qua. Each costume is unique, having its own personality and I really love finding little details that I missed the previous time, there's always something new to see. You can tell that a lot of research and work went into creating these time pieces.Moulin Rouge brings together not only an original score but a compilation of songs from well-known artist. Musicians such as David Bowie, U2, The Beatles, and Elton John lend their poetic lyrics to invoke heartfelt emotion into the story. The majority of the songs are very meaningful and pull the audience into the moment. But not all are like that, the rest are catchy and exciting, such as "Lady Marmalade" and "Spectacular Spectacular", they make you want to get up and dance. My favorite would have to be "Roxanne". There is not one cast member that I don't believe fits the part they played. Besides being my favorite actor, Ewan McGregor, who plays Christian, was picked over top actors such as Leo DiCaprio and Heath Ledger. His counterpart, Nicole Kidman, who is coincidently my favorite female actress, won the Golden Globe for best actress for her work in this film.The most important thing I took from this movie is the metaphor that it engrafts. This story is about freedom, beauty, truth and most relevantlove. Love is the strongest motif and is represented through the whole film. The relationship between Christian and Satine symbolizes such a pure and true love that anyone should aspire to. It is also about overcoming all obstacles and living your dreams. The freedom to not only be with who you want but to not be trapped by the confines of what society says you should be.A movie with such symbolism is not well received by all. I believe that these few who look down upon it are not willing nor see the message that is lain before them. I hope that whoever sees this takes into their heart the deeper meaning. It's not just about how well the costumes are made or what actors play in it, it's about what someone takes away from it at the end and uses to influence their own life. Moulin Rouge is one of the greatest movies I have seen in my time and I feel honored to have discovered it and its true value to the world.

Review title: I don't like musicals but I looooove this film
Review_body: I din't see this film till very recently because I'm not a fan of musicals. But a friend convinced me to give it a chance and I'm real glad I did. The film is visually stunning. It feels as though you are watching everything happen within a big, richly decorated Christmas tree covered in fairy-lights :-) The music isn't originally written for the film, but who cares. The tracks that are used, their arrangement and blending with the screen visuals is absolutely fantastic. As for Kidman and McGregor, fair play to them. They can both sing and have really good voices. Anyway......great film, which is going to be right up you're street if you like sparkling visual feasts and good music. I wonder how many other people who thought they didn't like musicals watched this film and suddenly realised what they'd been missing......i know I did LOL.

I watched this for the first time a couple of years ago after turning it off after about 10 minutes and I've only just recently tried to watch it again - now I love it! :-) At first it's a little fast paced and it's definitely something that grows on you in time, the more you watch it and get included into the sad yet beautiful story of the Moulin Rouge! Ewan McGregor's performance in this is super and he has such a lovely voice. You get attached to the characters quickly and get sent on an emotional roller- coaster which may or may not result in tears - it did for me! Overall, it's amazing, the storyline, the cast, the imagination, the songs!The show must go on :-)

I love this movie so much!It's great!Entertaining,interesting and touching!Very touching!Especially the end,when Satine dies!It just makes me cry each and every time I watch it!!!Nicole Kidman,the best actress on the world like she is,makes this movie even better!She has such a beautiful voice!Hard to believe it's hers,but it really is!!!She's so talented!Can't remember a single bad movie of hers!She's #1!!! Moulin Rouge Soundtrack is also very good!!!This is one of those movies there's nothing bad about!The Nicole's acting is genius(like always!!!)and script and soundtrack and everything is just great!!!!!!!It's really,really good movie!!!!If you like Nicole Kidman,there's no way you won't like this movie!:)

I saw this movie on a bus. Of course the impact with watching movies on a bus isn't as big as watching it at home. But I actually liked it. I'll admit I joked about it during and after the movie, but I always do that with movies.I didn't expect I was going to like it, I mean it's a lovestory mixed with music. Not really my kind of thing, but for some reason this movie gripped me. Ewan and Nicole really shine. As well as the other actors. The chaotic filming at times didn't feel misplaced at all. I also didn't find any weak songs, they al fit the scene perfectly and are sang excellent. To be honest: I didn't find any flaws.Definitely a must-see if you ask me. Even if it's not your kind of genre

This is the greatest film I have seen for a long time. The story is wonderful and the characters are fantastic and beautifully played. Even if you're not a fan of musicals, I would recommend this film to you. I cannot imagine the roles of Satine and Christian being played by any other actors as they are both magnificent. Also, all the songs are sung by the actors themselves, which is even better! The way modern songs are used and put together, especially in Elephant Love Song Medley, is brilliant. This film has everything: romance, comedy, tragedy and music. I truly cannot say a bad word about it. Please please watch it, you will not be disappointed!!!

My friend got me to watch this film and my first thought was that it was going to be rubbish.....but this film is the most fantastic film i have ever seen, pure genius! There is nothing in this film that i don't like. I enjoyed it from start to finish. Ewan Mcgregor and Nicole Kidman were excellent in this film. I don't think there could have been any other actor/actress who had such chemistry to star in this film. Also the songs are amazing. I didn't realise that both were such good singers, so was very impressed when i first watched it. Totally brilliant. I would recommend this movie to anyone who likes a little bit of comedy, drama and good songs. My number one film. :)

from the first moment i saw this film, i loved it, i loved the characters, the songs, the acting is spot on, the editing was perfect, it started great and finished great. i cant understand why some people do not like it. the film even makes you want to get up move and sing along, which( i no its a bit sad) i do. you can see the real connection between Satine and Christian which in some romance films is quite rare. i often get really angry at the duke and his 'shananigans'. i cry every time i see the end which is often rare because i cant hold it in. i wish that Satine didn't die in the end however thats life. great work Baz.

I loved Moulin Rouge!! I am a university student studying film and it is one of my all time favourites, along with Romeo & Juliet (also by Baz Luhrmann) then there is Trainspotting, a classic, and Amores Perros and finally (It may be sad but I love its predictability) Scream. Many of you may think it's the saddest film ever but I don't care, I love it. Moulin Rouge is at the top of my list, the music, the colours, the actors, all of it, I have no complaints at all. Ewan McGregor has an amazing voice and is pretty yummy too. One of my favourite things is the Elephant Love Medley (yes I am that sad I have the soundtrack) it has so many songs in it that usually I wouldn't listen to but in Moulin Rouge, it works brilliantly. Also Exan McGregor's rendition of Your Song by Elton John is fabulous, absolutely fabulous. Moulin Rouge is a classic film, with many typical aspects of romantic films, with a twist that makes it even better.

I think this movie is the most wonderful display of love and heartbreak. The music is incredible and the acting is top notch. I love the way this movie presents itself. Sure i like movies like kill bill and harold and kumar go to white castle, but this will surely touch you even if you've felt the slightest bit in love before.I cant believe anyone would dislike this movie. its unlike any movie ever made. i think this is a must see movie. This is one of my favorite movies. I'll never get tired of watching this movie. anyone that wants to discuss this message me on aim at nycex360. !!!! 111 222 333 444 555 666 777 888 999

Review title: the best movie i have ever seen
Review_body: This film is a feast for the senses. While at first the film's edgy, dramatic touch may be a bit daunting, give this movie ten minutes and you will be sucked in. There is an infectious humour and reality in this film. You almost feel like you are in the room, and it is a private show for you. As a music lover, the songs in this blew me away. Who would of known that Ewan McGregor and Nicole Kidman had such amazing voices? The medleys just blew me away. All the songs really work together better than some may have thought. I cannot stop watching this film, and now I know almost every single word. It does not get old and is still exciting. You also see things that you didn't see the previous time. This is an exceptional film and is my all-time favourite film.

This movie was a colossal disappointment for me. I enjoyed Romeo + Juliet tremendously and I really like Ewan McGregor and Nicole Kidman, so this seemed like a can't miss.Unfortunately you could dive feet first into a puddle of this movie and not even get your socks wet. All the dialogue was contrived to find meaningful poetic snippets of great songs and compile them into one fluid love story. The idea has merit, but the execution was all wrong. The lines didn't tie together well and totally lacked the emotion of the songs themselves. This left little to no character development and almost no emotional attachments which should be important to a "tragic love story." Another problem I have is that a lot of the mystery is taken away in the opening monologue, not that that would be enough to wreck a movie, but in this case, there is no reason for it. So with the ending already decided you look to the actors to hold your interest and find yourself being even further let down. You hope the dialogue can at least carry some interest but that dies quickly too. I can't believe the hype for this movie, but then, I can't believe Britney Spears has sold millions of albums either. You can't trust the general public.The filming, set-design and costumes are the only reason this film received any stars at all in my book. Brilliant colors, multiple crazy angles/cuts and wild sets however weren't enough to hold any interest.I describe this movie as being liked by people that THINK they're artistic and creative but truly have no depth.

I was recently invited to a movie night at my friends house, and when I heard we were going to watch Moulin Rouge I was horrified."A musical?" I thought, "don't make me gag." But as I started watching the movie, I realized how tragic the story really was. After the initial laughter and dancing, I began to feel a stirring behind my eyes as I watched true love being played out in a heart-breaking manner.Ewan McGregor was spectacular in this film, bringing just the right amount of sensitivity to a very hard role to play. He managed to come off as both jealous and heart-broken when Satine goes to sleep with the Duke, which I find would be very hard to pull off.But the true star of this movie is undoubtedly Nicole Kidman as Satine. She is sultry yet vulnerable and innocent in her role, and she was the one that truly made me start to tear up. The expressions she went through as she learned she was dying were subtle yet so emotionally powerful.The only complaint I have about this film, is that they seem to love piling tragic incidents on top of one another without leaving us room for a breather.It goes from hide love, love is found out, love is killed off, love is regained, love is killed off again, love is regained again, love is killed off again, love is regained, and then finally to love is gone when Satine dies.It seems to go a bit too fast, but that doesn't hinder the story very much. The ending is still just as tragic and moving.I'd recommend this story to just about anyone...well, anyone but insensitive idiots with the emotional range of a spoon. :3

When I rented Moulin Rouge I did not realize at all how much i would grow attached to this movie. It may not be to everyone's liking but people should give it a chance...I did and it really connected with me.First, the music and dance in this movie was absolutely mind blowing. It was stunning to see the actors and actresses dance and sing like they did. The dance numbers were shocking ,but in a good way. The dances are so unique and stunning to look at, I got lost in them!The chemistry between Ewan McGregor and Nicole Kidman was a real treat because it is such a rare thing for two people to be perfect like this in a role. Their acting skills really stand out in this movie, when they are in a scene with each other you can tell what they are feeling by just looking in their eyes. The sound of their voices really surprised me. I had no idea Nicole Kidman had such a beautiful voice. When Ewan sings for the first time his voice is so powerful and beautiful you get lost in it. I love every minute of it when they sing to each other... i get so emotional. I cant stop watching Moulin Rouge...I find the love story so entrapping...it gets to me every time, especially the emotion Ewan puts into his role...or when he starts to cry at the end...I cry too. I cant get over his acting because it makes me feel like it is happening to me. Every time i watch this movie i cry...but i don't mind because it truly hold all the qualities of a great movie. I no some people don't like this movie at all...but for me at least it will ALWAYS be in my favorites collection---I cant stop watching it!My two favorite lines/ quotes from the movie: 1) "My gift is my song...and this ones for you" 2) "The greatest thing you'll ever learn is to love, and be loved in return"

This film is a crazy spontaneous mix! It's disorganized, wild and colorful. I've never seen such a spectacular mix of drama, comedy, tragedy! Never seen anything like it in my life! The music leaves you breathless. The costumes are just amazing, the decorations are impeccable and the plot line is beautiful.I was impressed by the actors. I never knew Nicole Kidman can sing...Like that! McGregor and Kidman had beautiful, amazing chemistry on screen. No one could have done it better. That was some of the best acting I've ever seen. Amazing talent! This is an excellent movie about the most beautiful feeling in the world-true love. It's not a sweet chick-flick for teenage girls, it's a tragic masterpiece!

I loved this movie. The theme of the movie is clearly evident when the movie starts with Ewan Mcgregor typing "the greatest thing of all is to love and be loved in return". That line encapsulates all that the movie wants to emphasize and wants the audience to take with them. The breathtaking scenes with multitude of colors add to the vibrant nature of the movie. Nicole Kidman's exceptional acting is simply mind blowing. The themes of love, true love and the joy of loving are prominent and the Nicole-Ewan on-screen pair is perfect. The chemistry between them is just pure magic. This movie is fantabulous. The songs are not the usual time-fillers or anything but are appropriate and apt. Although against the norms of Hollywood, this movie is a beautiful piece showcasing artistic adroitness. A must watch for all who believe in Truth, beauty, freedom and love.

I first came about this movie when I was a senior in high school. My friends and I would watch this movie and we would rejoice when Christian and Satine would finally have that first kiss and we bawled like babies when Satine died.This is one of my most favorite movies ever made. I never knew until I watched this movie that Ewan Mcgregor and Nicole Kidman were such wonderful musicians.This movie captures you and holds you captive through the opening score to the last sob. I love, love, love this movie. Anyone looking for a good romance story with laughter and tears should go out and rent this movie Immediately!!!!

Review title: One of the best movies ever.
Review_body: I think that Moulin Rouge! has everything you could want:you can laugh,you can cry...All the performances are unbelievable but I have to say that John Leguizamo is the best.The good thing about this movie is that if you enjoy music movies you will love this one and if you do not like music movies,you will love it too.My favorite scene is the one that goes by inside the elephant when Christian and Satine sing all those "silly love songs",specially when they sing the bodyguard song.I also enjoyed Roxanne's tango(why does my heart cry?that is perfection)with that double scene thing.I do not know what more I can say to convince you all to see this movie,so I'll just say that the greatest thing you'll ever learn is just to love and beloved in return.

...this is basically for people who have already seen it......heres what i think about the characters......ewan MacGregor was amazing. i almost fell out of my seat in awe after i nearly peed my pants. i had no idea that he could sing! how wonderful life is, now that hes in the world!......nicole kid mans acting was superb, but i don't understand why she had to be singing. who said that she could sing. she is almost always off key, and her squeaker voice really annoyed me and my friends. who'd she have to sleep with to get that role? I'm glad she wasn't cast in the role as Ula in the producers......that midget guy! i don't know if you've noticed but in every single movie there is the same guy. he is famous in Hollywood without the name. every single movie that has a midget in it is played by that guy. i swear hes gonna be famous in 10 years and were all gonna be like, "hey your that freak from Molina rouge"......the duke disappointed me, he was way too nice...so thank you for reading my comments

Words to describe this movie; happy, tragic, fun, surprise, beauty, song, love! If you're looking for a movie that you can't take your eyes off of, this is it! "Do you believe in truth, beauty, freedom, love?" "Above all things I believe in love." ~ Quotes from Toulouse and Christian.Treat yourself and someone you love to a night in with this powerful love story!

I loved the whole movie! mostly *Ewan McGregor cough cough*. I loved how interesting the filming was, its really artistic. I love when in some of the music scenes it turns in to a kind of magical fantasy sorta thing. All the music in it is so addicting! I have the sound track and don't want to stop listening to it. Christine is so beautiful! And Satine is pretty... I wanted to be her. I love the ending scene! It is so beautifully done, as is the rest of the movie. They do the characters so well that you hate them, or love them, and the way the look helps a lot. The costumes were awesome, I liked all costumes, they really brought out the setting and time. It draws you in to the crazy time of Paris in the 1900's It make you laugh and cry, love it, I'd give it an 12 out of 10. must see, if you ask me.

Before i begin...i would just like to say, anyone who thinks this movie is bad or stupid, i have one thing to say to you...your just mad because you don't understand the complete beauty of this spectacular movie because someone in your life either disappointed you or you had a bad childhood so you couldn't possably love anyhting so your just a poor sport....anyway! I saw this movie at least 35 times literally! Its my favorite movie of all time! Perfect actors and actresses for each character! simply extraordinary! I can quote anything from the movie. i know all the words to the songs. (the main songs) I'm so happy i saw this movie in the first place. My sister bought it and liked it (she thought it was OK) then i saw it when she was at a friends house, and it sounds so stupid, but it changed my life forever... this movie introduced me to Ewan McGregor and when i found out that him and one of my favorite actresses (Nicole Kidman) sang all there songs themselves. i was blown away! Even after I've seen it over 35 times, its still the best movie! i can watch it over and over and over again! and I'm never bored! I'm not saying that I'm the movies "bigest fan" or whatever, I'm just saying that i love it! In fact! ill watch it right now! see ya on the flip side! so my rating for this movie is a perfect 10!!! excellent forever and always.

Review title: A movie too good for words!
Review_body: Love is not a strong enough word for how I feel about this movie! In fact, I don't think that there is a word for how much I adore this movie! I can watch it over and over and never tire of it! I make all of my friends watch it, I even made my older brother watch it! And they've all liked it a lot. Even if you HATE chick flicks, musicals, or movies that contain prostitutes, watch it. I think you'll be surprised at what a wonderful film it is! It's a work of art! A beautiful love story, a charming comedy, and a ground breaking musical! It provides universal appeal. I completely loved Ewan McGregor in it! He was just SO adorable! And I didn't like Nicole Kidman AT ALL before I saw this movie. I wouldn't say that I'm now her biggest fan, but I like her much better.

The first time I watched this film I was mesmerised.
It's a great film for people who love romance and musicals.
I can watch this film over again and again.
The songs are fantastic and ewan mcgregor sings like an angel.

This is the best musical movie I have ever seen. The lyrics are to die for! The cast acts and sings and dances amazingly. Nicole Kidman is one of the best actress in this film. Her voice is amazing.This is a must see! Its just totally great!The music is splended! The best musical I have ever seen. Every time I wacth it I cry!It is an unpredictable love story. No Laws. "No Matter where ever we are no matter how hard it gets just remember I will always love you. And we will always have love for each other." The music form this movie is darling! If It was sung to me I would be like awwwhh<3

Review title: The parallels between Moulin Rouge and Children of Paradise
Review_body: Two movies that sit near the top of my all-time list are "Moulin Rouge" and the French movie, "Children of Paradise". The parallels between the two movies are beyond coincidence."Children of Paradise" was released in 1946 after WWII as two movies made out of one, primarily because of its extreme length. It was made during the Nazi occupation in France in 1945, and was set on the Boulevard of Crime in Paris, in 1820. Many of the actors were Nazi collaborators, because the Germans were oversaw the production of the movie. The French who made the movie were mostly unfriendly to the Germans so many of the actors were also members of the resistance.The two main characters, like the two main characters in "Moulin Rouge", include a timid, shy artist, Baptiste, and a prostitute, Garance. She becomes an actress by the direct influence of the shy artist. As the movie develops the courtesan ends up as a courtesan to a Duke, even though she is in love with the shy artist.Finally Garance rejects the Duke, in this case many years later, and goes back to the artist. They finally consummate their love, but then are tragically torn apart, once more.As with Satine in "Moulin Rouge", at least two other men are in love with the courtesan, Garance, and have their lives dramatically changed because of their attraction and commitment to her. Arletty, the actress who played Garance, was banned from French cinema for 10 years after the war because she was judged a Nazi collaborator. She had a relationship with a Nazi Colonel during the war. While the plots of the two movies a not exactly the same, the flavor of the movies are particularly similar. Both are set in front of and behind the stage. The action within the scenes in both movies is complex and diverse, as in a non-stop carnival. Dancers and acrobats, aristocrats and beggars fill the stages of both movies in wild celebration. Beneath the surface, within the story lines, deceit and jealousy are played with a richness seldom seen in film.Truth, beauty, freedom and love are questioned and examined, and finally, perhaps, found to be fleeting, at best.The children of Paradise lived 79 years before the children of the Revolution, yet they lived in the same place, lived the life of the theater and suffered the same agony of love. "Children of Paradise" is considered by many as the best film ever made in France. In 1947 it was nominated for "Best Writing, Original Screenplay" by the Acedamy Awards.
